Good for casual dinner or date night.PARKING (1/5):Street parking is atrocious. During a weekday you can find parking but all of it is paid. I imagine on weekends it's worse.TAKEAWAYS:I liked Hui Xou Tiang and it's nice to have a spot specifically for dumplings! The main downside is parking.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Terrible parking since it's right next to Hollywood.The sign and restaurant is semi covered by a tree so makes it hard to notice from the street.Parking at a nearby garage was a flat $20 (Sept 2023)Lots of noodles/wrapping so it fills you up.I liked the thickness and chew of the noodles, would opt for a sauce that had more of a kick/flavor than the pork.Dumplings were all pretty good - liked the pork hui tou the best. Spicy dumplings taste average, beef hui tou was too dense and meaty.Lamb skewers were ridiculously tender, delish, not gamey at all. Best I've had in a long time.Coming back for the beef skewers and pork hui tou.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great option for a pre-show dinner at the Pantages. Great food, awesome staff and casual vibe!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Would rate higher than 5 starts if I could! I've been back a few times and it never disappoints, all the dishes I've tried are phenomenal- I especially love the spicy pork wontons and beef noodle soup! A little bit on the spicy side with their house chili oil which makes it even better! Food always comes fairly quick, and there's never a wait when I do go. It's small but comfortable inside, there's also a full bar! I also recommend trying their teas, it comes in a glass teapot that's perfect to share with your party. Parking is a bit limited since it is in Hollywood so definitely be prepared to park on the street. Hui Tou's become one of my favorite restaurants in LA and y'all should definitely check it out!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This place smells soooooo bad. Smells like luoshifen. I love luoshifen, but hate the smell remain in room. Food were ok.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came soon after they opened for dinner on a weekday and it was pretty dead. I think this place is definitely more of a late-night dinner spot. The staff was super friendly and guided us through the menu. There's few veggie options, it's mainly pork and beef - just something to keep in mind. We ordered three different types of dumplings, the hui tou and xiao long bao being our favorites. Everything was very good, but I wasn't super wowed by anything (except the hui tou!). I would come back again later in the evening when it's more lively.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I've been craving dumplings ever since coming back from Asia. I'm in the San Fernando Valley, so I figured this would be close enough. IF ANYONE CAN RECOMMEND A VEGETARIAN DUMPLING PLACE IN THE SFV, please let me know.Parking: you're in the heart of Hollywood, so you'll most likely cruise the block looking for street parking. The closest parking lot was trying to charge me $20 to park there for one hour. NO THANKS. On a Saturday, around dinner time, I found parking a couple blocks down. Not a huge deal for me, I love to walk.Onto the food: I love that their menu isn't overwhelmingCHICKEN POTSTICKERS: yummy, so yummy that I got a second round of theseVEGETARIAN DUMPLINGS: simple flavor, but tastyCUCUMBER SALAD: meh appetizer. I wouldn't get this again. It doesn't have any unique flavor to it. I could replicate this by chopping some cucumbers at home.SESAME NOODLES: wish I would've read other reviews about these noodles. Super bland. WOULDN'T RECOMMEND. Even adding soy sauce and chili oil didn't help. Sesame flavor was quite muted.Service: good, friendly staffOverall, I'd return for the dumplings, potstickers, and perhaps try a new appetizer and noodle.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Delivery review (to be fair):Below average. Dumplings and wontons mediocre. The noodle dish was dismal. Unremarkable flavors...but at least fresh ingredients.This experience does not entice me to visit the physical location.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Cute ambiance... food was lacking in flavor. You could just tell it wasn't made with love (almost seemed like frozen dumplings). Service was wonderful.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Really yummy Chinese food! The spicy pork wontons were great about an 8.5/10 and the Noodle dishes are really great portioned! Actually everything portion wise they show lots of love. I think the noodles are great but there's one flavor missing. I still keep going back tho so it's still very good!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: dani is the best server i ever hadbread pudding taste so good, service was quick & she kept peeking over to see if we need help, place is a vibe too
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Amazing staff and food first timers at this place and I recommend the bread pudding for sure.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Service impeccable- we had another server, WILLiAM who was professional, knowledgeable, and extremely attentive.  We ordered the onions rings, bacon jams fries, patty melt, carrot cake and bread pudding.  The bus boy had our table cleaned right after we finished our main meal, the kitchen to table waiter was so sweet. As she dropped off the fries, "she said welcome to heaven."The staff and food is the best!The staff works as the team and it really shows. Atmosphere is Halloween theme - love it!You won't regret coming here.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Rodger was an excellent server! He was attentive, professional, and made my meal exceptional!  We had sliders, onions rings, fish and chips, and patty melt. All was amazing!  We are coming back again and again.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Love their onion rings!. Service was excellent. All their hamburgers are delicious! I had the truffle burger and went back for more! Sliders are good too!Don't order their mousse cake is misleading,
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The Morrison, I need your bread pudding at least once a month.  Your portions are hefty and your service is *chefs kiss*.  By service I mean Kate and Jess', so attentive and familiar.  See you again soon at the bar soon!  :)
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The atmosphere was very lively. We loved the food. William was on point with his service.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: it was our first time here at Morrison and the food is SO amazing. our server teddy gave the BEST service and made sure we had a great first time here. we will definitely be back!! thank you teddy!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Always love coming here but just had a great experience having a large party at the Morrison! We were out on the back patio and had wonderful service from Roger all afternoon. Great food, great drinks, lovely staff!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The Morrison is perfect every time I come! Good beer! Amazing service thanks william! And the vibe is always right.  I love the holiday decorations!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Morrison is the happening place!  Great food, special and seasonal decor!  Teddy, our server, was fantastic!  Cordial and efficient.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Roger was amazing!  Helpful. Informative. Efficient!  He got our orders quickly, and serviced us with products as we requested!  Wonderfully presented and a personable person!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: I was having a very emotional day today having a family death and wanted to share a special time and have great food after the funeral. I was starving , let me tell you the food came by fast , hot and delicious. The drinks came and we got  the most amazing service  by Teddy who was very kind . Definitely had a great experience and would love to come back soon !
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Service - 5/5 quickAtmosphere - 3/5 small and crowdedFood - 5/5Everyone has to be present to be seatedI have no idea what we ordered. My friends ordered everything but it all tasted delicious esp the one they lit on fireWould come here again if in the area
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Me and my partner were visiting LA and after a long day were craving Korean food. We discovered this restaurant through tiktok and decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised and I would 100% recommend Louders as they had very nice staff and the food was excellent.We ordered the Cheese Buldak and  a yogurt flavored soju. With the cheese Buldak we got a medium spicy which wasn't too spicy, if i were to go back, i'd get spicer. Would definitely want to try the pasta next time as well. Perfect way to end the night. However, id recommend to plan accordingly as there is valet parking for a fee, and street parking that is virtually filled for blocks down. The wait was not too bad, just be prepared to stand outside while you wait to be called. The restaurant is small but has a unique charm with kpop blasting throughout the experience. I look forward to coming back!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: WORTH THE HYPE!This place is sooo good. Service was fast and food was amazing.Got the Kimchi Bacon Carbonara and it was super flavorful. We had a lot of leftover sauce so we took it home and added ramen noodles to it. HahaI will definitely be coming back.Expect a wait time though because the place is pretty small.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Good food, K-pop on big screen, very attentive waitstaff. Fun place to dine. Would come again.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Keep in mind, it's less expensive ordering in the store. This place is sooooo good! I love the street corn and the sweet garlic wings. I love the seaweed rice. This place is a gem! Parking is a little crazy in this lot. They are open real late too!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food - delicious.Love all their menu items here. I come here with friends every once in awhile and have tried a variety of menu items and they were all good! I definitely recommend here as a restaurant. I wouldn't really recommend this place as a drinking place because it is very small, there's only Valet which is always full, and the ambiance is not much of a drinking ambiance.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This hole in the wall spot was amazing!!!!! They have various flavors of Soju!! I had the fried calamari and shrimp rose pasta would definitely order again. My sister had this chicken dish with cheese that they light on fire she loved it (I don't eat chicken) everything was good including the service!!!!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The Stir-Fried Baby Octopus and Pork Belly was so good, I can handle a spice pretty well, but I prefer things to be not as spicy as what my spice limit is because for me, overly spicy things takes away from actual flavor (though I'm sure some people like to burn their mouth), we got medium (보통) spicy and it was perfect. It comes out on a stone pan thing so the rice starts to crisp up at the bottom! So generous with the octopus and pork too. We both weren't feeling that hungry, so we had enough leftover that we could each take a to-go bowl home. We also got the cajun fries (not pictured), which were light and perfectly seasoned. The service here is not remarkable, it's just your standard Korean type of service, so your server might seem cold but that's just the way it is. We went during lunch so it wasn't crowded, but I can imagine it being a lot more busy at night because they are technically a pocha at the end of the day.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Really cute restaurant! Had a variety of Korean options but they r definitely big proportions so be aware. I got the kimchi fried rice w my friend and it def filled us up! The parking lot is strange cause there is valet for that small plaza but nonetheless I'd come back again with more people to try out more food!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food: 5/5Wait: 3/5Service: 4/5Vibes: 5/5We went on a Sunday night. Got there around 7 and had to wait quite a bit before getting seated. The food also took quite a while to come out, and there was quite a bit of wait between each dish being brought out. My favorite dishes from most to least favorite were the soy garlic wings, kimchi bacon udon carbonara, stir fried pork belly, and spicy cheese rice cake. The glaze on the wings was delicious, and the chicken was fried to perfection. The pasta had a unique flavor and was tasty. The stir fried pork belly was solid. For me personally, I'd prefer if the rice cake had a bit of other things in it, like ramen or even sausages. PSA: all the dishes are kind of on the smaller size, so don't expect to leave here feeling super full! They played Kpop on the TVs the entire time I was there, which kept me entertained as I waited for the food. For parking, we parked a few streets away and just walked over, which was not a big issue for us. Overall, a good spot with tasty food but there could be a bit of wait, especially on the weekend.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I don't like leaving negative reviews on Yelp, and I don't usually engage in that. As a business owner myself, I understand the impact a casually written review can have, and I'm cautious about writing reviews. Especially in these tough economic times due to COVID-19, I want to support local businesses even more. However, I felt the need to leave a review today.In conclusion, I went alone and ended up paying $50 just for a bowl without a tip. At this price point, I could have gone to a place like M Grill and been much more satisfied. Here, it's a buffet-style system where you serve yourself and the food is cooked and brought to your table. The price is determined by weight, but why don't they tell you the price upfront? Why make you calculate it after you've already eaten? Their intentions were clear, and it left a bad taste in my mouth.To get to the point, I filled a very large plate with a little bit of everything. Since it was my first time here and my first time trying these foods, I asked the server if the amount I had was okay for one person. Her response was, "Oh, it looks like you're very hungry, hoho." My intention was simply to ask if I had taken too much for one person, not for some strange and irrelevant comment like that. But she insisted it was fine even though it was quite a lot.In the end, I filled two to-go boxes to the brim and took them home. So, I basically prepared three servings for myself. Why don't they tell you the price by weight upfront, so that the staff knows that what you're serving is too much for one person, especially for a first-time customer?The intention is very clear at this part. And why don't they ask if it's your first time? I had no idea if it was a self-serve system, and I sat there for over 10 minutes without getting any water or a menu. Later on, they realized I was a first-time customer and thought I was choosing my food from the menu. I mean, sitting alone for over 10 minutes as a first-time customer is pretty obvious, isn't it? Also, shouldn't there be at least two staff members working? One person handling cash, one in the kitchen, and one in the dining area, all while making me wait for over 10 minutes... Well, it was truly the worst dining experience I've ever had. I really, genuinely feel like I was scammed. Please don't run your business like this.And these kinds of reviews shouldn't make you feel bad; on the contrary, you should be grateful. Seriously, if I had wanted this place to fail, I wouldn't have pointed out these issues and would have just let it go under.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First time having malatang and it was a great experience!! The store is clean, fast service, and good quality ingredients. The worker was super friendly too.You pick out the ingredients and pay by weight at the register when ur done eating.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came here w my college besties for dinner on a Sunday. I am DEF coming back. We all got Mala Hong Tang and loved it so much. They also played jazz in the background lol.First, you go down an aisle of ingredients and put everything into a big bowl. I always get a lot of cabbages, bok choys, spinach, mushrooms, tofus and noodles. At the counter, I ask them to add beef brisket for an additional charge. You then choose a spice level. I got level 1.5 today just to see how it is (im going to try level 3 next time). Then, you have a seat and they cook it for you in the meantime. You pay at the end depending on the weight of the food.I was so happy when our food came out. I was initially worried that they'd just jumble up all the food and boil it all at once, but it they def have a particular order of cooking the ingredients. The taste of the food was 10/10.The only downsides are parking (valet) and there was only one person waiting the tables --but she was really nice.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Interesting noodle? Restaurant! Good for people who loves spicy noodle soup. Good pork. It's fun to pick your own favorite topping to soup.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: If you're craving malatang, this is the place to go! As you may know, you grab a bowl and fill it with all the veggies and noodles. Those go by weight so be mindful of how much you're adding. Towards the end, there are skewers but beware, you pay per skewer. When you take your bowl to the counter, they'll ask if you want to add any meat. They'll add that when they're cooking your soup so it's a fixed amount. You can get anywhere from 0 to 4 spice. The base soup has a strong peanut flavor and the more spice, the better! 1 is really minimal so I'd recommend a 2-3 if you like spicy, obviously a 4 if you want that extraaa kick.The lady who served our table was sooo sweet. She was an older woman and she explained how the whole system worked.Parking is minimal because they share spaces with at least 3-4 other stores. You can try street parking instead but make sure to read the signs.One fun fact: this restaurant was featured in a Korean TV show known to showcase hard workers in society who mastered the art of their craft (saeng hwal eh dal een)!
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Interesting concept as I don't like to venture out of my comfort zone but I felt adventurous and soupy.It is like a make your own soup noodles.You fill a bowl with vegetables and other stuff and then choose a spiciness and they give it to you in a soup or you can get it stir-fried.   They get you on the skewers at the end but the fish cakes are a must.  Option brisket for $3.99 and a decent sized portion.Not a huge fan of the noodle options on the bar (vermicelli, spaghetti) but they have Ramen noodles in packages on top which hit way better.  You can also get udon noodles at the cashier.Broth is spicy and delicious.  Definitely peanuts in it so if you have an allergy sorry bruh.  Awesome with the broth and all your veggies choices.Oddly enough the fried rice was the winner here.  Plate is $12.99 and looks so simple and easy to make, but I'll give it credit its tasty af.  Also a necessary addition to cut down on the broth once you are half way.  The Fried rice is literally spam, frozen veggies, and egg.  The real value of the price comes in the motivation of saying to yourself "man I can make this at home."  Anyways great dish to share with the table.Save your receipts and pay at the end.Valet parking $3 or good luck street parkjng5/5 great meal.  Will come again!
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My friend and I were craving mala, so we checked out this place from a quick google search. The place is clean and the ingredients also seem fresh.You grab ingredients from an open cold bar, then you go to the cashier to choose your meat option. The price is determined by weight. You can choose to have it dry style or soup style - we chose dry but in hindsight I wish we chose the broth because it felt like you were eating a lot of the chilies straight up, which was distracting.I'd also mention this place is korean-fied so the flavors would be a bit more mild than what authentic calls for (didn't get much of the numbing sensation).Overall, it was enjoyable but fell a little short of the strong mala flavor we were originally craving!
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Nice services with a wide variety of toppings to choose from. The stuffs are also so friendly. Great ambiance.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: such tasty broth! the broth is peanut based and i felt like  this flavor with the medium hot spice level 1 was perfect for me. i also tried the hot spice level 2 and felt like it was more of a numbing spice from the Sichuan pepper, which i don't really enjoy but would recommend to those who enjoy that type of spice.there are a variety of addins that you add yourself. the price of your bowl is based on weight and you can add beef brisket for an extra $3.99. my bowl was around $20~ including beef which imo was a great deal considering how much food i got! left with so much as well.we came during dinner time on a saturday and there was plenty of seating and staff was friendly.
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Honestly so so good! And such a cool concept!You enter and go to the self serve station where you grab some tongs and a stainless steel bowl. At the self service area you'll find an arrangements of different noodles, proteins like fish cake and tofu and veggies. You bring it to counter where they will weigh your food (this is what determines your meals cost) and you ask them to make it as a hot pot or a dry pot (stir fry)! Both options are tasty but personally I thought the dry pot was excellent. Super flavorful and unique.You can really not get tired of this place because you get to pick your own destiny here hahaAlso there is a valet parking lot. And if you know anything about parking in ktown, that alone is worth 5 stars am I right or amirite
Address: 425 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I recently hosted a party at The Edmon, and I couldn't be happier with the experience. I had planned this event a month in advance, and from the moment I reached out to book, Francois and his team made the entire process incredibly seamless. They were accommodating, attentive, and made sure every detail was taken care of.One of the highlights of our evening was having the entire outdoor area reserved for our party. It provided plenty of space and comfortable seating for our group of 30 guests. Talia, our host for the evening, was an absolute pleasure. She was attentive, friendly, and made sure everyone had a great time.Our overall experience at The Edmon was exceptional, and we'll definitely be returning in the future. Thanks to Francois, Talia, and the entire team for making our party a memorable one!Big plus is there's a parking lot in the back!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Jaron was wonderful and as a mixologist he worked hard to make sure each cocktail was made special all while keeping a smile on his face : it's a great happy hour from 4-7pm every single day! I ordered the roasted little gem Ceaser salad and think you should too! It's art deco design and inspiration is top notch and so is it's beautiful vibe! I'm glad your part of my Hollywood story!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Love the Kumamoto oysters! Easy outdoor ambiance, great staff love that they remember you!!!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Cool spot. Good music. Nice cocktails. Food is just fine. Mellow on the night we went.
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I love to come here for early happy hour. There's a parking lot in the back which makes it easier to suggest as a meeting location. Delicious drinks and appetizers and great service. My favorites are the oysters but the fries or poutine is pretty good too! Coming on the early side allows for better conversation in a quieter space-- the later it gets it has sort of more of a lounge/club vibe (which is what you might want actually).
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: GREAT happy hour, M-F 4-7! With a free parking lot in the back, it couldn't have been a more stress free decision to come here. The bar is unique and classy.I got the Tea's Knees which was a wonderful riff off of a bees knees. My boyfriends old fashioned was tasty, but no cherry. The food was yummy but portions are very small. I didn't take a picture of the charcuterie platter but everything was sliced micro thin you could practically see through it. Service was a little slow, we didn't see our waitress for almost an hour at one point. Still a great spot to catch up with friends and enjoy craft cocktails.
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: New fave spot! I'd been wanting to go just bc it's in a cool old hotel, but it was so much better than I was even expecting. My husband & I came here this past Thursday and got great seating inside with a view of the incredibly beautiful bar (Shining vibes but so much better) and they had a DJ who I would come back every night for. He played the best mix of cool/sultry/chill at the perfect volume. The drinks & food were fantastic, had the Old Fashioned Sour & the passion fruit cocktail. Both were delicious, but I LOVED the Old Fashioned Sour. The presentation was great too; nice heavy glassware, the "good" ice--all of it. :) Food was also fabulous, had the calamari & charcuterie to start, and then had the kale salad & the barbacoa nachos which were AMAZING, and the chocolate cake was maybe (definitely) the best chocolate cake of my entire life. Everything was reasonably priced, and portions and quality were great. The staff was SO nice & so helpful, and lovely all around. They have an adorable large outdoor seating area, but inside was too gorgeous not to enjoy. The restroom is also such a cool & beautiful space that oozes the same Hollywood golden age vibe. And easiest complimentary parking!! Truly, every single thing was perfect! We can't wait to come back!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I've been here a couple of times for happy hour. They have great happy hour specials. The food is delicious and the drinks are well made. I love the ambience and decor of this place. Would highly recommend!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Super cool vibe, both hip and sophisticated. Gorgeous bar area inside (21+), complemented by comfortable outdoor patio with nice mix of high tops, regular tables, heaters, and colorful couches (under 21 ok). The drinks were amazing--they have a talented bartender! They also feature chartreuse in several drinks--and it is very hard to find right now! And the food was delicious, dish after dish, all perfect for sharing. Service was attentive and friendly. Parking lot behind with helpful attendant. If I lived closer, I'd definitely be a regular here!
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Hate leaving this review because it's right around the corner from our home, and we go here quite often and always have good service and amazing food! Sadly, this was not the case when we went in Saturday night. A group of about 8-10 of us came in after attending a concert downtown Saturday night and sat at a table for 30 mins without being acknowledged. It was busy, I get it.. but we weren't rude, weren't loud, so I thought this was odd. I asked a server if we could order drinks and she responded rudely, "I'm not your server, give me a few minutes". 10 minutes passed and still no one came over, so naturally we left. It's rare for me to leave a review, but I won't stand for poor service. Thoroughly disappointed in the level of service we received and I don't plan on going back anytime soon.. if ever.
Address: 5168 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I was able to find street parking with no problem, there are a lot of street parking that's free past 7, so look for those signs. Otherwise valet was 13?18$ cash only, they accept venmo. Food was delicious, we were seated upstairs and it was very very dark lol. So if you're going on a first date, I would ask to be seated on the lower level.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: nice staff. but SHOCKED this establishment, being so close to Paramount and many production houses, and most likely having enjoyed YEARS of support from local actors, DOES NOT offer SAG-AFTRA members an "on strike" discount. they said, No, we ONLY offer discount to WGA. well, here for post-strike lunch today but won't be supporting this place again. principal.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We went Saturday night for my partner's birthday. The staff were super sweet and provided excellent service, the food was fabulous and the prices were very reasonable. Highly recommend.The ricotta appetizer, which was the absolute standout of the meal - do NOT miss it. The drinks were tasty and well crafted, we got the Laguna Mattata and Werewolf Bar Mitvah. The homemade pasta is wonderful and comforting - both the Carbonara and Cacio E Pepe were great.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I used to live around this area and always drove by. I don't know why I never tried it until recently. Wow! I have been missing out all these years!Everything we ordered were delicious! Carbonara and Short Rib ravioli were my favorites!Easy street parking.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I recently dined at this Italian restaurant, and it was an incredible experience. The ambiance was exceptionally cool, creating a fantastic atmosphere for a delightful evening. The lighting added to the overall charm of the place.One highlight was their extensive wine selection, which offered a wide variety of options to complement the meal. I chose the bolognese pasta and rice balls, and they were both exceptionally delicious. The bolognese had a rich and savory flavor, while the rice balls were crispy on the outside and bursting with flavor on the inside.My friend got veal raviolis and they melted in your mouth.In addition to these highlights, the restaurant had much more to offer, making it a memorable dining experience. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a great Italian meal with a fantastic ambiance.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: From food to service, Osteria La Buca never disappoints. Servers like Morgan and Josh make the dining experience exceptional. From the arancini to the cacio e pepe and short rib ravioli, this is my favorite restaurant in Los Angeles!
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Wow! La Buca has really stepped up its game and is better than ever. I used to eat here fairly regularly before the pandemic because it was one of the few good Italian restaurants with good gf options for my adult daughters  with celiac. For some reason, I thought it closed until my daughter told me she had it delivered recently. I went on a week night with a friend and it was buzzing with people and good energy. The food was AMAZING and the drinks, as always, were done to perfection. Service was a tiny bit too fast, but I'm sure they would have slowed the pace had we requested it.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We got the room upstairs. Our host was okay and I would take that as literally as possible. She hardlycame upstairs to check on us unless it was to take our orders or bring the bill.Asked about split checks- she said no. Asked about getting regular spaghetti with shrimp. She said no. I ended up ordering the seafood pasta but just with shrimp haha same thing but whatever. I asked for no spice since I was with my children. I said no spice like 3 times to her because again- children.Tel me why the pasta came with spice. I waited to tell her for a good 15 minutes but again since she didn't show to ask how we were doing... I had to run downstairs.The man working downstairs was amazing and I wish he were the host cause he took my pasta no questions asked and brought a new one. The only problem was it was brought after everyone had eaten and right before we left.Idk I left disappointed and not satisfied. I think my boyfriend ordered the halibut and that was extraordinary.Street parking was easy to find.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The $160 steak was too tough and the pasta was ok but not at the top of LA Italian restaurants. The service was below subpar if not rude. The wine list was "fine" (but overpriced).  We tried several items on the menu and we are not sure how it deserves the accolades it has received; probably hype. I know the "adherents" will strongly support this "icon". I understand that it's only our opinion, and it probably doesn't matter to most, but I recommend spending your hard earned money on a restaurant that still cares.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Had my birthday dinner with 2 other couples joining us. We got to sit at the private table upstairs and it was so pleasant. Fresh pasta was amazing. They are heavy on the spices so be mindful if you can't handle much.
Address: 5210 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great location for after work drinks and a light meal. Amazing views of Hollywood and a diverse crowd.  Food was good and they have a ton of servers so wait time isn't very long.Highly recommend.
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Really only come here if you want to feel like you're doing some typical Hollywood clout vibes. The food is sub par and I'm pretty sure I paid almost $45 for a mid breakfast burrito and a Diet Coke.
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I'm still waiting for them to contact me and fix the bad experience i had. From my food to the service
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Nice serviceGood menu for food and drinksGreat ambianceTry to make a reservation beforehand
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Last time I was there I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken, was delicious. Crispy. Juicy. Tender. Just like my date. But the waffle? Dry, like my ex. Our table was too close to the neighboring table, so I felt like we were all sitting together as one big happy family.Lastly, the bathrooms smell like piss. And that's not particularly what I want to smell walking into such a nice place.3/5 overall. I've had better times at highlight so I won't go too hard on you guys. But please disinfect the bathroom
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: So bad... the benches had cigarette burns on the cushions. Service was so slow. We ordered 3 salads and it took 45 mins. Salads were over dressed and chicken was super dry. Not worth $30-$40 a salad. No one addressed the long wait or poor quality. Restaurant is near the pool which that day there were children running around, back and forth from the table to the pool. Not the service staff's responsibility to ask kids to stop, but maybe a policy that you need shoes and shirts to enter the restaurant even if you are 5y/o? It really killed the vibe. So much that we ended up avoiding Tao and Beauty & Essex.
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Incredible avocado toast. An ombre of flavors and colors, and well balanced with the perfect amount of acid. Nice Cafe American in little cups. The hands that served, if only she balanced what could have been an across the board enchanting experience. I guess Waiteress 101 re-training is store. At least find a new personality. And, please, be cordial.
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I love everything about this place besides the parking. Parking is like $25. But what will you expect? It's friggin LA where everything is not free but anyhow, didn't regret everything.. Ambiance was amazing, love every food we ordered. Service was great too!! Definitely going back!
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Hands down, the BEST avocado toast I've ever had. It's been over a month since I went back and I still think about that avocado toast  I wasn't sure if furikake on avocado toast would work but it definitely did because it was DELICIOUS!!
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I recently had the unfortunate experience of dining at highlight room grill that left me utterly disappointed and appalled. What was meant to be a memorable birthday dinner turned into a nightmare that I wouldn't wish upon my worst enemy. The dishes were not only tasteless and poorly presented, It was as if the chef had taken a haphazard approach, tossing ingredients together without any thought or care. Every bite was a reminder of the money wasted on this dining experience. To make matters worse, instead of allowing us to enjoy our meal, the security guard seemed determined to rush us out of the restaurant. We were constantly interrupted and pressured to finish our plates, even though we had barely taken a few bites. It felt as if they were more interested in turning tables than ensuring customer satisfaction. As if this wasn't enough, the climax of this horrendous evening came when we were abruptly escorted out of the restaurant by security. It was my friend's birthday, and we had gathered to celebrate and enjoy a pleasant evening together. Which turned out to be one of the worst birthday celebrations.
Address: 6417 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The sweetest spot. It feels like entering the lush backyard garden of a Japanese grandma's house who's cooking up rich miso soup, all the proteins, and preparing the freshest fish and salad just for you. It always hits the spot and feels like a humble oasis in the middle of LA.
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This review is mostly for their miso soup, although wasn't crazy about my roll either with RE-usable chopsticks that were impossible to use.My miso soup came with every other ingredients but classic ingredients like tofu and see weed. It had tons of boiled onions (who adds boiled onions to miso soup?), zucchini, fennel, mushrooms. Why not call it a veggie soup but in no way a miso soup!Very disappointing
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Yummmmm!!! This place made me feel like I was in another country, eating local food. It was so delicious. The staff was super friendly, the food came out fairly prompt, and being surrounded with so much greenery was definitely a vibe. I recommend.
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great location, big menu, super green garden with Good food, nice staff but not much fish in the dish
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This is my favorite new spot in town! The food is to die for and it's nice to see healthy options. The vibe of the place is adorable and I love everything about it so much that I have to limit the amount of times I eat out here per week lol. Highly recommend!
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Such a cute cafe, loved all the greenery inside. This cafe is kind of tucked away but such cute find. They have seating inside and out but it's pretty limited, luckily we got a spot inside since it was so hot on the day we came here. The food portions were larger than expected and everything was super fresh! The workers were super nice and explained the drink menu to us.Definitely recommend this place if you are into themed cafes or cafes with greenery or just want some great food!
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Been here a few times and food and drinks are always fresh and tasty. Deducting one star because every time, there are a ton of flies landing in my food making me have to eat quickly or not want to eat the parts where the flies landed.
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Good vibes place specializing in Japanese style rice bowls in all kinds of varieties. Good flavor, big portions, plants everywhere to keep you company. I'll come back to try the rest of their extensive menu.
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Everything was delicious, it was a 4+ star restaurant    I am very stingy with five stars by the way.
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This Yuko Kitchen location is absolutely adorable. It's blanketed with vegetation both indoors and outdoors. It makes you feel like you're eating outside in a rainforest or some sort and not in the middle of Los Angeles. There are both indoor and outdoor seating that accommodates to 2-4 people, but here are some longer tables that sits up to six for a bigger group.I always tell myself to try something new, but I always order the Chicken Special Plate that comes with teriyaki chicken, rice, salad, 4 pieces of spicy salmon rolls, shot of soup, & mini dessert for $17. As you can tell it gives a variety of servings and the portion is large too. You can't go wrong with this order tho!The service is great. You order your food at the counter and they provide you a number. You seat yourself so I recommend someone order and someone holds down a table if you see one open because it does get busy. They have an intercom so you can listen for your number if you're sitting outside. You also self serve in termed of utensils, water, trash, etc. There are bins and trash can adjacent to the entry door so you can't miss it.Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant and this location!
Address: 5484 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: The Front Yard is one of my favorite local spots. Cozy atmosphere, great food, and excellent service. On this particular visit, for my husband's birthday, Sonia elevated our experience and expectations. She was attentive, warm, and personable! Her hospitality is infectious! She made us want to come back ASAP. Francisco C., also made a huge impact on us by simply adding his personal touch to our superb dining experience.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: Great brunch and dinner spot. Go here all the time. Service is always nice (as long as you are) and always do their best even when stressed with high traffic. Lovely ambiance overall, very nice lighting, especially during sunset - the light reflects amazingly through the windows. I go here all the time, both when looking for a business casual brunch/lunch or having a quick family dinner. 5 stars!
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: Mosquito problem. Entire family was bit up.Food was good - hard to enjoy with the suckers eating up our family.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: Bad bad service. No water refills. We asked about three times. At least the food was not bad just the service all in all.I might come back again and maybe the service will be better.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: We arrived at 4:00 pm the hotel. We got off the road from TEXAS. Walked into The Front yard restaurant for food- REAL FOOD!The hostess directed us to the bar- there was no seating in the bar area. We asked about using one of the dozens of open tables to sit at. We were told to put the bar had food, and we had to sit there.Again, they were dozens of open tables available !We sat down on the sofa. We waited for service. Nobody showed up.I got up, again, ask about menus and food.They brought over a chump change paper menu. It was mostly drinks and bar food.  NOT REAL FOOD! Not to mention it was EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE bar food!!We look at the menu, considered the service, the poor attitude of the hosts and walked right out.We are staying at the hotel for our wedding anniversary! We WILL NOT be eating or drinking at this place.We are BOTH Calif natives who came back for our wedding anniversary! This isn't how WE will be spending it. The hostess needs an attitude check. The location also needs to re-define the definition of "food"- bar snacks and "happy hour" isn't food!The waiters ALSO NEED to pay better attention instead of standing around hustling drinks.DO NOT waist your time here! Lots of better places to eat at in Studio City/ north Hollywood.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: We went there  on a Sunday for brunch and it was great the food and the drinks were delicious. Great service and fast. Great atmosphere , beats decor and upscale dining experience.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: The food and beverage manager wrote me back, and I was refunded the total amount that I paid for the meal. I appreciate that they addressed the situation financially, and I do believe that they will be addressing food prep safety and hygiene with their chefs and hospitality team.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: I visited this location last week for a business meeting and found hair in my steak salad (there looked to be more than one). The hummus was great (and hair free), but the waiter wasn't warm. He was actually quite unfriendly. I didn't flag the hair because I didn't want to cause any concern and I was meeting with a new professional contact. I did make her aware of the hair though.I ultimately paid the bill and emailed Thomas, the food and beverage head, the next day. He never wrote back. I loved the ambiance of this location and the hostesses were great. Unfortunately, however, finding hair in my food even once at an establishment means I'll never visit again. Double check your plates before digging in. I wish I had.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: Small seating outside, calm and efficient . I tried the orange white wine- quite refreshing and perfect for a hot day! I went during happy hour and caught a break for only $10 a glass. Snack menu could improve but it was 6pm nearing dinner anyway! I'll be back.!
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: TL:DR - Beautiful outdoor seating, friendly service, tasty foodI came here with a couple of co-workers for a business-esque lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant. Located next to The Garland Hotel, The Front Yard is an aesthetic restaurant that serves contemporary American dishes. The outdoor seating is very beautiful and there is enough shade to keep everyone cool during these hot summers.I normally don't order fried chicken sandwiches but for whatever reason, I had to get one today. The chicken was cooked properly, not too dry or undercooked (god forbid) and it wasn't overly battered. Honestly, the sandwich was good, nothing that Wow'd me, but also wasn't bad. It's exactly what I wanted and for the right price. The fries that came with it were also good, just standard good fries. I wish I could explain more, but it was just what you would expect, no crazy ingredients, no fancy fusions, just a good fried chicken sandwich that left me feeling satisfied.The wait-staff was incredibly accommodating and even wore a mask for us when serving and taking our order. That's super rare as I'm writing this in fall 2023 and we're going through another covid wave.Overall, a great time location for grabbing a relaxed lunch and getting some good food. I'll definitely be back if I'm in Burbank or North Hollywood.
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: If you're going on the weekend, make a reservation - I'm glad we did as it was pretty packed.  The food was decent and the drinks were ok - when they say the drink is spicy, they aren't lying. woo!
Address: 4222 Vineland Ave North Hollywood, CA 91602
Style: American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Beer, Wine & Spirits

Comment: Good food, great location. Since my original review was lost and apparently too long. Check this place out.
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Happy to report that I was back at one of my favorite places on the west coast. Yes, it's that serious! My husband and I really love Pasta Sisters. So happy to see they're still busy bees. There really isn't any pasta dish that I could recommend over the other- everything is just so fresh and delicious.
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Stumbled upon this spot after opening up yelp on our way back to our Airbnb. Disclaimer, I'm an Italian that is very particular about her pasta. Secondly, I do not judge "a hole in a wall" spot and neither should you. Pasta sisters is crazy good and crazy busy. We pulled up and walked in to get lucky enough to dine in. Very limited seating btw. We were given complimentary bread and dipping oil, like hold up, all of this is a strip mall?! This was already starting off like fine dining. Then comes out the truffle pasta and Bolognese. Holy smokes! Fresh pasta, Al dente to perfection and truffle flavor like you wouldn't believe. Every time I touch down in LA, I'm headed here, no doubt!Much love, respect and continued success from this Italiana!
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Service is great- supplied extra bread free of charge with a smile... many options, and delicious flavor. Recommend for lunch so good.
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Really good food!! That said, the vibes are... weird. Go to the Culver City location for sure
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I love this plays and this location,always the best never disappointed!!!probably best bolognese in town. Reminds me of Italia!!!when in the area I always come here!!!thank you for good food!!!
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Everything was tasty the Bolognese I get it was delicious.If you want a nice Italian food and you in the area or you should stop by also the stuff is very friendly so basically I like everything about this place thank you guys
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: We got the salmon cream pasta & bolognese. And they were so delicious! They make their spaghetti, tagliatelle, and pappardelle fresh in house. They offered complimentary bread with oil and vinegar. This a small restaurant, only about two tables and bar seating. I could tell it was popular because many people came through for pick-up/take out.
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Absolutely amazing. Excellent service and the quality of the food is bar none for the price point. Highly recommend and try it all! And the lemonade!
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: It was my first time to try this most recommend pasta. The order is great and delicious. Not too cheesy and perfect mixture of Italian and American. I will try more later
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: This space is more of a takeout place. The pasta with salmon and the butrarico pasta or something was good, maybe not 17 dollars good. The broccoli side was roasted but more burned. The side of roasted vegetables was good but limited. Nice employees but limited seating.
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Nice people. Good service. Tasty food in mid city . Little to go spot worth tasting.I'm doing 4 stars now , because 5 means amazing in my book. You might feel differently, but try em and see !
Address: 3343 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Ok one thing was on my list was to get good mandus/dumplings and this place was it. This place is tucked away in the back of the building (you have to go outside, but still indoors). There are a lot of menu items, but we ordered kimchi dumplings, crispy shrimp kimchi dumpling, ddukgalbi kimbap, and the pastry. Definitely recommend the crispy shrimp kimchi!! Oh my it's so good. Everything was good that we went again in the same week lol. I think this place is ran by 2 women, but they always seems so busy. It might take a few minutes for them to take your order bc they're busy back in the kitchen. One thing that was off was that usually when you order kimbap they can give some kind of soup on the side which we had requested, but one of the ladies kinda questioned it and gave it like she was forced to. But I would still come again lol
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Fromt cashier is nice and food is delicious.I would come back and place is clean.Rice noodle and mandu is so good.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Definitely a hidden gem. Staff was welcoming. Portion size is big & worth every penny! I feel terrible that I couldn't finish my bowl, but if I could've I would've. It was so delicious! Will go back next time I'm in town :)
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I would've never found this place if it wasn't for yelp. This restaurant is on the first floor of a building on Wilshire/Hobart, 3660 Wilshire Blvd to be exact. It's located on the first floor in the very back of the building. There's a sign in front of the building, but it's so unassuming, there would be no way of noticing it if you were driving. For years, Pao Jao was my favorite Kimchi Dumplings, but now I found a new favorite place for Kimchi Dumplings. Cooking Mom is exactly what it sounds like. It's a Korean mom cooking for you, and the way she cooks is utter perfection. The Kimchi dumplings are a bit spicier than Pao Jao, but in a good way. Cooking Mom restaurant allows for credit cards, but the owner told me she prefers cash, so be a sport and pay cash when you get here. Please support this business, I know I will be a regular.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The service is great.  They are very nice and friendly. The place is like a small mom and pop restaurant.  I ordered spicy rice cake and spicy chewy noodles.  They were delicious.  I especially love their dumplings.  I will definitely come back again.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The portions were large and the food very tasty. The service was very good. Surroundings are simple but clean.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: There are so many delicious Korean restaurants in Koreatown, but Cooking Mom stands out as a little star for me. It's comfort food at its finest, meals that you know are made with love because how delicious they are. Their dumplings are a standout, and although I want to try everything on the menu, the bentos are what I crave. You definitely cannot go wrong with the dumplings and noodle soup combo. The ingredients are always fresh, and just has me craving it week after week.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Randomly I would see the sign on the street. Wondering what I want to eat for lunch, I I decided to walk in to this place. No regrets. It's kind of hidden. Just ask the security guard. Or, just keep walking all the way to back of the building and you'll see it. Very kind staff and very good home style food. Always feel like I get my moneys worth and more. Tables are clean and orderly. Highly recommend this place. Check out their specials inside. They change regularly.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Rice noodle soup and shrimp dumpling combo is great. You can also add other side orders like different dumplings. It's a good lunch option.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This was my first time here. It's a little hidden in the back of the building, so don't give up.The food comes in generous portions at good prices. VIP stamp cards are available as a benefit for paying with cash.The bulgogi beef was delicious and sizzling hot. I live in the neighborhood and will definitely be coming back. They have a big menu with a lot of great dishes to try.
Address: 3660 Wilshire Blvd Ste 120 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Love the ambience to this place, really chill vibe. I love the ahi tuna tartare i think this was my favorite. Service was great. I got molise as a drink is the one with a little beaker on the side, wish it is more spicy tho cause it kinda tasted bland or watered but i still like the drink. Our only thing was the food was served really slow which made us be full fast but also we had somewhere to go to so we were in a time crunch but they we're kind enough to give us champagne for waiting a bit more for our food to come out. Would come back again.
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I chose this dinner spot on vacation for our party of 7 solely because the top reviews and pictures. We wanted to go somewhere in downtown LA with a nice ambiance, great food and drinks. This place fell no short of that!We had James as our server and he was AMAZING. He came out of the gates very knowledgeable of the drink menu and recommendations for each of us. All of the cocktails we ordered had a WOW element, either dry ice, smoke, or fire was involved. I had the campania ($19) and the Sardinia ($21) which were both light and refreshing.We started with a few appetizers (2) braised meatballs ($20 each) and a truffle pizza ($38). The meatballs were so tender and had the most addicting sauce. The pizza was loaded with truffle and the Parmesan cream sauce was the perfect pair. HIGHLY recommend both of those apps.For our entrees, we had the hardest time deciding but James ensured everything on the menu was amazing. My friend and I had the bone marrow pasta ($32 each) which stole the show!! This was my favorite dish! In our group, they ordered the lobster pasta ($75) cacio y Pepe with truffle ($32+ Truffle price), Bolognese ($32) and Wagyu Alla Vodka Pizza ($28).We were so stuffed from the food and drinks and wanted dessert but there was no way we could do it. We decided to take pictures after in the hotel courtyard and it was the perfect aesthetic. Our experience overall was a great start to our vacation. This is a perfect place for a date night out or for a group gathering- 10/10 recommend and definitely will be coming back on my next visit to LA.
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: All of the dishes we got were yummy and presentation was on point. Loved the aesthetic inside and nice view of the pool. Had a reservation and got seated immediately by the super friendly staff. Cocktails were also really good!
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Came here with the wife for date night before the drake concert! One of the best pastas around! I had the wagu pasta wow ! The place is super nice also. Service as top notch!
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Portions and pricing was decent for being a restaurant in LA. Food was decent but my main entree (cacio e pepe) had WAY too much pepper and the pasta needed to be cooked another 5 mins. Cocktails are really good and the restaurant itself is just beautiful.
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: First of all the place was very cute & chic I went for my birthday brunch with a friend. It's all indoor with open air and views of the hotel pool and music playing. It was a very nice cool brunch vibe. The service was good nothing stuck out but the device was good.They have a prefixed brunch menu I tried to order a drink I saw on yelp but they didn't have the ingredients for it because they had prefixed brunch cocktails. I can't remember the name of my drink but it was very good tasted like a peach spritz. Next I had the Sparrow Carbanaro and when I tell you it was TASTY it really was. I wasn't sure how I felt about a egg on my pizza but it fit just in. I usually like ranch on my pizza but everything on this pizza complimented each other there was NO need to add anything else to it. Next I had the pistachio pasta, I'm not the biggest fan of arugula and it's definitely a main ingredient in the sauce and other but I can taste the arugula for sure. It was still very good though the actual pistachios compliment just right. I'm glad I got to try out this delicious spot for my birthday brunch!
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: BRUNCH REVIEW:I cant give a full review of this place since I only came here for brunch on father's day but the brunch menu was pretty underwhelming. Also I'm not sure why they had open reservations for our time slot because as soon as we sat down they told us the kitchen was about to close and we had to order everything right away.We ended up getting two orders of the gnocchi pasta which was pretty much just a small portion of tomato sauce and gnocchi topped with mozzarella cheese. We also got the egg pizza which was literally just like Georgian khachapuri.The drinks were decent, nothing crazy good to remember.  The ambiance was fine for brunch since it was outdoors and you could see the hotel pool but there were flies buzzing around near us which was annoying.Overall, i wouldn't recommend this place as a good brunch spot. There are much better options all over LA to try out instead like Dialogue.
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This place makes amazing pasta and has great service and atmosphere.#Bolognese Pasta
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Nice spot, an oasis in DTLA by the pool. Service wasn't the most attentive but they were nice and the food was good.
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Aside from the lovely ambiance that you will experience eating at sparrow, the service and food are excellent. Ive had the pleasure of visiting three times now and most recently I was able to celebrate my 8 year anniversary.While I expected the food and drinks to be great as usual, the service we received at dinner was excellent. We were greeted with complimentary champagne in honor of our anniversary and even given a small complimentary dessert. My partner and I were so thrilled at the thoughtfulness of our waiter and staff & it amplified our experience even more!We had the wagyu ribeye, broccolini, baked spaghetti squash & focaccia! The ribeye was cooked to perfection, we most definitely recommend. For drinks we had the basilicata and molise & presentation is above & beyond.We most definitely recommend visiting Sparrow and celebrate your next special event!
Address: 939 S Figueroa St. Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Food was good.Service was good.Theres a parking lot behind the restaurant and street parking in the area.Dishes here are made to be shared so come with some friends.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: First off, the ambiance was just perfect. It strikes a balance between modern chic and cozy comfort. The sleek, contemporary design sets the tone for an elegant dining experience, while the warm lighting and comfortable seating make you feel right at home.The outdoor seating area proved to be a brilliant choice. The temperature was just perfect, and it allowed us to relish our meal while basking in the fresh air and natural surroundings. What impressed us most was the impeccable service. Even though we were seated outside, the attentive staff ensured we were never forgotten. They consistently checked in to see if we needed refills or anything else, making us feel truly valued as customers.Now, let's talk about the drinks. I decided to go with the Haeundae Blue cocktail, a delightful concoction made with rum, coconut milk, and pineapple juice. Not only did it taste heavenly, but its striking blue color made it a perfect candidate for Instagram-worthy photos. The balance of flavors was just right, with the alcohol content not overpowering the tropical essence.As for the food, we couldn't resist sampling some of their offerings. We ordered the fried chicken & fries, and it was a decision we didn't regret. The fried chicken was expertly prepared, boasting a crispy exterior that gave way to succulent, juicy meat inside. The fries were golden and seasoned to perfection, making for an ideal accompaniment to our drinks.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: They have parking around the corner.As for the restaurant; Nice atmosphere. Good service. Decent drinks. Quite pricey mediocre food.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The only thing this place has got going for them would be their captivating interior and decor. You would think that their food would match what their environment offered... disappointingly, it didn't. No physical menus, only QR. When it was time to order, we decided to ask a server for recommendations. Which put us in a pretty funny situation because even he had trouble providing options. We ended up just going with what seemed popular on Yelp -- tomahawk pork cutlet. Also went for a wild card with the Bulgogi oven risotto. It was very underwhelming. The cutlet came uncut with a basic sweet tomato sauce. Very chewy and tough. I was pretty disappointed. I'd say the risotto was a little bit better, more enjoyable. Service was meh. Food was meh. Maybe my expectations were too high considering the high-end ambiance and prices. Would not come back.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The mentaiko spaghetti is the best Asian style spaghetti I've ever had in my entire life!! It's amazing. Worth a visit just for this! Tasted just as good when I got it delivered as well.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Great service, got a reservation and asked to be seated in a booth by the window and got it. Decor and vibes are great. Some items are a little pricey, but here we got the iron plate, mentaiko gnocchi, and watermelon soju. Watermelon soju reasonably gives at least 3 drinks, but is not very alcoholic. Sounds like they have a happy hour from 5-8pm on Sundays-Thursday where the whole check is 20% off - will be coming back for that.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food is pretty good, service was a little sore but it's expected cause it was busy so I understand, the ambiance is AMAZING, great place to have a drink and chat
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I was excited to try this new restaurant after seeing it online and it being so close to my place. It was smaller than I thought! And when I came on a Sunday at 6:30, it was nearly empty. So definitely a different vibe than I expected. We didn't have a reservation and it wasn't an issue.I believe happy hour is 5-8pm everyday (? Not sure) and it's 20% off!We ordered the crab meat pasta -- delicious and so creamy -- and the tomahawk pork cutlet. I thought the pork cutlet was just ok, but it's a massive portion. The two of us ate family style and we couldn't finish. Overall, they give big portions but the prices reflect that imo.My friend ordered the peach Bellini which was yummy. I ordered the Ms Korea and replaced the tequila with vodka. It was DELICIOUS. Will order again. Loved the yakult in it.Our receipt has a 10% coupon for Cafe Concerto nearby which we will try next.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Really sad to give this place such low rating. It's so cute. It took 35 minutes to get our cocktails and it was clear the staff they had there were not trained on how to make the cocktails on the cocktail list. Wouldn't go back.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food isn't superb, service is decent, but the ambiance is pretty nice. Overpriced cocktails as well as certain dishes... I don't recommend the truffle fries. Also, it felt like they intentionally reduced the portion for all the dishes ordered during the happy hour.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I've heard really good things about this Italian restaurant, you may want to make your reservation (-:
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Came by Labor Day weekend afternoon for lunch with family.  Read another review that had a bad experience on LD weekend as well. Guess it's just our luck.We were the first to be there (restaurant was empty) and 2 more tables arrived after us. Put in our orders and it took half an hour to get our one calamari dish- appetizer. The waiter came out with free bread shortly after, but then we waited and waited and waited.. 40 mins went by and we still haven't seen the next dish.. 2 pasta orders and a large pepperoni pizza.  The other 2 tables also haven't gotten any of their dishes as well, I noticed.  I know if I opted for fast food, I could've gone there, but over an hour wait for 4 dishes?  What the hell was the chef doing?? Picking his nose back there??When my pasta dish (carbonara) finally came out, it was overly salted. When food takes that long to come out, shouldn't it taste at least decent?  I could've made a more decent frozen pizza at home.We canceled the last pasta dish that still hasn't come out, paid our $100+ with tip and left. It wasn't the waiters fault, but when you're hangry, it doesn't  matter.Food is barely decent, but taking over an hour to serve 4 dishes was beyond ridiculous!
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Stopped by for Labor Day weekend. We called in earlier to ask if they served wine and had been told that while they had a house red and house white, they also charged a $15 corkage fee to bring your own wine. My girlfriend and I saw in another review that there was a liquor store next door to buy said wine from, but when we pulled up to Supremo and parked the store was closed. We decided to walk on over to the gas station across the street to see if they had wine to bring in.We didn't even take two steps before a man yelled after us. He said, quite rudely, that the parking (an empty lot, btw!) was only for customers. I explained to him that we intended to come in and get dinner but we wanted to buy a bottle first."How long?" he asked. I told him around 5 minutes and then he, with an attitude, repeated "How long?"Not a really welcoming start to the experience. My girlfriend and I decided to go to Uovo down the street instead. Jury's still out on the food as we've yet to try it but I was so put off by this experience that I had to share. No wonder that whole dining room was empty.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This spot is a true hidden gem in the city of LA. They have incredible dishes that I tried, see list below. The service was really great they have indoor and outdoor seating and a parking lot that is free. The ambience inside is very spacious and clean and the outside is very nice.What I tried and loved.....⁣⁣Main⁣Pizza Fresca ⁣Caprese ⁣Stromboli ⁣Capelini Genovese⁣⁣Dessert⁣Torta Di Mascarpone ⁣Pizza Nutella with Strawberries ⁣⁣Appetizers ⁣Tuna Tartare⁣Grilled Chicken ⁣******************************************⁣
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Perfectly pleasant but very ordinary food. You won't hate it but you can do much better at this price point.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great food, kind service! I called to place an order for pickup on a Monday afternoon and they had it ready in ~25-30 minutes. There's a small parking lot in front which is nice but I anticipate it would get a little crowded during busy hours. Has a nice ambiance for dinner inside, though I got take out. Everything is freshly made and cooked to order - to top it off, freshly grated Parmesan and red pepper flakes were included with my margherita pizza! Thin, crunchy, yummy pizza that still tasted delicious when reheated days after. The luganega is a delicious pappardelle pasta with a creamy tomato sauce, sausages mushrooms, and arugula - definitely hit the craving as well. Delicious and can't wait to go back and order more!
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This Is my new go to favorite spot to eat italian - pasta is fresh. They have a great pasta special Tuesday night. I love it highly recommend. Great service homemade fresh pasta, so bomb.!!William Sanford n family
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: We came here before a concert and ordered the prosciutto pizza. They top the pizza with unwashed arugula salad, and unfortunately, mine came with a pebble the size of a peppercorn. I really thought I chipped my tooth!  I told the waiter about it and he told me it was probably a peppercorn until I dropped it on the plate and he also realized it was in fact a pebble. He took the pizza away and told me he'd get me a new one. His reasoning was because of the arugula. After another 15 minutes the pizza came back with more unwashed arugula.  I feel like they could have handled it better. I'm glad they did make me a new pizza, but afterwards, most of the staff came out to look at me, and that was awkward.  Also, bribe me with a dessert or a free pizza or something! Anyway, food was okay, but overall experience was not great.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Ive been to Supremo several times since it opened as I live in the area. The best things there are the pastas. However, I've noticed it's not always consistent. 2 months ago I had the Alfredo for the first time and it was incredible. I had it again last week and it was bland. The pizza doesn't have enough flavor and never seems quite right. Tonight I went and shared the caprese and the calamari. The caprese was made with ricotta although the menu says burrata. I would have told our server but they never came back to check us on. Ricotta just doesn't taste the same in that salad and wasn't what we were anticipating as described on the menu. The calamari had a tasty breading and dipping marinara. However the calamari itself was dried out, likely frozen. I also ordered a glass of wine which on the way out I saw came from a Gallo magnum bottle. The glass was $14. Everywhere online that same entire bottle of Cabernet sells for under $10. There used to be a super nice, helpful youngish Latino guy working there but I haven't seen him in awhile. He seemed like he cared about things and customers but I haven't gotten that vibe from anyone there since he's been gone. Probably won't be back.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: You wouldn't think it but this place is absolutely amazingggggggggg the lasagna is to die for. The service is quick and they are super friendly. So happy to have found this place.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Reliably good spot, I have loved pretty much everything I've eaten here. The space is super open and warm, and the staff has always been really nice and helpful. The shrimp wontons are my favorite. I will be back here more in the future and also the sister restaurant Joy.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Service was stellar! However, food was not. As a Taiwanese person, I was quite disappointed in the minced pork over rice. The ratio of rice and meat needs improvement and the rice was soggy. Egg wasn't fully cooked and you can tell it needed another 1-2 minutes to boil. The "Dan Dan" noodles were not your typical Dan Dan noodles it was more sesame cold peanut noodles which was delish. Portion was tiny though.Aesthetics were great. Didn't seem too crowded and place was clean and tidy.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I've been recommended this place so much that I had to stop by on my trip to LA. We came on a Thursday night around 7pm and it wasn't too busy, so we got to sit down to eat without a wait, maybe we just got lucky.You order at the register and then they give you a number and seat you at a table inside. Just beware, the restaurant itself is quite small (so that's why the wait could take awhile or more people order takeout).Since this was our first time here, we wanted to try their popular dishes. We ordered: stir fry cabbage, beef roll, dan dan noodles, mapo tofu, three-cup jidori chicken, pan fried pork buns. I think my favorite dishes were the dan dan noodles, beef roll, and mapo tofu. The mapo tofu was not spicy as other mapo tofu, but you can add chili oil on the side if you want it spicier. The pan fried pork buns were ok, I don't think I would get it again but it wasn't bad.Overall I had a good experience here and would recommend this restaurant if you are ever in the Silverlake area. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in LA.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Really enjoyed the food here. My favourite was the lotus root appetiser and wood ear mushroom appetiser. The cold dishes do change from time to time so definitely a few new things I want to try if it comes back on the menu. The vegetarian mapo tofu also had nice consistency and thickness. The Bok Choy dumplings were pretty good as well. My friend had the minced pork on rice which looked really delicious. It's a small seating area indoors so sometimes there may be a wait. A little cold inside but I do like the dim-ish ambiance. They also serve boba and loose leaf tea. Overall, yummy food!
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Yeaaaa this place has it. Walk in the door and you immediately get hit with aromas you thought could only exist in your dreams. I've been here countless times now and I always get the beef noodle soup, pork dumplings and if I bring the girlfriend we get some scallion pancakes too (her favvv). The broth of the BNS is just jaw dropping - for real, be careful. You don't want to lose any of that broth because you're in pure shock of what flavor you just experienced. The pork dumplings just never miss and that's that. Overall vibe of the place is dope. We sat at the community table a couple times and that's always chill, I want to recreate that new girl episode there, you know the one. Aight that's enough from me. Hope to pluck a dumpling off your plate next time I'm sitting at the community table
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I came on a Friday night and with the high ratings I was expecting the food to be better than average. However, I left a disappointed.
