They have other dishes besides the Mandu if you're not wanting that as well. The interior was clean and open, the seats are hard and not comfortable but overall the taste experience was really great. Also it's pretty central ktown so you can also walk to hmart across the street or get dessert nearby.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Really great spot for some Korean staples. The interior is minimally modern and clean. I love the long concrete table that stands in the middle of the space for communal seating. There are booths and standard tables along the walls as well.The food was great and I actually can't wait to come back and have more of what I loved... which is:1. Fried mandu. Get the sampler. My favorites are the shrimp and jalapeno. Non standard, but they were so delicious. They fry the mandus so well - the outside is so crisp and the inside is fully packed with a generous portion of filling.2. Perilla buckwheat noodle. This is such a simple dish, but the perilla flavor was spot on and there was a hint of sweetness that brought out the flavor even more. The noodles are topped with a generous heaping of seaweed. The portion is huge and could be split into two different meals. The noodles themselves are cooked to just the right tenderness. Would definitely order again.3. Cold kimchi noodles. The bowl is GIANT. It's actually deceivingly huge. The broth is delicious, noodles are very chewy, and the kimchi doesn't actually make it too spicy.For two, we ordered the steamed mandu sampler, the fried mandu sampler, and the 2 noodle dishes. Both of us were extremely full and had leftovers to take home.PRO TIP: if you order an entree, you can add 3 mandus to your order for $3. This is a much better deal than ordering one order of 6 mandus for $9.99. And you can pick the type of mandu you want too! I recommend going this route for best value.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Yum!! Food is so yummy. I live in NYC and have had good Korean, but this is next level. The staff is super nice and the place was clean, too. Also, the price point was perfect for the quality. I had the tteok-bokki with cheese. So good!!!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Only had the takeout mandu sampler, but every variety was delicious! Especially recommend the jalapeño -- not sure what ground meat was in there, but the subtle spiciness took it up a level.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I had the steamed pork mandu which was good. I tried some of my friend's kimchi fried rice which was very flavorful-- a little on the strong side for me. The inside could be a bit more cozy but overall a solid restaurant.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I was expecting this place to be good. With that said. Never coming back. Service was atrocious and they took forever. Food was ok but made it worse due toothed lack of how long it took. Never coming back. Just not worth it.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I was honestly very impressed with every dish we ordered.  Mandu has never been a craving, but the fried version sampler (14.99) that CHD provided was perfectly crispy and flavorful.  You get 10 pieces all with the perfect crunch.Though I would come back specifically for the non-dumpling items.The space is spacious, modern, clean and bright.  The energy made me just happy to be there.The buckwheat cold noodle (13.99) looks very basic, but it had a balanced flavor that was dynamic and more complex that just using soba broth.  I enjoyed this a lot and surprised by the perfectly cooked noodles.  The perilla oil worked well with the soy and it wasn't too salty.  Thought this was great.The rose Tteokbokki (14.99) is so creamy, perfect chew and includes some bits of fish cake.  My partner wanted his own dish, he loved it so much especially with the cheese.  We're definitely ordering this again.The spicy cold noodle (13.99) was also great, nice kick and good flavor.The wonton noodle (14.99) was interesting, a lot of citrus and was very refreshing.  It was different from what I was expecting, but had nice pieces of shrimp.The Steamed mandu plate (9.99) were okay, ironically my least favorite dish.  The skin was a bit thin and you get only 6 pieces.  They were honestly very standard and not as memorable as the other dishes.Love it.  We always walked passed, but never got a chance to try it.  Glad we did and we were all very surprised by how good it was.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: food + price : we got the rose tteokbokki & i rlyy liked it hebe it was p good except i wish there was fish cakes instead of noodles :(service : service was meh .-. we got everything v quick tho !ambiance : the shop is rly spacious :0 and i rly like the vibes in there cuz there r a lot of tables + the tables r rly pretty LMFAO*btw they played a lot of blackpink SLAY
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The kimchi cold noodles are good, but the kimchi dumplings were below average. I'm downgrading my review.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Pao Jao at the Korean Town Plaza on Western has my favorite steamed kimchi dumplings. CHD Mandu LA is relatively new, and I was curious if this place was better. It's located at the Brown Derby Plaza where Boiling Crab and Wako Donkatsu is located. Mandu is Korean for dumpling, and I ordered the steamed kimchi dumplings along with the cold Kimchi noodles. The cold kimchi noodles were great, and CHD's steamed kimchi dumplings are 2nd to Pao Jao. Overall, I was very pleased with this experience. Would love to come back.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Instagram-able Cheese Fire Show. Interesting. Food is ok. Soup is flavorful. Huge portions. Comes with brown (more like purple) or white rice. Multiple locations, but 6th street seems to have the most reviews. Complimentary Kimchee and Radish banchan with free refills. Complimentary hot tea. Free soda with Yelp check-in. Valet parking a lot, metered street parking, or nearby self-parking at H Mart parking garage across the street for $5.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Just your average old joe. Classically well advertised korean food in ktown. Known for their galbi jjim that you share amongst people. As a korean, I think it is okay. But for those starting to dip their toes into korean food, this isn't a bad option.Parking: $4 valet (we went on a weekend night)They have multiple locations and this is the smaller one out of the two in ktown.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: When you eat here you can taste the authenticity. Had the Sulung Tang or the Bone Soup with Beef Brisket and the quality of the meat was so good it surprised me. Came here with my boyfriend almost 11:00 pm, we called and asked and the place is open 24 hours. When we came there was no wait time and maybe one other group eating at the time so the staff were super attentive to us and helpful. Staff and environment was friendly and kind. If you want a smaller and more intimate space as well as delicious soup and meat come to this Sun Nong Dam location. If you want a bigger busier environment best fitting large groups or a family dinner go to the other Sun Nong Dam location on S Western.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came in from Texas needing a change. Absolutely blew my mind! Best comfort food in any culture! The service by Mike was top notch! Provided every bit of anything we needed and some. Small intimate ambiance absolute perfect place to take a small family or group and enjoy every second. Memories were made and this place will always be my go to whenever I'm in the city again!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best Korean Cuisine in Los Angeles! Great customer service, quality ingredients and the best atmosphere in Koreatown
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Love it delicious af love this places to eat and I am going out for dinner with the kids and I am so happy for them to come back and visit with me I am very excited for you guys and I'm very happy that you're coming
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Service was horrible once again unfortunately. Only reason I go is for food . Even if it takes an hour to come out . Oh and they will make h feel really uncomfortable if u don't tip them 18 percent lol
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We called 30 minutes in advance asking if they can accommodate parties of 11, and they eagerly told us yes over the phone.We show up and write our name down on the queue and there are about 3-4 small groups ahead of us but we don't mind a short wait.A male worker walks out to check the list multiple times and doesn't say anything about our party size being 11 people. There were 2 people on the list named Rachel which caused confusion, so I even spoke to him in person about our table of 11 and he didn't question it.A few minutes go by and another female worker comes out to check the list and she sees our group of 11 and sends us away. She recommends the Western location to us instead because it's bigger and basically tells us they cannot accommodate 11 people at this time.Disappointed that they told us over the phone that they could seat us. Even more disappointed that it took them 15 minutes to say anything to us, so we waited all that time for nothing.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was incredible and super authentic. Service was quick and the staff (especially Mike and Julian) was excellent~Will definitely come back
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place is clean and inviting. The service is above and beyond many local restaurants. Mike and Zoey do their best give customers the best experience possible. The food is mouth watering if you like traditional Korean eats this is a must stop place! The music is pleasing to the overall environment!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: OMG chef Antonia Lofaso you're AMAZING, we absolutely love Scoppa and our first time at DAMA. Wow every single item on the dinner menu and cocktails was absolutely AMAZING.  This is why you're so special because you focus on perfection.  I mean everything we had was perfect.  Location I'm not crazy about but once you valet and walk to the DAMA it's a different world.  Our amazing friends and us were on a food coma and we couldn't stop eating.  Now let's talk about our amazing waitress Diana, she was extremely professional, hardworking, knowledgeable, courteous, very kind and beautiful kind personality.  I will definitely ask to be seated at Diana's table section.  We enjoyed our various cocktails, appetizers, entrees and coffee and most delicious desserts.  Please enjoy the pictures
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Drinks are delicious. Food was pretty good. We enjoyed the Lamb chops, Empanadas, Aqua Chile, Crispy Potatoes, Calamari, Camarones and Churros for dessert.  Everything was very fresh.  Sat in outside terrace area each time and was decorated nicely and fully covered. Inside reminds me of being transported to Tulum with a full size bar centered.  Food is served tapas style and comes out as ready. Very cute for date night or girls night out.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Tried it for the first time. Everything was very tasty and well seasoned. The service was nice and friendly. Very lovely ambiance.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Love the food drinks and ambience plenty of parking on the street or you can valet. I tried the chicken and steak it was great i forget the names of the appetizers but they didn't disappoint don't hesitate to try DAMA.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Food is delicious and fresh. I totally love the decor and setting! Definitely one of my favorite places. Just wish it wasn't so pricey.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Dama had some tasty dishes, but overall it feels like an Americanized take on Latin American cuisine with a splash of stodginess. The pork big plate was quite scrumptious. The oysters and drinks average. The empanadas felt apart a bit and the arepa was decent, both to me just not dishes meant to be fancy. The environment wasn't much to call home about. The hit was the fluffernutter desert -- hot, textured, crunchy, airy, yum! Not a place I'd return to for the price. The menu itself just didn't come together for us even when selecting dishes.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Located in Downtown Fashion District, DAMA is a popular restaurant and bar. Indoor and outdoor seating is available. There's plenty of seating but I highly suggest you make reservations as this place tends to be busy.My party and I ordered the  Aguachile, Calamari, Empanadas, and cocktail drinks. Our waiter was great, drinks were ok, food was served quickly. The aguachiles were my favorite. They really had a kick to them.The decor is really cute, but parking can be a bit challenging. They do offer valet parking.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: We went for just a snack and drink but were underwhelmed by the service. After not ordering a second round of drinks, we were ignored by the bartender the rest of the night. Once the bill finally came we paid $70 for two Tito Martini's and a side of fries. Should have asked for an itemized receipt, I feel we were up-charged for a more expensive liquor. Unhappy with our experience, not going back.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: The ambiance was very lovely and the food was delicious. I would have given it 5 stars if the service had been better. Our waiter forget one of our main courses and the time between meals was a bit excessive. Other than that, it was a lovely restaurant! I just wish it was in a better location
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Really beautiful place and great service. Unique food options, most of which we really enjoyed!Food we ordered listed in order of preference below (favorite to least)Clam toast (5 stars) - delicious and super unique! LovedAguachile (4.5 stars) - very yummy!Whipped beans (4 stars) - really enjoyedCharred octopus (3.5 stars) - octopus was great but the accompaniments were just ok and kind of overpowered the octopusLamb chops (3 stars) - too charred for us, but sauce was good
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Perfect little spot & good original sandwiches.The staff were welcoming and willing to make my substitutions on my sandwich. & the branding is very appealing! We ate half of our sandwich on the car ride home from LA to the Bay and got full. Ate the other half when we got home, traveled well!I ordered the Pastrami Mami (got it cold) and my boyfriend got the Uncle Nikki. Both packed with meat (no skimping) and veggies, they both get a 9/10. The flavor was solid! Definitely will be back when we are in the area.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Sandwiches are huge. Packed with so much meat,veggies and flavor !I would most definitely recommend pre-ordering as the lines start to get pretty long and wait time is is 50 min ‍-street parking
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food: The Sandwiches are delicious and PACKED with high quality meat/cheese. They have a wide variety of sandwiches to choose from, but you can also customize  your own. The bread/ condiments used are great as well.Service: Good service can't complainAmbiance: Cool Shop with good seating options
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Cool little spot amazing sandwich get the melrose! for cold cut sandwich don't think there better
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food is amazing, tasty and to order. They do get super busy at times so expect a wait during the rush hours.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: If you love sandwiches, you will love Ghost. All I've got to say is, the MELROSE, the MELROSE, the MELROSE.Pros:- The sandwiches are huge and if you upgrade to a larger size, they add more meat on the same size bread.- it's on a Dutch bread and they use Boar Head Meat. I do wish that the bread was warmed up a little but that's a personal preference- Service is always great, friendly and fast- The interior is mint blue so that's funCons:- Parking may be a little tricky sometimes because it's facing the street so you may find meter parking on the side-- but that's LA for you- The shop is extremely small, so seating is limited but they've got benches in the front (just not ideal in the summer)- Head's up, there's no restroomRegardless of these cons, I'd still give Ghost 5 stars. (Ghost also has a Pizza Spot next door)
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Sandwiches here are incredible!!!!! Service great but pretty slow. Mostly because they seem really really busy. So order way ahead.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Great sandwich!  Busy but worth it. A must stop whenever we're in the Melrose area. Taken friends there and they loved it too. Awesome bread. Melrose is the go to sandwich, but the Santa Monica is great too.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: It's better than Jersey Mike's. I don't mean that as an insult Jersey, Mike's is better 99% sandwich places in Los Angeles. This is for sure one of better Italian sandwiches.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Very impressed. The food was of the highest quality. The sandwiches came out fairly quick. Additionally, the atmosphere was excellent- put a smile on our faces as we jammed to various 2000's hits while enjoying our sandwiches. I ordered the Howdy and absolutely loved it. I also had a chance to try the Melrose Sandwich, which was superb, the Phoenix, which i also loved, and even the Veg Out was excellent. Overall, a great experience.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Healthy ramen broth, curry chicken wings, eel rice ball & wine has made the perfect Monday evening.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Tonchin has captured my stomach and heart. This is now one of my favorite places to dine in. Their appetizers are so good! We got the tsukune bun which I think is one of the best buns I've had. We also got the chasu rice ball and kimchi  which are also good. My husband got the classic Tokyo tonkotsu ramen which he enjoyed. I got the Tokyo rich tsukemen which was fantastic. The broth was very rich and the tsukemen noodles were good. I couldn't finish my dish since it pretty heavy.The ambiance is very nice. The service great, however, our food took awhile to come out. All in all, tonchin is one of my now favorite food places.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The original tebasaki wings were perfectly seasoned.The special tsukemen was gritty for better or worse. Wish the dipping soup was hotter in temperatureThe soup for the tonkatsu ramen was authentic pork base, almost like a stand-alone stew type soupThe Tokyo banana was better than expected. It's basically a banana cream pie
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Honestly first time I tried the pork ramen and it was delicious. The broth is a creamy deliciousness with some very thin cut pork which melts in your mouth. We both got the spicy tam tam and the amount of spicy was just right.We also ordered the kimchi mushrooms as an appetizer and even though the order is super small, it was so so good. The dish is cold, the mushrooms are long, cut lengthwise and one will give you a small tasting for two people but really worth trying.The ambiance is very laid back, even though the restaurant looked very elegant at first but it's really nice for a casual evening or even for date night. I'm happy after the French Market, which I was very sad to see go, they made something nice out of it, finally.One portion of ramen was so filling I couldn't finish all the broth.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Place was great and found street parking. Loved the chicken wings! But when we were trying to decide what kind of ramen and shaved ice should we get, the waitress just said everything was good. That was not very convincing but we managed.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: For ramen, this is one of the better spots I've tried recently in the city. It has a stylish vibe with a cool bar. The tan tan ramen was delicious and the presentation was on point. Their mango ice was also tasty and refreshing for a dessert.My waiter was super friendly and went out of his way to be personable to us. I'd definitely come back here again!
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food here is incredible! Beautiful ambiance as well. Great location, and creative bartenders.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: My favorite of the night was the spicy maguro. It's a DIY hand roll and I like that you wrap it in the lettuce and seaweed. They mix it in front of you and I appreciate that they ask how much of the spicy mayo you want in it. The pickled radish bits add just another level to the texture I loved.The spicy tan tan ramen was solid. A bit spicy for me if I was going to have the whole bowl to myself. I'm eager to go back to try their other ramens because I loved the texture of the noodles and the thinly sliced pork.The kimchi mushroom was delicious, packed a good amount of heat. A bit expensive for the amount given.Unagi rice roll had a nice smoky flavor. I think something was missing flavor wise.For desert we got the mango shaved ice. The topping of honey cream was so so so good and the texture of the shaved ice was nice and soft. Sadly, the mango inside was not sweet at all.The orange sake highball and paper plane were pretty good. I had wanted to get a skin contact wine and they were nice enough to offer a taste of it and thank goodness they did because I did not enjoy it at all. Ended up getting a different drink.Ambience was a 10/10. Service was inconsistent and on the slow side but everyone was really nice. We were able to find parking in the neighborhoods. Price is a bit high but the food is solid and ambience is really great. I would go back but it won't be my go to for ramen joint.
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: On the pricier side for ramen, but overall the food was really good.-1 star for the extremely slow service.I stopped by for dinner on a weekend and got to try their chicken wings, unagi hand roll, pork buns, and ramen.We ended up spending over $140 for two, which I thought was a bit much just for ramen since I'm used to ramen being under $10 in Tokyo.Definitely worth a try if you're in the area :)
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Oh God this place is great. If you happen to be a vegetarian, the miso ramen is mind-blowingly flavorful. My only disappointment is they don't do take out!
Address: 5665 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: food was excellent & service was fast and exceptional! definitely coming back! loved it
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great fried chicken! No wait on a Wednesday at noon for two. They were  busy, but it is a huge space and there was plenty of room.Total $49.71 including tax & tip for 2 entrees, 1 side.* 2 Piece & a Waffle ($16) - 4 starsFantastic juicy yet crispy fried chicken. The waffle is on the thinner side, but it was good with the maple syrup and (strawberry?) butter.* Fried Chicken ($17) - 4.5 starsSame fantastic fried chicken. My friend who got this dish said this was the best fried chicken she's ever had (but also she was very hungry).* Charred Okra w/ Bacon ($6) - 3 starsOn the sour side, and a few pieces of okra were super fibrous-y and I couldn't bite through our cut them, which was frustrating. The rest of the okra were soft with a light crisp. The very crunchy savory bacon was a nice contrast.* Candied Yams ($6, but this came with the Fried Chicken) - 3 starsFine, nice flavor, could have maybe been softer.* Collard Greens ($6, but this came with the Fried Chicken)I tried a bite, I generally don't like collard greens so I feel like I can't accurately rate this. My friend enjoyed it.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: The food was amazing! I sat at the bar and the bartender was the most friendly and beautiful soul I have ever met!  I was traveling for a work conference and stopped in for lunch and a drink.  It's my 8th time this year in DTLA, first time trying this place. Fixins Soul Kitchen is top notch! I lived in Gulfport MS for years and this is the closest I've found to Real Soul Food! Great drinks, great food, great staff!!
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Servive is great. Very attentive and sweet staff.Make a reservation, we did.Get the Catfish nuggets and deviled eggs as an appetizer.Came here on a Thursday. There were five of us, we planned ahead and made a reservation. I got the smothered chicken which was delicious. The Yams were perfect, just sweet enough and the Mac and Cheese was excellent.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Ladies and gentlemen, if you're looking for authentic soul, food, and some of the best fried chicken and oxtail around, you have to visit this restaurant. We were blown away by the customer service, and the food was excellent. They have a great cocktail program, with interesting things to try. we sat out on the patio where it was a little quieter, but you can tell people love to come here to celebrate. The DJ was an excellent perk! We didn't have reservations, but they got us in right away. You can tell they care about the quality of the food and the environment. Put this on your bucket list.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I ordered the catfish, Mac, potato salad, and greens. I actually loved all of the sides but did not care for the catfish. I could still taste raw batter and the seasoning was very bland.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Everything about this place was perfect the food was amazing the vibes was all positive and the DJ was showing out
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Really enjoyed the food and the vibes. Food was seasoned just right. Can't wait to go backTo try other things.y friends love the fried chicken and the gumbo.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Ambience is a vibe, good customer service and food was good... One of the best soul food places i've been too in Cali!!
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I'm "Fixin" to tell you how awesome this place is! We were staying near the area for a conference and this spot popped up on my Yelp so we had to try it because Soul food is my favorite! It did not disappoint. This is the real deal! The food comes out quickly as well and the service is super friendly.We ordered the smothered chicken with a side of Mac and cheese and fries and the catfish with a side of red beans and rice and greens. The chicken is crispy and moist all in one - perfect. The catfish is crispy and tender - perfect.  The sides are...yep, you guessed it - perfect!You get what you pay for and "perfect" must cost a lot, but not at Fixins.  Prices are very reasonable. Considering the price of other places, inflation, and it's location - it was not expensive at all.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A150 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: The food is still pretty amazing. The service is basically trash. They should be ashamed of themselves. Our server Isabel was terrible.We have come here 1-2 times a year for the last 7 years. In that time we have grown accustomed to Bestia being the standard for exceptional food and service.Tragically it is a shell of what it once was.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: Came to bestia for a date night and I was not disappointed! Parking was quite easy which is always tricky in DTLA we parked on the street but they do offer vallet parking as well. Great ambiance, the music really set the tone for our date.. Our server was the best and he definitely made our experience great. The food was absolutely delicious. We started off w/ an order of cocktails that were tasty. We ordered the spicy prawns for an appetizer, this dish is definitely for seafood lovers and the spice was just right! The prawns were juicy and just divine! For dinner we ordered the spicy lamb sausage pizza which was amazing! Definitely recommend trying out the pizzas at Bestia. Now the star of the show was the Roasted Marrow Bone w/ spinach gnoccheti, this was by far the best dish I've had. It's just one of those dishes that you NEED to try. We finished off our night with another round of cocktails and some dessert. My bf ordered the peaches and cream macaroon dessert, and I had the olive oil cake with frozen sherbet shavings of melon and ice cream. I am still thinking about that olive oil cake. I will definitely be coming back to Bestia, it was a 10/10
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: Wow. This is one of the best restaurants in La and guaranteed to have one of the best meals out here. Great vibes, I love the fact that from the outside looking in, you'd have no clue it's an amazing restaurant... no sign out side makes it feel kinda like your about to enter a Brooklyn warehouse party or a speak easy... I definitely got warehouse vibes inside too.. and I dug every second of it, not the comfiest of chairs when sitting on the high top... granted I'm 6'3. The food was lights out amazing, the pizza was unreal, light and airy crust, explosion of flavors with every bite. Best pork chop, I've ever had in my life.. and wow that scallop crudo was a bite that u wish to have again. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, get lots of it and share it all!
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: My fiancé and I have been wanting to try Bestia for a very long time. Personally for me, this was in the works ever since I saw a video with the owners from Guisados touring certain restaurants in LA and they stopped by Bestia. Full circle moment for me.I say that to say that the food did not disappoint. We ordered the Herb cesar salad, ricotta, gnocchi pasta, sausage pizza, and the cavatelli pasta.  I had three drinks and price was really good!Service was good; our server was busy but given the status of the restaurant it was super busy for a Tuesday night.One of the managers came by to celebrate our engagement! They brought us the peaches dessert which was amazing! All in all; freaking delicious and I highly recommend this place.Parking: Pay for valet, if you're going to eat here just pay for the valet. Not much street parking here.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: We'd been waiting a very long time to try Bestia and we finally got around to it on a special occasion.We started with drinks:Little silver cross. 5/5 Possibly the best tasting cocktail either of us have ever had. Perfectly balanced. Not too sweet and oh so ever smooth because of the Japanese whiskey.Ginger beer. 4/5 Really delicious and refreshing even without alcohol.Appetizers:Herb Cesar salad. 5/5 The perfect cesar salad with an outstanding dressing and a mix of romaine hearts and endives. Big enough to share but we could have each gotten one because it was so good.Tuna panzanella. 3/5 Like a mini poke salad with croutons. Pretty good.Pizzas:Guanciale. 5/5 A perfect pizza. Up there in level of deliciousness with Pizzeria Mozza's fennel sausage. The Guanciale bits are crisp and salty and really balance well with the creamy smooth cheese.Burrata. 5/5 Another winner with a flavor pop in each bite from the castelvetrano olives,The crusts of the pizzas are less crisp than some other Neapolitan pizzas and more airy and soft... reminiscent of a perfectly executed naan.Pastas.Squid ink spaghetti with crab. 4/5 Tender morsels of crab with very al dente thin spaghetti in a slightly briny sauce. Very balanced and flavorful.Ricotta gnocchi. 3/5 Perfectly textured gnocchi with a tomato sauce that you dip into their super creamy Burrata. The flavor reminded me of chef boyardee in only the best and most nostalgic way.Desserts:Chiffon cake with seared plums, nectarines and crème fraiche. 4/5 Delightfully light.Chocolate budino tart. 4/5 Well-balanced chocolate with salted caramel that isn't too sweet or overpowering.Service 5/5Cost/value 3/5. Very expensive but worth it for a special treat.Overall 4/5. Would definitely return for just the drinks and pizzas.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: The Roasted Bone Marrow was a rich and indulgent appetizer that perfectly complemented the main course. The marrow was buttery and decadent, spreading effortlessly over warm, crusty bread. The accompanying garnishes added an extra layer of complexity to this dish. While not the star, it was certainly a memorable supporting act.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: Service was excellent.  The waiter was friendly and attentive.Ambiance was loud and noisy.  Our table was 15 feet from the open kitchen.  Through out the night, we heard frequent screaming and yelling from the kitchen staff.  Since Bestia is not located in the best neighborhood, the screaming was a bit unnerving.Food in general ranges from good to excellent.  Beef tartar and scallop were excellent.  Among the 3 restaurants (Saffy's, Bavel and Bestia), Bestia's food places third.  Their pasta was not as good as Uovo (Pasadena).  The pork chop was tasty but a tad overcooked.  Bistro 45's pork chop got theirs beat with ease.  Saffy's got the best food, and Bavel is a close 2nd.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: Recently went to Bestia for dinner.The place was very busy. Food was excellent with lots of variety. Their pastas and appetizers were really good. Rustic look gives a really nice ambiance.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: My family is the biggest Bestia fan. We go constantly and adore the food. Ambiance is amazing too. No doubt that this is one of the best restaurants in Los Angeles. Tonight we went and had the absolute WORST server of all time (coming from someone who worked the service industry). Her name was Berenice and she took 20 minutes to touch out table. She was not apologetic. Second, we ask her for recommendations and she simply picks out the most expensive things on the menu. She literally walked away mid order to give someone else the bill. She constantly forgot dishes and my moms wine. She gave horrible food descriptions and told us we had a perfect amount of food when we significantly over ordered. I am so appalled by the treatment and service of this woman. I hope to not see her there again.
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: Going to Bestia feels like getting nickel and dimed every way you turn.The food is tasty, of course, but the portions are tiny. I was shocked when my $38 pasta dish had around 20 pieces of tiny, .75 inch ravioli. Sadly, Bestia is the kind of restaurant where you spend $200 on food only to pickup Chipotle on the way home.The drink I ordered, the old fashioned, was a $19 bland liquid with a weak pour.At the end, the bill includes a 4% "service charge" that isn't a tip.The bill also lies about the subtotal. They add the service charge and tax BEFORE asking you to tip. It's a subtle, scummy way to get you to overtip.Parking is a nightmare unless you pay for $12 valet.If money is no object, give Bestia a try! But if you want some semblance of value please-- take your business elsewhere
Address: 2121 E 7th Pl Los Angeles, CA 90021

Comment: i've been coming to this place for a few months now and never had a problem, but a few weeks ago one of the staff got upset at my party over a misunderstanding while we were being seated. we apologized and i thought everything had been resolved, but ever since then when we come in we get terrible service- ignored, plates dropped on our table spilling food everywhere, "forgetting" to bring out drinks and then charging us for them anyway, etc. i've worked in food service for years and know that people have off days, but this has happened about three times so i'm starting to think it's a personal vendetta because of that first incident. i really want to keep coming here because the food is sooooo good, but the servers are making it hard to!
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Can't get enough of this place!!! The pasta is just so good. The service is quick which is great. Each order come with a side salad and fresh bread, always a plus! Everyone we take here love it
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I'm so happy I finally got to check out this restaurant as it's been on my bucket list for a while. The restaurant is a pretty cramped and you're seated directly next to another party. It is pretty busy so you don't have your own server who checks on your table often. If you need something you have to flag them down. That aside though, I loved the food and it did not let me down!! My friends and I ordered the Uni cream pasta and the bacon, eggplant, mozzarella pasta. The tomato based pasta was deliciously smokey and the pasta was cooked al dente, it was truly a dish to rave about. The Uni pasta was slightly less exciting, while the pasta and sauce was delicious, the single piece of uni threw me off. It was warm and very pungent, the dish could have done without it. Maybe it's just me and I don't like warm uni, but it was a strange experience. That said, the uni pasta was still my favorite because the sauce was just splendid. I want to come back and try the other pasta dishes next time.
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: The pasta was a nice twist to what my friends and I are used to. The squid ink was delicious, but be caution if wearing any light colors! Overall delicious food and friendly staff!
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I love this place! the service and the value is A1!I just with they have normal spaghetti noodle option instead of the thin noodles they use.
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Came here for a quick dinner after a long day of walking around, and with about a 20 minute wait, I was seated promptly in between a table tightly fitted between two parties. Service was curt and a bit rushed, because I think I'd arrived near closing time and was part of their last batch of customers.If you order a pasta, you're served with a basic white bread roll with a pad of butter, as well as a side salad with a typical vinaigrette. The seafood pasta wasn't anything to write home about, I mean it was delicious but I think I could honestly make it at home. The mentai pasta had a great creamy, umami flavor from the butter and mushrooms that I enjoyed, however I don't think I'd be able to have the entire dish as it'd get too rich.I don't really like the ambiance here because I prefer less bustling restaurants, and because you're seated so closely next to others, other parties can hear your conversations relatively easily so just be mindful of that. If you're looking for an intimate date spot, I would not recommend this establishment. It's good for what it is, but I've had better!
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Love this place. Their food is SO good. Ordered the Jidori Chicken Gizzard Confit and Creamy Crab Meat Gratin as appetizers. For pasta, we ordered the Uni Pasta and Beef Ragu Sauce Spaghetti.I thought the Uni Pasta would be my favorite, but I enjoyed the Beef Ragu so much more which is saying a lot because I typically don't like red sauce pastas!!!The ambiance is very cozy and the service is great and friendly. I always recommend this place to people, and the wait's not that bad (worth it for the good food).
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Bomb!!!! Too good, must have!!! The service was amazing and the food and wine recommendations were good.
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: This place is definitely worth trying! It's a small, cute little restaurant with a cozy vibe. Food did not disappoint as the flavors of the pastas were delicious. Service was friendly & efficient.
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Service is nice. Great staff. Pasta is dry AF. Uni is not fresh. I got slightly sick from it. I gave them three chances to redeem. Pasta is also not al dente.
Address: 432 E 2nd St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Service was fantastic- except when my drink sat at someone else's table for about 5 minutes before the waited noticed it was on someone else's table and it was moved over to me. . Took patio seating at a 5pm reservation, roof was opened about 10 minutes in and it was lovely to eat semi Al fresco. The agnolotti was so delicious it barely sat on my plate for more than 3 minutes. The crème brûlée, though not traditional in presentation still had every element you look for in a creme brûlée and the sorbet on top paired very well. The music was low enough to speak over and the decor was elegant without being gaudy. Variety of people , couples, colleagues, friends, family, you and old and everyone was enjoying their meal it seemed. The drink was seasonal and while labeled as a medium bodied, I found it a little light and too sweet for my taste but never the less it was a great drink. Would definitely come back
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Spago Beverly Hills is an absolute culinary gem. The menu is a masterful fusion of flavors, and every dish is a work of art. The ambiance is sophisticated yet inviting, creating the perfect setting for a special occasion or a memorable night out. The attention to detail in both the cuisine and service is exceptional, making Spago a top choice for those seeking a truly remarkable dining experience.
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Spago is amazing. 10/10. It's consistently great throughout the whole dine in experience. Will def come back!
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: The team really did a great job in making my birthday dinner of 14 guests a  great success. The beautiful dinning area they set up was perfectly decorated. This was a last min reservation and they pulled everything together seamlessly. My guest and I are still raving about the food and service . Best part is have Wolfgang  come by to say hello and wish me a happy birthday.  Thank you to the entire Spago team. This is one of my go to spots in Beverly Hills.
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Everything you'd expect and if you're lucky maybe you'll get more. Beverly Hills Vibe
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: I was invited to join my friends for girlsnight out. The staff was friendly and very attentive.  The food was delicious, and I enjoyed every bite of the portion that I was able to share, starting  with my salad. The rest of my meal was equally delicious. The New York Steak.  The drinks were great and I would definitely recommend them for a first date because of the atmosphere and also a place to empress your business partners or friends.
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: All-time LA favorite. A perfect menu, impeccable service, gorgeous atmosphere. Meets the highest bar across the board!
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Absolutely perfect! I've been a fan of Wolfgang Puck and all his restaurants. He is not like Gordon where he is just about the fame and the restaurants are lacking. Every restaurant I've been to the Wolfgang owns is amazing from the moment you walk in to the time you walk out.The service was excellent, but the food  outdid itself! Everything we order was delish and just full of flavor!When it comes to the ambiance the restaurant was full, the decor was modern, the staff were high energy and very observant.Even though everything was already perfect we got the best surprise ever! Wolfgang comes out to say hi! Ahhhhhh I'm literally going nuts! I get to meet the man who admire! It's was just the best night ever!
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Spago is a Los Angeles staple. From the food, the service, to the ambience it is a 5 star experience. The staff is incredibly attentive and thoughtful. The food, especially the pasta, is to DIE for. And lastly the patio is beautiful and secluded and intimate while still feeling like a lively LA experience.Highly recommend!
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Jen made the experience very personable and friendly. She took time to chat and we never felt rushed. It was great to see Wolfgang walk around chatting with the guest and Tobie helped in proving a personal level of service that made our 23rd wedding anniversary all the more special. Thank you to all. Every single detail was well presented.Best, Biviana & Juan Jiménez
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: This once impressive Beverly Hills landmark is now a sad and tired tourist trap.  My trip this evening was a huge disappointment as the entire experience was marred by two large groups of tourists who spoke little or no English and required the full attention of the wait and service staff.  The food was priced as premium, but was average at best.  Despite getting no attention from our waiter, we did have a random busboy come during our meal and try to grab our $170 wagyu steak while we were still eating!!   The risotto was inedible because of poor seasoning and i needed to instruct the waiter that untouched food should elicit the question "was there something wrong with your meal"?   I can deal with the B Team, but this was ridiculous.  Not a good review when the best i can say is that the rest rooms were clean.  No interest in returning to this place.
Address: 176 N Canon Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Very very tasty dumplings and wontons.I ordered the chicken and shrimp spicy wontons. I like how chicken knuckles were in every wonton. Perfect flavor.I would definitely recommend and return. Street parking was easy.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: It's all about the aesthetic here! We were craving some Oriental favs...dumplings and wontons. Well we got the best variations of what this cute little restaurant in Beverly Hills could offer. The atmosphere was ideal 4 stars the service wasn't terrible either 3.5 stars. The food which most of us come for...especially with an appetite because it's DUMPLINGS.... disappointed.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Food is dependable, but truthfully I just get the har gow only because I have a specific obsession. Don't pass on the other menu items. Everything is pretty solid. Would be the most authentic experience but still tasty nonetheless.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Great atmosphere and food.  Love this place.  The comparable places are in chinatown --but definitely not in this area.  They're consistently yummy!!
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Lunch in Beverly Grove, Los Angeles, California...National Bao Day was on 8-22-23...Everything was meant to be...Meeting my Yelp friend, Mikey, in real life just worked out perfectly!Mikey made reservations for noon on the Tuesday before I left to go back home to Honolulu, Hawaii, USA.It was 8-22-23 at Bao Dim Sum House...how appropriate!The free dessert with check-in on the Yelp app was between a choice of two items. We had the Custard BAO!Niki S. and I found metered street parking right in front of the restaurant. We walked into the dimly lit, elegantly decorated restaurant where Mikey and his wife, Kayleen, were already seated. Our mutual friend, Te-See, arrived shortly after.Fernando was our competent and helpful server.  He gave excellent recommendations. We ended up ordering the Pork and Shrimp Shumai,Crispy Cucumber Salad,Crystal Shrimp dumplings,Sautéed green beans with Garlic,Honey Walnut Shrimp, andBao's Chicken wings. Delicious!!!Our free dessert for checking in on our Yelp app was a plate of three custard bao. Fernando cut them all in half so everyone could taste the not-too-sweet treats! Yum!We enjoyed entertaining conversation, excellent food, and great service in a beautiful atmosphere. We're looking forward to returning!Thanks for setting up this meeting, Mikey!See you again soon!Thank you for the personalized chocolate with macadamia nuts!
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: The atmosphere is very nice if you come right before or during happy hour. It started to pick up after happy hour, so it got a little crowded for me. The food was very tasty; the baos and egg rolls were my favorite. The drinks, though, were delicious! will definitely go back again.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Really good. Tasty. Luke was very helpful in explaining the items to us. He and his support were all very attentive.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Extra ordinary options of authentic variety of great selection.Ambience and crowd are great .Very good service and courteous waiters.Will definitely come back for more .Good vibe dim sum.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Really great food, nice service and pleasant interior. Best bao I've had in a while and the xiao long bao was excellent too. Metered street parking outside. The cash price was a few dollars less than for cards. Will return when I'm in the area.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Do you "dim sum?" Cause I am not a huge dim sum fan...However, when someone you adore is in town and another person you adore invites you to join them...ya don't say "NO!"  It's just proper "yelp" etiquette:)But seriously, great place.  Never been here and everything we ordered was very good.  Our server Fernando, and yes, Abba is singing in my head as it is in yours, don't lie....was fabulous.  His menu suggestions were spot on!Today we had:The cucumber salad2 Crystal Shrimp Dumplings2 Honey Crispy ShrimpGreen beans with garlicPork DumplingsThe inside is spacious. Great for groups.  The bar is closer to the entrance and separated from main dining area. *Food came quickly.  Prices here are not cheap.  We shared everything so our lunch the bill was $20 per person including tax & tip.  Not bad!*Check in and get a 1 free dessert for the table.*Here's a tip for free: cash is long here.  You will get a discount when you pay with cash!*Street parking only.  Metered available in front on the side street and 2 hour free parking in the residential area. Please Read The Signs! Avoid a ticket/tow.
Address: 8256 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: It was our first time at Fratelli cafe!Will definitely come again! Food was amazing & our waiter Ocatavio was really friendly! Highly recommend!!!
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: First time coming to Fratelli Cafe. Best customer service! Octavio our waiter was very welcoming & friendly! Food was tasty! I ordered the croissant French toast they were sooooo delicious!! My boyfriend ordered the steak hash & was satisfied! Definitely recommend! A nice simple brunch spot to come & enjoy a good meal!
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Absolutely loved our breakfast here. The food was great and the service was amazing. Octavio and Jason made our day.  They were  swift, efficient, helpful and super nice!
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: I love this establishment. The food, the service, the management is full of heart & consideration!I recommend Fratelli to everyone who doesn't already know about it. If you are not from LA and have family in town--this is a wonderful place to come if you want good food. They are consistent! Highly recommend making reservations because of everything I mentioned before. It's undeniable! No need for me to go into detail--everything is good. Ask for what you'd like.
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The choco croissant was better than expected. My bf got the regular French toast & he was not disappointed (coming from a harsh French toast critic) . The fried chicken was also good. Customer service was very wonderful.
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Great food, coffee, and service. Our server Jason did a great job offering suggestions and keeping our drinks topped off. Will definitely be back.
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Jason was a great host 5/5 food was 4/5. The biscuits & gravy were amazing ! Would definitely come back .
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: This place is so cute.  They promptly seated us and our food came out so quick. It was delicious and octavio was so friendly and make sure we were taken care of! Definitely will be back
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Croissant French ToastScrambled EggsI would definitely recommend doing the waitlist. I did the waitlist for about a 30 minute wait knowing my Uber ride would be under 30 minutes however miraculously the waitlist move pretty quickly so by the time I got there I was removed but the owner or host or whoever was great about it and seated me I think only because I was just me by myself but had a great time, great customer service food was great definitely will return!
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The owner was very welcoming and attended me and my friends in a very professional way. I had a great experience and the food was phenomenal to say the least. Great ambiance as well 10/10 recommend!
Address: 7200 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Wow! From arrival to departure....what a decadent delight. I went with my sister, who is vegetarian, and both of us enjoyed every bite. It was amazing to see food that looked like art. The layers of flavors and textures were incredible. The service was outstanding, and the owner of the restaurant even came out and chatted with us for a little while. I can say it was an honor to eat there and experience that level of quality. You must go to Providence if you are in the LA area, you will not be disappointed!!
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Without a doubt one of the best restaurants in LA. If you admire gastronomy, vast selections of fine wines, and whisky... this is your place!
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I've dined here at least 4-5x over the last few years. It's one of my all time favorite restaurants. If you're looking for an elevated dining experience and appreciate gastronomy, this is your place!
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The best restaurant experience I've ever had in LA, and that's saying something
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I was extremely impressed with Providence from start to finish. The entire dining experience was everything I expected and hoped it would be. Right when you enter you're greeted and they ask for your valet ticket number so your car will be pulled up right when your dinner is done. I genuinely appreciate those extra little fine touches.In total we had 11 courses and I did the additional wine pairing with the meal. I truly enjoyed each course and it felt like a work of art. The wine pairings went well with with each course. Some courses were better than others but all in all I loved the take on each one. The service was impeccable and I really liked the ambiance of the restaurant. I also appreciate they time your courses based on your dining and how quickly you eat.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Where can I start, best food I've ever had! We went for my birthday and staff were very friendly. For our first course we got wagyu and it was great.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: If you're reading this review one of your main questions is: is it worth it? First, each meal is about $300. The wine pairing is about $150. Then, there are the upgrades. Tax. And tip. So if you do the simple addition you can see you'll spend a lot of money on your meal. So is it worth it? Well, let me say it is by far the most I have ever spent on one meal. By far! So go in with your eyes open. But was it worth it? Unequivocally yes! It's not just the food it's the experience. If you watch The Bear you know that restaurants like Providence seek to give you a full experience because they know you're spending a lot of money. The food alone was excellent. Starting with the amuse bouche which was so good I didn't know how they would top it. But they did. Each course explained. The servers seamlessly tagged teamed our dining experience. I don't drink so while my wife had her wine pairings they were kind enough to set up mocktail pairings for me, which I don't think they'd done before. There were certain food I didn't care for. I went with most of it but they were really clear that they want you to so speak up and ask for what you need and want. (But don't be a d$@& about it ) As one of our servers said, "Here, we want you to say something. Always say something. It is not your job to fit into our experience. It is our job to fit into your experience." As someone who has been called high maintenance that was honestly really nice to hear. Everything was good. You get to take your time enjoying the meal and enjoying your company. It was our twenty year anniversary and it was a great way to begin to celebrate it! And here is the cherry on top: I forgot my business card there. At first they couldn't find it but Sarah looked a second time after we looked everywhere and she found it tucked into the bottom of the bill holder. That alone was above and beyond. But then they did not simply say come get when you can they asked where I lived and checked to see if someone might be able to drop it off! Drop it off at my house. Are you kidding me? Well, they did. It would have been a two hour trip with traffic for me to get it and I was leaving for business the next day. Who does that? Providence does. So if you want to have a special experience with amazing food and are willing to invest in it I highly recommend giving yourself the gift of Providence, at least once.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Providence was a very solid dinner experience with friendly and knowledgeable servers. The restaurant is fairly dark inside but each table has its own lamp, which adds a very intimate vibe. We found free street parking near the dmv about a block away but there is valet parking available too.We started the meal with two cocktails. I forgot what they were, but one had watermelon and the other had honey from the beehive on the second floor. Both were good and not too sweet. From the add-ons, we got uni egg with caviar which was a bit salty (most likely due to the caviar) but delicious, along with the rabbit tortellini which was good but could use some more flavor.For the main dinner menu, the amuse bouche was a great start with shiso wrapped tuna and several other small bites. We both loved the shima aji, but everything else lacked a similar wow factor. However, we both did not like the bread service. Compared to some other fine dining restaurants, the crust here was very hard to chew and might poke the inside of your mouth if you try to bite off the corner so be wary of that.We got the swordfish and the duck for the entrees. The swordfish was soft but didn't have a whole lot of flavor, but this was also my first time eating swordfish so I don't have anything to compare it with. However, we've eaten duck multiple times and the one here was good but not great. It was cooked well but the sauce could also use more flavor and salt.Onto dessert, the mango one was like a sorbet and tasted really good. Very fresh and flavorful mango. The chocolate dessert tasted somewhat like haagan daz which is a good thing, but needed more of the ice cream to balance out the chocolate. Then finally, there were a couple small bites and sweet coffee  to end the night.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This place is hands down the most interesting culinary experience I've ever had. I was skeptical about the small portions of the food for the Michelin star prices, but the very first bite I had...it was such a burst of delicious flavors and it made sense. And it just kept coming and coming. We got the tasting menu and drinks from reserve. It was absolutely delicious. Everything was so perfectly curated and the vibe of the place was cool - it's soft and quiet. Haven't had many other Michelin star restaurants in LA, but this one deserves all of the hype. If you have the opportunity to go here, go and get the tasting menu and allow them to cook everything the way the chef recommends.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: What can you say that hasn't already been said (including by me) about Providence.  The meal was an unforgettable experience and the service was impeccable.  Providence is an exceptional Michelin dining experience.  From the delicate and tantalizing amuse-bouche to the rich and decorative desserts, you will be awestruck.  Bravo to the best fine dining experience in Los Angeles.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: By far, the best meal I've had at a fine dining restaurant in LA. Sophisticated, complex flavors and textures that worked so well together. We did the Providence tasting menu and every dish was regrettably over too soon. I will return and I will unabashedly recommend.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Beyond amazing. A proper high level restaurant. Everything is exquisite. Impeccable service and food is simply exceptional. We went for our anniversary, perfect ambience and best memory!
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Finally made it in person and had a great experience.  I sat at the bar, which is not recommended if you expect more formal service, but I didn't mind it as a solo diner.  The bartender was fantastic and every dish was amazing.  Can't wait to go back.
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Amazing!! Their current take-out is a must.  I live right around the corner and have always wanted to try Providence but hadn't had the opportunity to before the pandemic hit.  I was excited to hear that they started take-home meals and have been following all of the exciting culinary journeys each week.  Yesterday, I finally had the chance to pick up a meal during the New Orleans theme and it was well worth the wait.  Everything was beautifully packaged, easy to assemble and delicious.  Can't wait to try again!
Address: 5955 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I came here for brunch with a friend during Labor Day weekend. We had 9:45 AM reservations and were seated immediately.It is a beautiful restaurant inside of a hotel. Honestly breathtaking.We ordered eggs Benedict with crab, fruit plate and, lime breakfast with sausage. The food was pretty good. I thought the crab was a bit salty and $14 is a lot for a small plate of fruit.All in all, i would come back. Beautiful views and pretty good food.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: very cute greenhouse scenery and food was pretty good as well! i ordered the poke tuna and it delicious  the service was great as well and wasn't too crowded
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Well the first time being there fell short BUT the manager CHANCE said come back we will do better. And he kept his word food and service was spot on. We will be back
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I gave them a credit card to make a reservation for eight people for breakfast. We were seated in the greenhouse. It was a warm day and everyone was dressed in light clothing but the greenhouse was over airconditioned. I heard someone in another party say "It's chilly in here!"We ordered breakfast and my plain black coffee took a long time to arrive. When it finally came ($ 7.00!), it was barely lukewarm. I told the wait person and after a long time, I received what I believe was the same coffee that had been heated in a microwave. Most of the food was pretty good but not worth the exorbitant price.When we received the bill, we gave them two credit cards and told them to split it in half. A few days later, I looked online and saw that I had been charged the total amount. My niece told me that she was charged half. I called them and a rather nasty man answered and said he couldn't trace it unless someone returned to the restaurant with a receipt. I filed a claim with my credit card company and the restaurant withdrew the charge on my niece's card, instead of charging me half. I wound up being charged for the whole bill while my niece reimbursed me with Venmo. Very annoying! I would NEVER go back.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Came here for a girls day brunch! Found this place on TikTok. We had a reservation and were seated quickly.Very beautiful, not too crowded, and service was good. Only downside was the parking-- as it's apart of a hotel, we had to park a block away which wasn't much of a hassle.Food was typical. Ordered the french toast, eggs benedict, and avocado toast. Nothing special, but portions were huge. Decently priced. Would visit again when in LA.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: We went here while staying at the LINE. Service was excellent! Waiter was so attentive and responsive. The food was just ok. We went for a brunch and 7/9 of us ordered eggs Benedict. Sadly half the table had eggs that were closer to hard boiled than runny.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I have been wanting to visit this place since I saw it on one of the episodes of Someone Feed Phil.  I was surprised on how much smaller it was in person.  It is such a cute eatery cafe type place.  We ordered avocado toast and the tuna tartar, both very good.  It was pretty pricey though I thought for the 2 orders of the toast and the tuna & 3 oj's ($122) plus there's a health wellness charge of 4% added to the check ( I read that if you ask they will remove it).  Other than that I'll consider returning but maybe just for some coffee and their cinnamon roll.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Absolutely disappointed with my experience at Openaire :( It was my first time here and I was excited to try it. It has a gorgeous ambience with the greenery and I love how the pool is right outside. However, everything else was terrible.I made a reservation on OpenTable for 1:15pm and we arrived around 1pm. They kept telling us our table would be ready about 4 times and we were finally seated at 1:45pm. It took 15minutes for the server to give menus. Everything just went downhill. We even ordered drinks at the pool since the server was taking forever to get our order. The server finally took our order...The food was NOT good, we all ordered rice bowls and all my friends said it was salty and unappetizing. It was not an enjoyable meal, nobody finished their food. The frozen drinks at the pool were good and I also ordered the midnight margarita which was good too.I'm not sure if the food is better during breakfast or dinner, but the lunch was unappetizing. Overall, 1 star for the pretty ambience other than that I have nothing good to say about Openaire. Very disappointed.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Every single thing that we tried, we loved! I cannot believe that I waited for so long to try this place! I can't wait to come back to try the brunch! The waiter was so helpful and did great recommendations! We try the ricotta fritters, tuna tartare, the kale salad (with peaches, it was amazing) and the albacore (one of the best I ever tried) all the flavor and textures combine perfectly! The dessert was another staple! Chocolate cake and dolce de leite ice cream!
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: A late review but I had such an amazing birthday brunch here. The servers were so accommodating and attentive, the decor and ambience was my favorite part being a plant lover myself. I would definitely recommend reservations for secure seating!
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Long over due post.... Really wanted to like this place but the service was so miserable. Our waiter was so so so rude it was really disappointing. Left still hungry and had such a bad experience. Almost everything we wanted was not available, it wasn't that busy when we went and our food took so long to come out. Waiter checked up on us once to give the check and that was it... we were super patient, polite, but yah so many better places in the area!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Saffy's is fantastic all around. Food is to die for and I will be dreaming about that red snapper for weeks. Can't go wrong with the skewers. And the sauces? I could drink. Staff is top notch. We were seated outside but it was a bit chilly and the host kindly moved us to the bar cause tables were going to take a while. But Chris made us feel very welcome and explained the menu so well. Drinks are killer as well. Had the sour and a Collins and could've kept going but they strong lol also had a great wine pairing for our snapper. Also can NOT forget to mention how beautifully simple yet elegant the design of this restaurant and bar is. Can not recommend this place enough but obviously go here hungry and ready to drop some dough.All worth it and will be back!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Saffy's is Bavel's sister restaurant that takes a more casual approach. Wonderful, delicious food, but service when we went was pretty mediocre and ambiance was just okay.Every single dish we tried though was delicious and we were impressed by the quality and execution. Especially loved the lobster kebab (so unique and great flavor) and the beef kebab and beef shislik. The kebab was visually more the traditional beef kebab you'd expect but the quality was more like a high grade steak and so juicy and yummy. The shislik was made from ground beef and heavily seasoned in the best way and had a unique flavor. The two contrasted each other nicely, and we loved the laffa (super fluffy but chewy) and the sauces that were served alongside the meat. Really enjoyed how flavorful everything was and the slight kick of heat found in the food/sauces.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We had the best experience! Service was so kind, food was amazing, drinks also delicious, be prepared to make this a splurge dinner but the food and drink was quality. Can't wait to try their other restaurants after this night!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food was great quality but very slow service with poor communication between the kitchen and the wait staff.Even with a reservation we waited at least 20 minutes to be seated, which was fine. Our food came out so slowly that my friend canceled his order and ended up eating some of our food.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: INSANE INSANE INSANE !!! This is the best restaurant I have been to in years. I kid you not.  We ordered about 6 items and were licking the plates.  The food is sublime, delicious, ridiculously good!!!OMG !!! And the banana cake is made for royals.  It's exquisite.  Our waiter Jessie was absolutely lovely and terrific. The bus staff were so sweet. The service is seamless and swift.  The room is buzzing and beautifully appointed.  This is now my favorite restaurant in America.Congratulations to the husband and wife team who have created a very special thing.  I may go back this week.I want all my friends to try it.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Incredible food. Truly a culinary experience! Would definitely come back many many times
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: There's nothing I ordered that I wouldn't love to eat again!! Bustling atmosphere! Loud environment, so much so it was a little hard to chat, but even so the food was worth it!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: I came here for a birthday dinner, and had an amazing time. The service and wait staff were top notch. The ambiance was also very hip, energetic, and lively. The food was also decadent. I particularly loved the hummus ful - which came with such soft and fluffy pita bread. The lamb kebab was also tender and moist as well. The green falafel was also savory. The favorite that was recommended was the red snapper, which was tasty and not overwhelmingly fishy. Finally, we finished the night with banana cake, which was soft, spongy, and not too sweet. Would recommend for a date night or nice occasion to anyone looking for a special event!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This was my second time going to Saffy's and man, it doesn't disappoint. The service is always top notch, the decor is modern art deco, and the food!! Everything we ate was impressive to say the least. Smaller portions so the richness does not over whelm. The cocktails are all curated to enhance the flavors.Could be dog friendly if you request a table outside.I asked about the service charge and my waiter said they are receiving healthcare.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: The pork ribs are amazing. Tender, flavorful, seasoned to perfection. Highly recommended
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Favorite new spot in the neighborhood. Naengmyeon is perfect. Lovely folks as well. Bonus points for on site parking that never seems to be full.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Their beef mandus are to die for. I can eat this whole plate by myself.Nyeongmyeon was too sweet for me but the noodles were amazing as they hand pull it themselves.And ive never had cleaner tasting seol lung tang in my life. I think its because the dont use shrimp jutgalOverall amazing!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Good cold noodles and ribs!   The wait wasn't bad on a weeknight.  You can either get valet parking in the lot or look for street parking.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. I think we got there at around 530PM and there were maybe two parties a head of us? We had a party of three and didn't have to wait long.The parking is valet only but it's only $3 so it isn't too horrible.We decided to order a few dishes to share since it was our first time here:Mul naengmyeon combo with kimchi dumplingsSeok pork spare ribLee ga guk bapThe Lee Ga gukbap was super delicious, flavorful, and came out piping out. There were so much meat and veggies in the soup and it went great with rice! It gave me such a homey feeling. Definitely would recommend this!The seok pork spare ribs were very good too! The marinade they used wasn't overly sweet and it was just super delicious! But they do put this on a portable stove at your table so it keeps cooking. The meat may get a bit tough later if you don't turn off the stove.I read an article saying that Lee Ga makes their own naengmyeon noodles. They even have a machine that makes it, which is one of the reasons we got it. The noodles were great -- texture is chewy and bouncy. I feel like the broth was a bit under seasoned? There wasn't much flavor to it and the broth wasn't icy. Maybe it's because we had the gukbap first and the gukbap had so much flavor that the naengmyeon seemed bland.The kimchi dumplings were pretty dry though. I didn't enjoy those as much.Overall, it was a very good meal. I really enjoyed it and wouldn't mind coming back here!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: My boyfriend and I were visiting LA from NYC and stumbled across this amazing Korean restaurant. It had some of the best Korean food we've had, and our server So Young was so kind and helpful. Can't wait to tell all our friends about this place!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The naengmyun!!! Loved that I didn't need to add anything to the bibim naengmyun and I don't think I stopped to eat anything else until I finished the bowl. The noodles were thin, chewy, flavorful, and the sauce was spicy, sweet, slightly tangy. I dropped the dumplings in the leftover sauce and ate them. Dumplings were lacking in flavor, the filling was watery and bland, and did not hold together very well. The oxtail soup, oh man, delicious and enough for 2 people. The broth was rich but not greasy at all, the kimchi was perfect for it soup. Service was good even for being so busy. A little difficult to find seating for more than 4 people, we did have to wait quite some time even though the lunch rush was over. No big deal because the naengmyun was worth it. Prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity. This will be in the book for places to revisit. Delicious!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Of course the food was great and exceptional BUT I wanted to praise the two female servers working on 8/23 lunch time. I took my parents who are in their 80's yesterday for impromptu lunch. What really blew me away was how understanding and caring both servers were. Their service was phenomenal. Thank you both.. you made our family lunch awesome!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I love love naengmyun, korean cold noodles. Prefer the spicy version. Lee ga's were chewy, and generous in portion. I got the combo with 3 huge galbi ribs which was delicious but couldn't finish..taking it home for my dog
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food is really good. We got beef cheek soup, a couple of cold noodle dishes, and dumplings. Portions are big. They give you a lot of meat in their soups. Service was prompt and attentive. Highly recommended and definitely coming back.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005
