Comment: This place was such a good find, the ajumma that was working there was so kind! We got the large combo with cheese fried rice and we destroyed the whole thing. My fav was the large intestines. Def recommend, will be coming again!! Thank youuu :)
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Amazing beef tartar!!! Amazing service. They prepare the food in front of you and the waitress even fed me! Such an authentic Korean restaurant. There is valet parking available
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A unique dining experience with great flavors. Came here with a group of friends and was blown away by the quality and quantity of food you can get from here. Located in the same plaza as some other really popular restaurants, sadly it looks like this place gets overlooked. I would argue this place is one of the better choices in ktown if you like intestines! They are cooked to perfection, perfect balance of crunch and chew. If you were ever hesitant about intestines, here is a great place to start your journey eating through the inside of a pig haha!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: BEST ARMY STEW! Me and my boyfriend ordered an Army stew and a small intestine. Everything is great the ramen, the flavor, the soup. Good portion and great price. We have been to so many place for army stew and most of them have that ramen flavor or seafood taste. But this place, they got it spot on.The korean lady was helpful when she tried showing us how to eat the beef intestine, she also gave us compliments lol cuteThe ambiance is great for group and casual dine in. Valet parking. Walk across the street for boba while you're there
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Small intestine was sooooo good. Also loved the brisket and rice cake dish. Everything was delicious and the staff was so nice :)
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Place is still yummy, still a great value, but the food was slightly worse than last time. Beef brisket, which was sublime, was in slightly smaller quantity in the soup, and the spicy soup base was a little salty. Regular brisket hot noodle soup was flawless. Still, a great value in the area, and I like that the interior is not too loud.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Comically good - because, typical of LA, the place was empty while there were lines to the buzz places next door. The beef brisket is the star, and the soft tofu stew and beef risket soup were just delicious, each tasting different than the other. Bottomless banchan, only a few varieties but particularly good kimchi. Very, very reasonable prices and fine value.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Been there twice a couple of years apart. I really like everything they serve. The soups wether for one or more persons are big portions.This last time I went I had the Korean ramen and it was superb, the noodles and meat were cooked to perfection the soup itself was flavorful, not too spicy but that was ok. My first time all I remember was it was a red soup base as most are but it was very spicy and I cleaned the bowl up.Tried the beef brisket and the pork as well, the brisket was left too long on the hot plate but other than that it was very good and the soup had a very familiar flavor to it like if it was a Hispanic style soup with I enjoyed. We got the fried rice option at the end where they get your left over from the soup and combo it with rice. It's really good. Definitely recommend.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Yelp says they're open till midnight but I got there at 11pm and they were closed. They apparently close at 8. -_- Drive 25 mins for nothing. Please update your hours!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've dined in few times before pandemic and did only to-gos after the pandemic. Either dine in or to-go the food is consistently good. All the servers I've had were nice and when I do to-go there's been same lady helping me at the counter who is so sweet. I will return for dine in once my kids are older enough. They have booths and tables which seems to be clean every time I go in. Haven't dined in in few years so I don't know how their bathroom situation is.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food:  food was accepted or decent at best.  My soft tofu stew with brisket was ok - the brisket was nice and tender but the stew itself was a little too bland for me.  The banchan was probably better than my entree - I liked the pickled radish and fish cake, but they didn't really refill those.Service:  the lady who took our order was nice but didn't back to check on us to see if there was anything else we needed.  And it didn't help either that she didn't speak any English.  Even ordering was difficult.Ambiance:  the inside of the restaurant looks pretty nice  but there were a lot of tables that were not cleaned up with dirty dishes on them when we were there.Overall:  to me this restaurant was skippable.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place is a really diamond hidden in the rough. We just happened to drive by while checking out Historic Filipinotown and I'm glad we did. The people working in there could not have been more friendly or attentive. It's a super small place but was really cozy and smelled amazing inside.But the food! Really great. We had a bunch of things even though it was only 3 of us because everything looked so good. We had the fried chicken, the lechon kawali, the chicken adobo, the pork skewer, the pancit palabok and their filipino menudo.They also gave us some bilo bilo, which was the perfect ending. Can't wait to go there again.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Tita Lina- all the Tita's and Tito's in this restaurant are so sweet! Food is very delicious and I love her turon. Will be coming back here again for Filipino cravings!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So so so good. Thought I'd take half home for dinner but had to finish the whole meal right there! Definitely get the ground pork stew with quail eggs
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I ordered 100 lumpia shanghai for $50 for a party.I placed my order a week in advance and was able to pick it up 30 minutes before closing at 5PM.Great catering and a party pleaser!  Good crisp, nice filling and lots of dipping sauce!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food here is always fresh and delicious.  The service is friendly.  The portions are generous.  I will detour to this location when I want amazing, home style Filipino food.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Food is bomb! I'm filipino and Kapampangan, So yeah I know a lot about culinary and all I have to say is this is some authentic amazing Filipino food! Stopped by here coming home to the Bay Area from a Disneyland trip, and the food was super good. My wife and kids liked it too, service was great, very helpful staff. This will Forsure be on our stops whenever we go to LA
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This is a basically counter buffet. You point at the food that look most appetizing. It's Filipino.food. When I get nostalgic, I go to take home the food I like. Perfect for a 1 person household. My favorite is the deep fried pork rind.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This place is a heck yeah!I had  just finished my appointment downtown and I had not eaten Filipino food in awhile, so I looked up a fast turo-turo place.  I did not have any expectations  but I sure will come back!  Aside from being cheap-$13 for a double combo and was not greasy.  I had the ukoy ,dinuguaan, and a turon and it was gooood!Plus,  they give you a lot of food...so worth the money!!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ive been living here for 42 years and Im so glad Tita Lina is in the neighborhood. They have great filipino food and the staff is very friendly.Ive met Tita Lina and shes a wonderful person.May God bless her restaurant and her staff.Loyal guest,Ferdinand L. "Ferdie"
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Nice staff, huge portions, and a great price BUT if you have any food allergies or dietary restrictions i suggest avoiding this place. Otherwise if you can eat anything it is worth a visit.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: this place is so dank!the ambiance is immaculate, a great spot for big groups or date nightfood is so fire, they gave us free food on the house cus we're cute or sumn :3they have a LARGE alcohol menu, including hard liquor and cocktails as wellthey also give free soft drinks & mock tails for designated drivers which i think is super coolmy friends and i ordered sm food.. we got 2 of everything: the steamed egg, johnson budae stew, stir fried octopus, bossam, and pa dakall the food was absolutely delicious!!!! the steamed egg and johnson budae stew was my favorite. but literally everything tasted amazing. like i couldn't stop drinking the soupydefinitely a great vibe here, service was great! they were super accommodating for our big sized party and gave us free dranks & bottles of soju on the house xDhighly highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice spot to drink and eatthere's a parking structure located within the building and they offer free validation too
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Bacchus Tables is this new Korean pub hotspot in LA.  This Kpub-Pocha is a total vibe! Filled with good music, K-pop videos, large screens, neon lights, booth seating, cocktail bar, and a fun vibe to dance, drink and eat with friends. What a fun place!They serve a variety of signature K-cocktails, fruity slush drinks, soju, sake, beer, rice wine and more. The menu is vast and there's so many good things to order from Asian fusion dishes to authentic Korean food. We were seriously blown away at how good the food was! Every dish was well prepared and presentation and taste were all on point. The drinks were yummy too! Definitely a great place to hang out with friends or go eat/drink late night since it's open until 1am daily (2am on weekends). There's not a lot of good food places late night, but this is one def one of them.What we ordered:- Smoked Salmon Appetizer - Omg smoked in-house and delicious!!! Must order.- Korean Fried Chicken Wings- Pork Belly Bossam - Very well done dish! Delicious.- Seafood Pancake- Pineapple Kimchee Fried Rice with Cheese - Yumm!- Johnson Tang Soup Stew - Very good! Shareable.- Mayo Shrimp - Similar to prawns w/honey walnut- Wangkalbi - Giant Beef Bone Kalbi. WOW! So tender and tasty.What a wonderful night with great friends, delicious food, and friendly service. The owners are so sweet and gave us great service and food recommendations. We'll definitely be back.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: My favorite pocha in k-town! Food is on POINT, service was super attentive, and ambiance was great (I personally loved all the figures used as decor)If you're looking for a nice place to eat and drink with friends this is the spot for you! I would even come here just for the food that's how good it was! We got the jokbal and pineapple kimchi fried rice, huge portions!! We left satisfied and filled to the brim!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I'm giving two stars for the ambiance and if you want a lounge. However, I came for the food and was famished and was super disappointed with the speed of the food coming out and taste.We had fried chicken, odeng soup, dduk bok gi, and jae yuk lettuce wraps with rice. Everything was just okay. The ddukbokgi was bad, and didn't look like anything in the photos.Overall, come if you wanna drink with your friends and want to pick at food. Not for dinner.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Newly open Korean food spot that you must try! It's perfect to come with friends for some drinks and unique dishes! I love the spicy chicken feet! Lol Prices are reasonable too !
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Decided to go here on a whim with a group of 10+ and the entire staff was so accommodating and kind. The fried chicken is one of the best I've ever had - would definitely recommend. The ambience was so welcoming and my group had nothing but good things to say about the service.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This is THE place to go to for a night out in K-town for amazing drinks and food!If you want to go out drinking with your friends at a place with a great vibe and tasty food, then you need to head to Bacchus Tables ! They have it all from fried chicken, to jokbal, to jiggaes, and fried rice! They have a wide variety of cocktails and of course beer and soju as well to pair with your meal. I love the atmosphere here and it's great to come with a big group of friends! They're located in the heart of Koreatown and I highly recommend you stop by if you're ever craving pocha! My favorite was their huge portion of banchan, and their tender wangkalbi. Their house smoked salmon is also tasty as well as their stir fried gizzard!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Love love love this place and the kind people that works here. Hidden gem on the top level of the iconic Brown Derby building at Koreatown. We have been here three times so far and will definitely visit again when we can. Their food is always amazing and fresh. And their service is always exceptional, making us feel very welcomed. Interesting decor, kinda a mix of our kind of quirkiness with robot figures and toys, plus techno or house music. They got a cool DJ booth, too, definitely has the potential to be a great event space.Our repeat order:KBBQ Chicken - Super crispy and juicy fried chicken coated with a delicious sweet and savory sauce. Portion is pretty much about a whole chicken! The breading they used tasted like sweet potato, which I love. 10/10Other things we're tried:Ginja Odengtang, added beef tendon and boiled egg - perfectly seasoned dashi broth soup with fish cakes for late night or cold weather comfort. The beef tendon was very tasty! It comes with a side of house-made pickled daikon, carrot and pickle. And again, the portion is great. It can probably feed 3-4 people. 10/10Johnson Tang (Korean Army Stew), added ramen - yum yum yum! The soup stock is so flavorful! Lots of sausages, ham, kimchi, onion, and topped with cheese. They pre-cooked the ramen to perfection, and put it on a large separate bowl for us so we can dig right in without waiting for the ramen to cook. Whatever sauce they made for the stock is amazing, adding a nice depth to the flavor. Great portion size as usual. 10/10Pork Belly Bossam - tender pork belly slices, yet again perfectly seasoned and great portion size. Love love love the stir-fried kimchi side 10/10House Smoked Salmon Plate - thick slices of smoked salmon topped with shaved lemon peel, diced onion, capers, fresh lemon slices, and a house made dipping sauce. Very yummy! The shaved lemon peel is a very very nice touch. 10/10Karaage Salad - very crispy and juicy fried chicken pieces and salad with a yummy ginger-ish dressing 10/10+ an assortment of beer and liquor, plus delicious soju highball mixed drinks.++ sometimes they give us a side of thin, sweet potato friesIdk, we just love this neighborhood place so much. It's one of our happy places to visit for sure. Highly recommend!!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place might be my favorite new hangout spot in Koreatown. Just had dinner with a friend and everything was great from start to finish. The food was amazing and the portions are surprisingly generous. The service was top notch from start to finish. I live in the neighborhood and I will definitely be back soon! Definitely a great place to check out!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Bacchus tables had an awesome variety of interesting dishes!! We came in a group of 9 people, and the staff were very kind as people trickled in in the span of around an hour before everyone arrived.  The restaurant It is filled with fun, quirky decorations and fun music (lots of blackpink!!) The pig trotters was a collective favorite among the group, and the portions are very generous! We may have ordered a bit too much for a group of 9 (12 dishes), but trying everything was well worth it! Will likely order #of people - 1 dishes next time-#A4 Beef Tartar: someone said its raw beef served with avocado with some sauce to go with it! It was fun to try, but was a controversial dish amongst the table.#C3 Pork Belly Bossam: crowd favorite! The pork is easy to share#A6 Karaage salad: another crowd favorite, not only was the chicken nice and juicy on the inside (and a deliciously crunchy ¿beer batter?), but the salad complemented the fried foods and heavily flavored dishes! (And the sauce tasted great!)
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I loved the outdoor area. The pasta was delicious and our server, hilarious! I had the papardelle boscaiola, and the polpette for an appetizer. The sauces were so good and savory. Definitely would come back! Thanks to our server "Eminem!"
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Extremely rude Hostess/ waitress Arie & Michiko (not sure how to spell their name) called earlier today and Arie must have been having a horrible day because she spoke to me as if I was stupid & Michiko pretended to be the manager, mocked me then hung up on me... Horrible customer service. I'm disgusted with the people this beautiful restaurant hired.*also just read another review about the server Michiko being awful*
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of our favorite neighborhood spots to have a nice dinner. The last couple times we have gone we've had the pleasure of having Michiko as our server. They go above and beyond in making dinner feel special. So thankful to have had the pleasure of eating in their section when we've gone. Great food. Great service. Fantastic to bring out of town guests to show them a good time or celebrate a special occasion.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of the best pasta dishes I've had by far. The place is cozy with a vintage feel. They also have the best Prosecco wine and Italian beer. I'd definitely come back again.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Incredible cuisine and outstanding service! A charming gem nestled in LA. Cant wait to come back!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Best pasta in LA. Laid back and charming space, perfect for casual or nice night out. Service is warm and also laid back, perfect amount of letting you enjoy a dinner/ not interrupting and checking in on you. Food will always be brought to your table fresh, though go there expecting to take your time and enjoy the food- not to be enjoyed in a rush. Oscar is the best!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Best handmade pasta in all of LA. The burrata salad and tiramisu also top tier. Exceptional service, cozy casual atmosphere. We are always in good hands with Oscar or any of the staff. Favorite restaurant in town, hands down.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Cute Italian restaurant that feels family-owned. We sat outside with our dog. The server was kind enough to bring her water. The service is impeccable. I overheard one of the servers say they were severely understaffed, but that was not apparent to us. I felt out server was very attentive.I ordered the mushroom risotto which was a bit more al dente than I like it (not their fault!) and could've used a bit more salt. They didn't skimp on the mushrooms which I appreciated. I think next time, I'll order pasta which is handmade!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Evef since Cafe Luna on Melrose closed in the early aughts I have been looking for gorgonzola gnocchi. I found a version of that on the La Pergoletta menu and was determined to try it. I was not disappointed. It was cheesy and creamy and melt in your mouth perfection. All the food eaten that night was fab. The staff is great. This is a lovely little hidden gem in Los Feliz that I highly recommend.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Very cute little restaurant. Has really good food from the bread, salad and pasta, everything was fresh. I would recommend getting the burrata bruchetta. The service is quick and friendly.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Really nice romantic atmosphere and perfect to take a special date. Their ravioli was great and so were the drinks and appetizers. The service was also great.Side note on the dessert: we ordered a tiramisu and it was bad, like spoilt milk. Almost like they opened the fridge too many times or left it open. I believe that made me ill the following hours after leaving.I am leaving 4 stars even though I got sick- I would definitely take my date back here and just skip dessert and take her somewhere else for that! Really pretty restaurant overall.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: So biased because when I visited yup dduk. i only had frozen ddukbokkis for few months. So i was more than happy to have yup dduk!!!!The ttukbokki was huge. We didn't really add things into ttukbokki but it was more than enough for two people. Had mild spicy level and i think it was spicy-delicious enough! I wouldn't be able to digest anything spicier than that lolOverall, glad that i had ddukbokki. Can't objectively judge because i was just in sheer joy to have korean ttukbokki!!!!!!!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've been wanting to come here for a couple years or so now. First time I'd heard of this place the line was out the door and long so my friends and I ended up at a different restaurant in the same plaza. Since then, every time I pass through town and research Yelp for yummy places to eat, this one seems to keep popping up. But then, I'm usually alone and it seemed like too much food for one. Boy was I right!We were a party of three this time. It was close to 8pm on a Tuesday night so the wait was maybe 15-20 minutes. After reviewing the menu, I realized this menu did not offer diet food. There were no fresh vegetables in their offerings. Sometimes, you just need an indulging meal.The space is quite small. Depending on the table configurations there were a maximum of 4-5 table sets possible. But this tinyness of the space added to the charm. People came in and out to grab takeout while all the tables were filled. It amused me that all the customers at the time of our visit were probably all under the age of 25, except us.And then I saw all their bowls of Tteokbokki on their tables. They weren't regular bowls, they were GIANT bowls full of sticky noodles covered in spicy gochujang style red sauces, covered in gooey cheese. We ordered Yup Dduk, Set C. In our order there was yam noodles (the kind Japchae is made of), fried onion rings and fried zucchini, fish cake, a couple small pieces of sausage and maybe some other things. Being an "older customer" my body can't necessarily handle such a carb loaded meal. But, my eyes and taste buds feasted on this dish! It was delish! I think this bowl could have fed 6 people! We had plenty of leftovers. On the side, the only vegetable to be considered was pickled radish. Does that count as "balance"?One of my favorite things about the meal was making seaweed covered rice balls. I'd never done this before. So much fun and delicious too. I'll be trying this at home!And when they advise "extra mild", I recommend you take their suggestion. No shame in extra mild.I can handle a decent amount of slickness. No joke! This was spicy! It definitely inched to my borderline.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This is probably the best spicy rice cake place I have been to!For the price, the portion was so big and the leftovers lasted me and my roommate for the rest of the week. We ordered the extra mild and it was still quite spicy for us, but was still really good. The location was a little small, but we went on a weekend around noon so we were able to be seated right away.We also ordered some yogurt drinks on the side, but they were a little small and not sure if I would have them again other than for the fact that it helped calm down the spice.Would definitely go back next time I come down to LA!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Great place to grab a bite with your friends when in K-Town. The location is quite small though with only a few tables and limited parking. Something to consider if you are craving rice cakes (ddukbokgi/tteokbokki).I came here with a group of 4 and we were able to fit perfectly by combining two tables. We split two bowls of rice cakes. In hindsight, one bowl would have been sufficient. The portion sizes here are really big! Also beware of the spiciness levels. I am pretty comfortable with spiciness and the mild was too spicy for me. If this is your first time here, I'd recommend to start with extra mild and then work your way up the spiciness ladder.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: super yummy. 10/10! will definitely come back again. service was delightful. ambiance was perfect.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: SO GOOOOD i had such a good experience. Our waitress so sweet and her black and white claw clip was such a serve. much love
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Easily the best dduk boki in all of LA.  There I said it.  But dayum it's always consistent tasting and always on point.  Btw extra mild spice level is like a 7!  It's still spicy!  Be careful!  And enjoy!!!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was good but definitely prepare for the spice. We got mild spicy and it was spicier than expected. But the fried veggies and other toppings were so good. The rice cake and fish cake was soft and chewy. The sauce was really good as well. Service was quick, the place is kind of small so theres not a lot of seating but we got there at good time.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Yup Dduk is the best place to share dukbokki with friends! We came here at 4:30pm on a Sunday and was surprised that there was a wait - but after 15 min nearly everyone left the restaurant so 5pm is the ideal time to visit LOLWe ordered their standard with fried spam and ramen at mild spicy. Don't take their spice level for granted though - I love spicy food and eat it a lot but their mild was definitely more of a medium. For two people, this is definitely enough and more for another takeaway meal. I would highly suggest getting other things to help with the spice levels like banana milk and rice balls just to cut the meal - I didn't need it but my friend definitely did LOLIf you add a lot of sides, the bill will rack up but I found out meal to be the perfect amount! May opt for more cheese next time!Parking: valet during the time we went at $3 which isn't too bad.Restaurant size: slightly smaller which is why there was a wait. Tables are also really close together so you'll smell the perfume of the person sitting next to you lol
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: After hearing about this place from friends, I finally had a chance to stop by. This place did not disappoint! The dduk was soft and chewy and the sauce was super spicy. If you have a moderate spice tolerance, I recommend going with mild. I liked the spicy kick but after a certain point all I tasted was the heat haha. I want to try the mild version next time to see if I can taste more of the sauce. Service was great.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The crab Benedict is not as should be! The sauce the put instead Benedict is a sour and sweet, it doesn't much with egg and crb at all! The worst Benedict!The waitress was so rude when I told him that it's not a real crab cake Benedict! The manager was so sweet, she know how suppose to be a real Crab cake Benedict. I used to live this place,  but no more come here.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Bottomless brunch was really great! As was the truffle egg sandwich that's on the brunch menu.Only con was we had a 1:30 reservation and didn't sit down until after 2. Thankfully we weren't starving and the staff was very apologetic but kinda annoying how a reservation didn't get any "priority" in seating order. But seriously not too serious imo, great place and vibe for sure, I'd definitely go back.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I love this place they have great food and a great atmosphere weather it's during the week or the weekend and the bottomless mimosa is to die for you won't retreat going there ‍
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Don't go when they open. They need about 40 mins to get into the swing of things. Pancakes were good, crab cakes eggs benedicts were meh, potatoes a bit over done. Service lacked. I'm thinking they must have gone out the night before and we're feeling it Sunday morning. Flies galore inside.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Good foodGood servicePerfect for mimosas on a weekend.The ambiance is great, def a go to spot.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food was pretty good! Service was great. Potato was were a little oily. Glad they had some vegan options.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The last experience at Eat This Cafe was excellent. While the prices are slightly on the higher side, they are in line with what you would expect in Los Angeles for a small establishment like this, making it acceptable. The brunch was fantastic, and the staff was very attentive.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Loved this place! From the staff, to the food, to the bottomless mimosas. Street parking wasn't too difficult and everything here tasted so delicious!! Can't wait to come back
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I work next door to this place and eat lunch here all the time! The staff is always so nice and the Eat This Salad is the best salad I've ever had! I don't know what they do to it but it's so good! It can be busy depending on when you go but that just goes to show you how good the food is. Highly recommend this place!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Rating 10/10 !Food : Everytime I go we get breakfast food but this trip we got sandwiches. BEST DECISION EVER, the sandwiches are sooo big and so juicy. They are not stingy with toppings or deli meat at all. Must recommend the turkey club, had me stuffed !Ambiance : Such a good time always, with bottomless mimosas you can't go wrong !Service : Our waiter was very attentive and on it!Bottomless Mimosas : Sooo fresh and ice cold makes them so much better to enjoy!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Went for a second time today. I got the buttermilk pancakes and was disappointed. They were hard and not fluffy at all. Potatoes were amazing and tasted yummy. The eggs were not cooked long enough and were a bit watery for scrambled eggs. I was expecting to never see the bottom of my mimosa because I paid for bottomless but was disappointed with watching an empty glass for long portions of time regardless how empty the restaurant was. Overall, definitely a place I recommend for bottomless mimosas just wish the waiters would be faster since you only have a 90 minute time frame there.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Amazing mimosas ! Amazing food, if you are seated outside beware of outdoor smells like garbage. Waiters were on it and never let me see the bottom of my mimosas!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: A real neighborhood gem with good and reasonably priced food. The breakfast sandwich brioche bread is so pillowy soft  the Nutella French toast is a touch too sweet for our taste
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: We had been meaning to try this place out, but it was a disappointing experience due to service. Food was fine, nothing amazing for the price. Decor was very nice and warm. But that doesn't make up for the staff.As soon as we sat down, the French server (how he introduced himself) copped an attitude. From sneering when we initially asked for water to only carding me even though the entire table ordered alcoholic drinks (I was not the youngest nor did I look it, but I was the only Asian person...), he acted as if we were inconveniencing him and wanted us gone.He never returned once we got our food and after sitting around for 20+ min after finishing, someone from our table finally got up and walked to the counter to ask another server for the bill and boxes. Waited for another 5 min and no one came, but saw him chilling at the counter chatting away. I finally made eye contact with him and we made the same request for the bill and boxes. He snapped, "Okay, I will do it when I have time!" before stomping away. I don't know who pissed in his Cheerios that day, but he succeeded in ruining our meal, too.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Absolutely amazing! The food was amazing. The vibes were great. Decor cozy and welcoming. Our waiter was very sweet and patient, even with a packed house. I loved it and plan to become a regular.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: The food was so good I'm coming back whenever I'm nearby.Danielle, the manager walked around insuring everyone enjoyed there food and service.Support local places like this and strengthen all of our quality of life.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I loved everything I ate, my daughter and I got the chopped Asian salad, the crispy mushrooms, shrimp scampi and for dessert we got the apple pie and the chocolate lava cake with ice cream, our server was Logan , very nice and attentive, he made sure that we had everything we needed . Ambiance was great, I liked that their music is not crazy loud or annoying like some other places. We will definitely go back to try some of the other items in their menu. P.S. Don't forget to order the Apple pie, it's the best tasting apple dessert with vanilla ice cream I have ever had!!
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: SERVICE: Great customer service!  I feel so bad for not getting the names of the waiters, but those two guys were awesome.  You know when the folks are cool when they take a group photo for you and wait for people in the back to clear out to offer a clean shot!  The one was slightly thick with blond/light brown hair and eyebrows.  The second was a thin French fella.  Parking in LA sucks, particulary in these areas, but we got lucky finding something on the street around the corner (non metered spot).   The venue was clean and cool.  We literally stayed for hours and they didn't kick us out lol.  However, that's probably why the second guy came over and offered desert, all good.FOOD: The pizza was good!  Pictured is the pep with chipotle honey and for desert is the apple pie, which was also GOOOOOD!WELL: well duh of course we're returning!  Stop reading this and get your order in.  Just don't be late like us and miss the brunch slot.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Looked up this place as a halfway point for dinner with a friend. I arrived first and got a seat with no issues. It's a cute space that's kinda like a quaint Parisian or Sicialian bistro with its ambiance and style. It's light and airy, even for California. Friend arrives and we decide on our entrees.We both ordered salads. Mine, the Mediterranean Salad with salmon came out looking good. My friend's, the Asian Chopped Salad was covered in edamame despite its removal being requested and the ordered salmon wasn't there. After fixing the salad, a few bites in there was a hair. They addressed this by replacing the salad and comping the first salad but not the salmon. It was an odd way to fix the issue but my friend wasn't mad so neither was I.Another attempt to soothe things was selling us on the idea that their bread was good so we ordered some. It was warm and tasteless. A little olive oil drizzle with some garlic would've gone a long way. Overall, it was an underwhelming experience.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: We've been to Vicky's for both brunch and dinner, and both times were a hit. Service is quick and friendly, there's a very nice ambience with great decor and lighting while still being casual, and the food is delicious. It can get a bit loud inside, but they were very accommodating with outdoor seating. As far as the food, you can tell they make everything in house with fresh ingredients, especially their breads and sauces. The shakshouka was amazing as was the French toast. Brunch was so good I couldn't wait to go back for dinner. I finally made it back and tried the crispy mushrooms and rigatoni. Our server described the mushrooms as vegan calamari and that was spot on, so good and not too mushroomy actually. The rigatoni was equally tasty with a delicious sauce and the spicy sauce comes on the side which is nice. Really glad to have this place in our neighborhood and can't wait to go back!
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I've guess you can say I've become a bit of a regular who's enjoyed a wide array of dishes, all of which have exceeded my expectations. Their breakfast sandwich is large, very filling and flavorful. But what was most impressing is the Shakshouka. A friend recommended and I've never tried it (or even heard of it), but the flavors burst like fireworks in your mouth. Honestly there isn't a single dish I haven't enjoyed but those stood out the most to me.
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I LOVE THE PASTA HERE!! The atmosphere is so cute too- very fancy, neat, but not too much. The servers were really nice and cute! I would personally come here to get brunch with my old friends and catch up. SO CUTE !!!
Address: 5410 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: This was our first time here, we always pass by and we live in the area. So glad we stopped by to try, and everything was delicious and the price is worth it.Definitely coming back again.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Love the Korean crab its shells are softer than other crabs. Wish it was a little more salty but its still so good!I love the ambience and the plates and utensils they use are so cute. Servers were friendly both times I went!Such a plus they provide with mouth washes in the restroom for after eating!!
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Very modern decor and ambiance. We didn't have to wait long before being seated. All the food was super fresh and amazingly delicious as well as the portions matching the price point. Highly recommend if you're looking for marinated crab!
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: I was in Los Angeles, and, coming from San Diego, knew that it was next to impossible to get a Korean raw marinate crab. There just isn't quite the customer base required to ensure the product stays fresh. Thankfully, there are places that are able to deliver on the promise of fresh, yet still safe enough to eat raw crab.Master Ha's has a very sleek interior, tasty food, and service to match. Honestly, the only negative I would say would be one, you may have to wait here a while. My understanding is they do not take reservations, and while we were seated immediately, we came at 9 o'clock at night on a Tuesday, arguably one of the slowest times for a restaurant. And the place was still packed.We got the crab as a bowl, which means they pre-clean the crabs for you, but for the full experience, you are supposed to do it yourself. I did take some of that to go, and it was similarly delicious. However, the luxury of having them do it is not something I would complain about. They also give you a crab soup on the side which was very tasty, and a few side dishes. I was particularly fond of the perilla leaves.Bathroom is also very clean, and although the price is a little steep, this is one of the only games in town I understand for this type of product that level of freshness. Would definitely try again if in Los Angeles again.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: I have tried a few other places for their raw soy marinated crab and i'm telling you hands down they have the best. The service is excellent and they will explain everything to you if you have any questions. The have indoor and outdoor seating. Great place to bring your friends for dinner.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Came here with a couple friends after seeing all the hype on Tiktok. We were seated quickly with no wait. Service was good; our waiter was flirting with my friend throughout our meal. Parking was difficult since it's located near a residential area.Shared the medium crab serving amongst 3 people and a plate of kalbi. Crab was a tiny bit fishy, but overall easy to eat and well marinated. Kalbi was very good-- soft and flavorful.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: I love raw marinated crab and enjoy trying it at new places! I came on a Wednesday night and it was busy. We waited for about 45 minutes before we got seated. We added ourselves to a waitlist there and was moved to a waiting area to put in our order. For a party of 3, we ordered the regular live uni ($40), marinated crab bowl combo ($40, and salmon handroll ($8 per piece). The interior was modern with black and gold utensils.Although a bit pricey, the seafood is fresh and comes in a good portion. The restaurant does have a strong smell due to the fresh seafood. Each person gets a bowl of rice and miso soup with crab. My favorite was the salmon handroll and marinated crab bowl. The live uni was colorful and fresh, but nothing too crazy. I tried raw marinated shrimp for the first time and really liked the texture. Master Ha provides a unique dining experience and has a high end atmosphere. 10/10!
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: After trying raw, marinated crabs in Korea, I really wanted to find something similar back in the States. Research led me to multiple restaurants in Ktown and Master Ha was one of the most talked about. Since we were worried about peak times, we visited in the middle of the afternoon and found the place empty.Medium Marinated Crab: A medium size is 2 whole crabs, cut into pieces. Each person (we had 3) also got a bowl of rice and crab miso soup. Gloves are provided and it's highly recommended to use these because it's just easier to squeeze out the crab meat with your hands. Take a bite with rice or wrap it in the provided seaweed. SO GOOD! Takes me back to Korea but the only problem is the price. The crab miso soup was even better, maybe even better than the marinated crab itself.Regular Live Uni: Comes with 4 halves of a live uni, filled with rice, roe, 3 pieces of (small) uni, and a raw quail egg. If you want premium, I think that just comes with more uni. This is an IG-worthy dish, very aesthetic. But I could've done without it. You can easily finish each half in like two bites and it's pretty expensive because of the uni.Overall, pretty satisfied with the meal but it's just so expensive compared to Korea. This is definitely not something to be enjoyed often, unless you have the money for it. Hard to say if I'll be back but I think it's worth trying at least once!
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: I was thirsty af after but it was worth it. From presentation to taste, everything was on point. Delicious. Glad we got here before the rush. For all u alcoholics, there's no alcohol and no you cannot bring your own. Get over it.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Solid spot if you want live, raw seafood. We ordered the premium uni which came with 4, and the medium sized raw marinated crab. The dishes come with rice, a few kimchi side dishes, and some soup. We also got steamed egg but its super small so i would pass on that.First off the uni was my favorite but maybe since its not in season / just starting it wasn't that fresh. I think they definitely try to mask it with quail egg and a lot of seasame oil. I really did like this dish but do wish they used better quality uni itself. The crab- honestly was a bit of a let down. I didn't really like the marinate it lacked flavor compared to the soy marinated crabs im used to. The food came out fast but the place is on the smaller side and gets crowded fast so i would definitely come here on odd hours or when they open because it is not worth it to wait.
Address: 1147 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Incredible food. Everything here is amazing, I've been about 4 times here and I've never been disappointed just belly full of amazing food!
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Best Thai good in downtown laNot much casual not much fancy just easy n nice placeGood for meeting friends n good for dating
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The ambiance is perfect for a date, make sure you make a reservation because they get really busy at night. Specially at this location/branch  Food is delicious   This branch is at downtown LA so parking is a bit of a walk and sometimes it can be pricey.  But all and all great place to eat!!!
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: This place had been on my list for a cool minute. My friends and I were at the bar right next door, so it was perfect.Customer Service: 10/10. Host was very friendly, and he helped us pick a few items as it was our first time here AND we had a food allergy.Food: 10/10. I haven't had much Vietnamese food, but this was by far the best. We had-Ga Xao Xa Ot: lemongrass chicken wings. Crispy, with just the right amount of lemon flavor. Don't skip these.-House Triple Garlic Noodle: Wow. This one was a huge surprise. It was so flavorful! This was the first thing everyone finished. So simple, yet so delicious.-Pho Banh Cuon: delicious. Our pickiest eater went back for a second roll. Tender, packed with flavor, and the sauce?? Yum.-Fried Sea Bass: the STAR of the night. Served with lettuce and meant to be made into hand rolls. An absolute must.Everything is served family style, which makes it ideal for those who want to try many dishes! I will be back.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My friend and I came by on a Saturday, and happened to show up to our reservation 2 hours early but they were able to seat us right away. The host was friendly, but the servers seemed to not have been very attentive. We came a bit before dinner time, so the restaurant was not super busy. Many chances that we were trying to get more water, but every server seemed to be off the floor or busy doing something else.Overall the food was good but nothing life changing. We ordered the garlic noodles which we both agreed was a 7/10. The spring rolls seemed very fresh (8/10). The rice and meat plate was delicious, however the meat was a bit hard to chew through (7/10).Would come back again for a nice fusion meal.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Food is good but this review is for the hostess. Little Sister if you want to keep your customers you probably need to do some training on your hostess/waitress. This pertains to the Asian waitress with blonde hair, she does not seems like she wanna be there. I came in with my family with kids, she sat us down in the back of the restaurant with no booster no high chair and just kept ignoring us. I was still talking to her and she kept walking away and does not provide any proper service. Very disappointed for a highly rated restaurant. Definitely NOT KID-FRIENDLY.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The food is so delicious here and the service is personable without getting intrusive. Definitely worth a trip downtown.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Food was great!! We've been twice and the garlicNoodle are delish!! The shaky beef not what it is all hyped to be. Crispy prawns delish!!Ambiance is super intimate and moody totally loved it!
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: This is the second time at the downtown location. Brought my family here. Once again it was a delightful experience. Really great food. The staff helped us with ordering since we had some food allergies. Good thing we had reservations since the place was busy on a Monday night.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My vegetarian friends, there are actually NO options on the menu that are actually vegetarian-- however, they offered one off-the-menu vegetarian item that I did quite enjoy, the tofu vermicelli.We started with spring rolls and sesame baguette with pate-- my friends really enjoyed the spring rolls and the bread was delicious and perfectly crispy and buttery soft on the inside. I loved the tomato spread it came with and also dipped my tofu from the bowl into it! Not too acidic, mildly sweet, smooth blended texture.The vermicelli bowl was great, too. I would have loved more sauces as it was a bit dry, and wish some thicker dipping sauce came along for the tofu. But otherwise quite enjoyable. The tofu was nicely crisped and fried but not too oily. The portion was quite big too, and I took half home for next day's lunch!Service here is great, very knowledgeable about the menu and helpful in assisting with dietary restrictions. It's a bit cramped inside, but we came around 2pm when the place was beginning to clear out. I'd hate to come during a busy hour.
Address: 523 W 7th St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The name is so fly! So is this place. It was a really hot day in LA.Our waitress Wanda took great care of us.The view is incredible. We came for a snack & drank before our dinner reservation. It was perfect!!
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Tried calling and sent an email on two separate occasions to get more information about setting up a special lunch event. Never got a reply back. Boo, poor customer service.
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Stayed here on a Saturday night, the room was clean and cute and that was the most comfortable bed!!We checked out the rooftop that night as recommended by the front desk hostess, and man it was a vibe. Beautiful people everywhere, dancing all night long, and great dj sets.We ordered too many fruity cocktails, all yummy.We had the steak and fries, sweet chili wings, and an extra order of fries. We ate it all up because it was so good! The wings were juicy and crunchy on the outside and the sweet chili sauce they were covered in was perfect. All of the drinks we tried were delicious!Great service, a bit on the pricier end, but well worth It. An experience I'll never forget!
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Even though it is always crowded, spending time on the roof, during the sunset is the best! They also have nice music playing there, bar in the middle and amazing views! Moreover, they also have some blankets, which is really nice, considering that sometimes it gets chilly outside!
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: So mamas shelter is a rooftop restaurant located in the middle of Hollywood which can be a good or bad thing depending who you ask. I've gone several times because it's a great place to meet up with friends and grab a drink to start your night. The scene stealer is the view of the Hollywood sign which on a clear day can be easily seen.  Now I did say this is a great place to start the night because the drinks are a bit pricey and you can run up a $100 tab real quick, so I usually come for a quick pre game then take off to wherever the night takes me. As for the food I've only had the Thai chili wings and salt&pepper shrimp which both are solid bar food but nothing amazing. Overall solid spot if you're in the neighborhood try at least once, I can at least guarantee a great view.
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This rooftop is so much fun, the drinks are not the best but servers are friendly and the layout makes you feel at home or at a friends backyard shindig.
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Amazing experience with great service and overall energy would come back anytime
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Terrible and rude service, mid and over-priced food, mandatory gratuity, the only redeeming quality of this place is the rooftop view. While online it looks so clean and cute, it is filthy and the furniture is cheap, dusty, and wobbly. The music is so loud you can't hear the person across the table. The bathroom being so disgusting for a place where the cheapest entree is over $25 is really telling of the vibe you're signing up for.Save you and your friends the trauma of crossing the scariest and dirtiest part of LA to be treated subhuman and go literally anywhere else, maybe somewhere where FREE parking is even remotely an option. So glad we booked out night at a different hotel!!
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great food, but uncanny service. From the moment we sat down we never felt welcome in a place that was not extremely busy to begin with. Service was rude, unprofessional, and nothing like I've ever experience in LA before. After asking for a manager to speak with in regards to the level of service instead of the manager attempting to sway our thoughts and resolve the experience we were having, he decided to add insult to injury by coming back with the bill and asking us to pay and leave. Bare in mind our order of food still had not arrived, and his words were "that's fine, but at this point I'd like you guys to leave."  We were nothing kind to the servers that came, nothing but kind to the manager, but for whatever reason he felt a need to give us the boot rather than listen to what our problem was with the service which resulted in us asking for him in the first place. I can't say I will ever return to this establishment and I can't imagine they can stay in profitable in a business such mannerism towards any of their guests. I only hope that ownership and the public see this, first to make sure things are put in order there, second for the public to not go to a place where the employees just have no desire to be there no value to their guests
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great drinks and bar bites. "Endless summer" drink is amazing ! Playful colorful environment. Guac had a nice kick! Not a fan of the crowd, very Hollywood.
Address: 6500 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I loved everything. I loved the risotto and pastels, the pizza was so yummy. And I ordered a calabresa pizza for to go. The server was so attentive. Definitely I will come back.
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Asquerosa comida  y al precio demasiado caro no vale la pena comer en este lugar. La comida  Alfredo  asquerosa
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food here is always yummy and satisfying! We really enjoy coming here! We'll be back again real soon!
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: the most popular item here is the skirt steak but i do NOT recommend. for a $35 steak, it's extremely tough. they do give you a decent amount of food though since it comes with 3 sides.this place's saving grace and our fave item was the fish of the day + risotto we ordered on the a la carte menu. it was $26 which is somehow the same price as the fish of the day on the grill portion of the menu. we asked the waiter and they said the fish is the same size and cooked the same way for both orders so GET THE A LA CARTE w/ the risotto since it's more worth than 3 sides. the fish is delicious and the risotto is perfectly cooked, def a 5/5.lastly, we also ordered a half dozen of the pao de quiejo which was good (4/5)
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: One of my fave restaurants when I visit LA. I always make a stop at Bossa Nova! Great menu with a variety of options. The wait time can sometimes be a little long depending on when you go but service is always great!
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Martha Server is the best. She was handling many tables at once, and still able to balance and be attentive to us. She also had help from the team. I love a good meal with good customer service. Delicious.
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food just simply is not that good has a lot of condiments. The meat is decent tho.
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food is amazing, service was nice and speedy, didn't wait long for a table, drink were strong. Amazing experience
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: THIS IS NOT BRAZILIAN FOOD. Please, for people that are not from Brazil, I apologize for this fake Brazilian food. Any foreign restaurant has to be authentic. Stop changing the original food with "American" infused menus.
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Delicious food, attentive service, ambiance was compromised because of construction in front of the restaurant. They had to turn the music up to drown out the traffic noise through the plastic film over the window holes. Large portions of delicious food. I would definitely come back.
Address: 7181 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: I had the absolute best time at this restaurant! The vibes were amazing -- the food, the music, everything transported me out of LA. And celebrating my birthday there was unforgettable; they even surprised me with a sweet handwritten letter and those unique charcoal candles, which made me feel incredibly special.Plus, the Brazilian ingredients and influence added that extra flair I adored. It felt like a mini trip to the Amazon! Huge thanks, and you can bet I'll be back for more experiences!
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The ambience is giving couture natural history museum. The service was superb. Our waitress Summer was lovely, attentive and so descriptive with the exotic primal menu. The food was delicious and presented in a beautiful way. The drinks unique and refreshing. Definitely recommend.  New favorite restaurant
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Love dinning here at Meteora in Los Angeles, and it was an extraordinary culinary journey that I won't forget.From the moment I stepped into the restaurant, I was captivated by its elegant and contemporary ambiance. The sleek interior design and thoughtful decor choices set the stage for a memorable dining experience and most importantly, Insta-Worthy! Now, onto the food - Meteora's menu is a culinary masterpiece. Each dish was a work of art, both in presentation and flavor. The fusion of ingredients and flavors was nothing short of brilliant. The chefs at Meteora truly understand how to elevate every ingredient to its full potential.The service was impeccable, with a team of knowledgeable and attentive staff. They were more than happy to provide recommendations, answer questions, and ensure that every aspect of the meal was perfect. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply want a memorable night out, Meteora is the perfect destination.
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The restaurant is BRILLIANT; GO. This review is for their brand new bar and lounge area. ALSO GO!!!Meteora had already become one of our favorite spots for undefinably delicious food in LA...and now they've opened the bar and lounge.WOW. The elegance and zen of their restaurant meet a phenomenal array of cocktails and shareable plates in a more laid back, connected surroundings with an atmosphere that adds something like an ultra-lounge feel...all without needing a reservation. We were delighted by their offerings, their vibes, and most importantly, their deep and earnest appreciation for our patronage. Jordan Kahn never fails to amaze and inspire; his staff never fails to impress, nor to anticipate and take care of our needs before we can even conceive of them.No reservations and anywhere within 10 miles of Melrose? Don't hesitate: the bar and lounge at Meteora are just as unmissable as Meteora itself!
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This is a spectacular place! If you're looking for an unforgettable date with your other half or a fun catch up with your friends, this place has all you need.It been a while since I've been impressed with food and drinks this much. Every single dish was a hit.Definitely coming back!!
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The design and energy of this spot is sooo dope !!! Went with a group of friends and it was amazing. Our server Harper was so attentive and on top of it!. The plantain platter was wheeeeew soo so soo good! The space feels like you were transported to another magical planet. Definitely coming back chile!
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: What a unique and inspiring dining experience. Meteora is one of my favorite restaurants in LA! From the ambiance and food it's perfect. Harper was an amazing server. She explained the menu beautifully, and was attentive the entire evening.
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: so delicious! we did the "experience" and it was so special. the chefs would come out and part of the experience was them plating the dish at your table while explaining what it was. the ambiance felt very otherworldly and my friend and i felt like we were in another dimension which was a lot of fun. pricey, but worth it and i definitely recommend!
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Our experience at Meteora LA was world class 10/10. From the ominous exterior, you walk in to find the most breath taking interior design every piece so simple and complex at the same time. As we were seated, we were welcomed with a handwritten birthday card for my wife, a fun little surprise. Pictures of the food don't tell the full story. A bowl of tomatoes turns into the most interesting thing you've ever tasted. The chef is truly talented. The cocktails are absolutely perfect, and all servers are ready to take care of you at any moment. We had 6 or so servers at our tables throughout the experience, and not a single detail was missed. I also have to give a special shout out to Jake, who was the primary server for us. He was everything you could hope for in a restaurant experience.
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: First and foremost to Jordan Kahn for a remarkable meal. We visited for the Cos wine paired dinner. I appreciated the molecular gastronomy very much, the well balanced dishes, all presented beautifully. It would have been five stars if not for the snarky staff.The decor was interesting, created a dark, intriguiging mood. The tableware was original and fun.All of our servers were great, but could have been more detailed with the very original, and unique dishes, how they were prepared, what techniques, and the background of the unusual products. However, the host/floor manager who came by a couple of times was rude, snippy, unprofessional, and unpleasant considering we each paid over $200 per plate for the evening. The place was quite empty. We asked to be moved to the patio to have a bit more peace as the music was loud with a driving beat. He said the music would soften, but it did not. He refused to bring it down a notch. We could barely focus on the food. The answer was a curt "no", with no reasoning whatsoever.My dining partner asked for a bit more wine with the first tasting. We had driven 90 minutes to the restaurant on a busy night and she wanted to relax. The host or floor manager's reply was a snippy, "You'll get your 3 glasses in. No. We can't serve you any more of the tasting wine."  Such rudeness and assumption we were there for 3 glasses of wine? Seriously?The final issue were the restrooms. One was unusable as some male had missed the toilet altogether and the floor was a puddle of personal "liquid" and the other toilet was clogged. Co-gender restrooms may be "in", but again, when you've planned for a nice evening out, visiting a smelly or messy restroom is just disgusting.We won't be going back. The food was quite good, but the experience of the loud pounding music, the host/floor manager's attitude, brought for a pretty unplesant evening altogether, and for $200+ per person, it's highway robbery.
Address: 6703 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Went here one late evening and had a burger and loaded fries. The fries were very tasty. Usually I like burgers medium but after reading reviews on Yelp, I learned that you must ask for no pink if you want the burger not to come out a bit raw. So, I ordered no pink and got a medium to medium well cooked burger which tasted really good.  Ordering can be done with the waiter or by scanning a QR code with your phone. I preferred ordering and paying by phone which was very convenient. My wife didn't notice the QR code order I placed and she was surprised that the waiter brought her drink as if by magic. Haha. The service was friendly and the place was clean. However, the restaurant windows are open to the street, therefore you may get bad views or good depending on the night or the hour.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The Stout Burger is to die for! A Solid Burger that out whole family loves. Friendly staff. Wedon't drink, but food is perfection
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great food, cool vibe, would recommend going here early afternoon to get some work done and have a good meal around a nice attentive staff.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Bomb burgers and good variety of beers. Need it say more? Nope, but will add that the servers, though busy, are still attentive. Great place, been here several times and will go back as often as I can.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We came here before a Pantages show for a quick bite and beer on Saturday night. It was busy but we were able to snag 3 seats at the bar. My husband and friend enjoyed their lager beer. I loved the fact they had iced tea. The burgers here are fantastic!!! I had the Stout burger lettuce wrap. Soooo good!  I could eat the horseradish sauce that comes with it with everything. My husband and friend had the Six Weeker, and The Morning After burgers. Both of them finished them off raving about how good they were.  We added the loaded tater tots to share. I'm glad we shared them because they were a good portion. The service was outstanding.  Drinks were always full and they all had big smiles on their faces. Excited to try the one in Ventura as well. It's a little closer to us.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Delicious burger! Ordered the stout and my boyfriend got the truffle, we also had the kale and quinoa salad and sweet potato fries (which were crispy just like we like). Great place.Only downside: bun was a little dryOther than that we definitely enjoyed our meal
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: If your looking for a place for a quick bite and a nice cold beer, look no further. They have a wide array of beer on tap for each and everyone's pallet. Food menu is down to the point. Burgers and salad. The name alone is quite interesting. Also the side dishes, recommend the loaded tater tots. Service is always amazing which is a plus. There's seating along the bar as well tables that looks out to the street. That open feel vibe.Services was always great. Friendly staff. There a lot but I'm not sure if it's juts for valet but metered street parking is also available. Location wise, it's centrally located in the heart of Hollywood. Minutes from walk of fame.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: we were staying across the street at Dream, walked over to eat. place had a cool vibe. we split an arugula salad, burgers do NOT come with fries or anything so we opted to split the loaded fries. I like raw onions on my burgers !!! but for some reason they will NOT allow you to add onions to a burger unless it comes with it !!! I asked if I could order and pay for a slice of onion...... was told NO. its there way or the highway.........  dont get me wrong, it was good but I like it MY way. I would maybe come back with a slice of onion in a bag or just try a not so uppity spot.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Good beer. Good food. Good service. Nice little place. Would return! I ordered the Curieux and it was delicious.
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I love this place! Tasty and great service! I took my wife and she was amazed a burger joint could be so good!
Address: 1544 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The best pupusa I've ever had. Best service ever. Look I've been to a lot of restaurants and the lady's in the back are dedicated to making sure you get the perfect experience.The lady's there are down to earth.I'm sorry I didn't take photos of the food I was too busy eating. Support your local cafe!
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I don't know where to start, but everything is amazing! This is a MUST TRY place! Quality food, served fresh and made with love  Owner Yanira, she's a mom that wants the best food for her family (customers) Overall this place is a 100/10.
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Refreshing, and delicious food! Great atmosphere! Great service, I recommend you try the Burritos here!
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: OMG.. Wow the food here was So Delicious!! Being Salvordan, I'm always in search of some good pupusas and this place sure is at the top.. my favorite pupusa was their carne asada..FYI.. they got some amazing veggie options such as their veggie enchiladas and chipilin tamales..definitely a must try. The chipilin tamale was my favorite..The owner is super welcoming and definitely ask her for recommendations if you're not familiar with Central American food..
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Food was delicious. I got the chilequeles and added chicken to it. Super good. Also got the mixed agua Fresca also good. Not too sweet so I enjoyed it. The service was amazing, always made sure we were taken care of. Definitely coming back
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: We don't always visit LA, but when we do we are in search of an awesome place to eat!  TBB didn't disappoint!  The owner is full of heart and passion. Her food was a fiesta for the senses.She went above and beyond to make us feel at home.  And it did feel like a home cooked meal. Fresh out the oven and just how you like it.
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: The food was excellent, service was great, and overall busy a perfect experience. Will be back
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Best costumer service ever Yanira it's so helpful and happy , food is delicious  recommended
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: After driving by and thinking I should try : 3 Borders I finally did and amnow regretting the delay. Don't make the same mistake! Of course. I'll make up for lost time!If you like Salvadoran food (too little appreciated in the US) or Mexican (d'uh) this is a godsend - everything made here daily.Friendly and delicious and neighborly (typical small parking lot - entry from Olympic just east of LaBrea.Enjoy!
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I have lived in the mid city area for 5 years and only just discovered this absolute gem of a restaurant! The Mexican/Salvadoran treasure has amazing food, drink, service and ambiance! I was welcomed by their head chef Yanira who is full of infectious energy! She offered me a custom enchilada and recommended a delicious tamale as well as a house made juice and platano all of which were AMAZING and made with FRESH INGREDIENTS! They also have a variety of salsas ranging from delicious and tame to delicious with a kick. After stumbling in after a tough first half of the day, the music and energy of Yanira and her team had me dancing out the door with a to-go pupusa that I'll be eating for dinner
Address: 5269 W Olympic Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Love Honey Night! One of my favorite Korean pubs in K-town as the food is always delicious and served fairly quickly. Never usually have trouble finding seating though if come past 11pm on a weekend it does get pretty packed! Always a great vibe with the music, and the servers are really fun! Definitely try the large intestines if you're feeling up for it- it won't disappoint.
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I've been searching for good pocha spots all over Koreatown, and this place definitely knows its audience. Most people in here were speaking Korean (sadly, I wish I could), one of the waiters was dancing at one point, another took shots with a table who seemed to be regulars, and they played music that made you feel hyper, chill, and happy at the same time. We could still talk, but it's definitely very vibrant and busy, so be prepared to talk a little louder. I didn't mind, though.We got two of their signatures, the Cheesy Fire Chicken with Rice Balls (Level 1 Spice), and their Galbi Fried Chicken which came with fried tteok and fries.The cheese buldak was so sauced and decadent. It's best in the very beginning when it's still hot and the cheese was melty. At the end of the day, though, the oil did build up and didn't feel amazing.The fried chicken was sweet and salty, still super crispy after the three hours that we stayed for. That's a very niche skill that I wish other places had!We also shared two bottles of soju, and they were pricey but not unlike soju bottles at other restaurants. Would love to come back again!
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: We came here for K-food, and a busy ambiance!We started with the soju mixed blue raspberry cocktail, the 32oz was enough to give one cup to the 5 party members I had.The spicy chicken with rice balls was super delicious! The chicken is so savory and paired with the rice is just *chefs kiss*Dduk bok ki was the perfect amount of chewiness but we were expecting something a bit more spicer. It's probably at a mild-medium level of spice.Seafood pancake was delicious and paired well with the other dishes. The soy sauce dip was super salty though.Overall, service was fast, the place was packed, and we didn't have to wait long for our food!Definitely a place to return to whenever I come to KTown again!
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: We ordered stir fried chicken, galbi fried chicken, and corn cheese. Food portions were large and delicious! Servers had great energy and I'm a big fan of the throwback music playlist.
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The food was so good oh my goddddd one order of the army stew was more than enough for two people probably just right for four people (order a side bowl of rice its 1.50 per bowl it wasn't listed on the menu) we were about to order two army stews, one for each person when the waiter informed us it was a very large portion (thank god) so we decided to get one order and an order of corn cheese too (both of which were amazing) be warned if you aren't super good with spice the army stew is a bit on the spicier side and if you can't finish it I would suggest making sure you finish the rice cakes first because they don't reheat as well as the rest of the food! Overall a must try!!
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Overall: 4.5 (dine in)We came here as a group of 4 during early and late night. It's 100% better at night when the place is popping with K-pop music and gives off a family-owned Korean pub vibe. Service was great and we left loving this place.Recently we went right at opening at 6 PM on a Sunday. There was only one other party beside us, no music, and just one worker. Each table has a button you can press whenever you needed something. Service was okay. The waiter only came when we pressed the button. He wasn't attentive so we didn't get water refilled and had to flag him down to order.Scallop Skewer: Tiny scallop balls that weren't good. Hard pass.Spicy Cheese Chicken & Rice Balls ($32.99): This was really good, and perfect to share with 2-3 people.Pork Belly With Fried Kimchi (23.99): The pork belly was dry and flavorless. They gave a sauce to dip it in but that didn't help. The fried kimchi  was amazing but it still doesn't justify the price.Galbi Sauce Fried Chicken ($19.99): This was bomb! The sauce was so good on the chicken and rice cake which were both fried to perfection. The fries were meh though. Also, the portion size has shrunk from the last time we were here.Fish Cake Soup ($22.99): My friend was raving about this and it did not disappoint! The soup along was super flavorful and had a nice little kick to it. The fish cake was delicious, one of the best I had. I wasn't a fan of the fat stick of rice cake though.
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Stopped here after a long day/night and felt revived after eating here!The serving sizes were large, soups were hot and filling, omelet was fluffy and moist and the service was amazing!Loved the vibe and energy here too, everyone was lively and the shots were plentiful!
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This is my favorite pub in ktown - the vibes hit just right after a night of karaoke or KBBQ, and their soups are SOOO GOOD with shots of soju
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This place is a rare-find. Their small intestine with garlic order was awesome. Bit pricey but all worth it. It was ordered via Uber Eats too. And that's impressive ( to be packaged with an effort  to maintain the quality over delivery time ). I'll give it an extra star after trying out on other orders in the future.
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Came here to watch the soccer game.Ordered the Army Soup and Signature Fried Chicken!Phillip was great and very accommodating.
Address: 3526 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food was very fresh and cozy spot. They did have a bar section, indoor, and outdoor seating. Valet parking was available. Staff was very attentive and always checking up/clearing up space on the table.
Address: 2903 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026
