There are pictures from customers covering the bathroom walls and ceiling it was very interesting to see abd gave you something to look at haha. The services was quick and the staff was very nice. Our food was amazing ny hubs for a steak and I got the carbonara both were amazing!! If you are in Hollywood and like the old Hollywood feel with some amazing Italian food make a reservation before 11am and enjoy some great food at Jones
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Such a cool hangout spot with music and a great crowd.Excellent service by such a kind, bubbly waitress.The food is outstanding!Ahi Tuna - absolutely incredible dish, makes me crave white beans.Beef short rib - so tender, fell right off the bone.  This dish was so delightful, can't wait to go back for more.Apple pie - I wish you could smell the goodness.Orecchiette with Turkey - good pasta dish, healthier option with turkey.Can't wait to return for cocktails and more delicious food!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I went in last night for the first time. They sat us in an area where there was no table service so we had to order from the bar. We were fine with that. So I go to the bar to order food and I'm standing there in a great mood, chatting with the nice drag queen that was working, when suddenly I feel a hard triple slap on my shoulder. I turn around and this female bartender (found out her name is Amy) gives me the nastiest attitude and yells at me that customers are not allowed to stand there. I was shocked! I looked at her and said don't you ever put your hands on me again. Then, she replied, "You can go see the exit!" Wow. First of all, there would have been no issue if she kindly asked me to move. The audacity that she thought she had the right to hit me is beyond my comprehension. And then to tell me to leave instead of apologizing after? So I asked for the manager. I watched her as she went over to him, pointing at me, really just acting and looking angry and out of control. The manager came over and basically told me the same thing she did, that customers can't stand there and she was letting me know. Yes, I understand that. But can we address the fact that she was rude and placed her hands on me? He told me he didn't think she really did that! My friends were standing there watching and other customers were shocked. So not only did this uncouth bartender assault me, but the manager told me I was lying about it. What a hellhole. BTW, the manager's name I'm told is Cody. Also, after reading the other negative reviews of this place, they all have the same theme. This place has the worst customer service I've ever experienced. They are not just rude, they are abusive. Don't spend your money here.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: They have RATS and ROACHES!!!! Please don't eat here it's gross and they service is HORRIBLE!!!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Racism is so appalling here the bartenders will ignore you literally placed my order then try to get check and the bartenders told me he won't serve me cause I was "trying to get his attention all night" he said this then when I left he said yeah go eat mc Donald's then when I flipped him off he got me kicked out . I have came here for years always talked highly until now this was so disrespectful disgusting experience I have ever had i regret any money I have ever spent here the bartenders are so entitled you would think they were owners killed the whole vibe never going back if your black this place is wackkkkk and racist !
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Would never come back here. I'd never been treated so poorly by a bartender in my life. I honestly left nearly in tears after he snapped at me literally because I sat at the bar to order food. I don't know what would possess someone in hospitality to brutalize a customer like that but I 100% did not deserve to be treated that way and I hope others aren't receiving the same treatment.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Been going to jones for late night dinner for many years. Used to love it. They still have the same great ambiance and pretty good food, but my friend and I had just a totally awful experience there last night, saturday 8/12. Our waitress was beyond rude no matter how much we tried to be friendly : and it was overt. we asked for bread 4 times before it came and the busser slammed it on the table like he was pissed. She left us alone for nearly half hour waiting for our bill and her and the busser continued with just awful attitudes. It was almost comical they were so mean. Was tempted to stiff her but wanted to take the high road - gave her 22 percent. This experience may have ruined it for me. Not sure if I'll be going back.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: This place is amazing! It's super packed but I like the vibe. I didn't try the food but it smelled amazing and looked great. Got an expresso martini and by far it was my favorite martini I had. Beautiful cocktails!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Always delicious, late night food. The pizza is light and tasty. The vibe is great. Highly recommend!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I used to come here in the 90s and was pleasantly surprised how much it HASN'T changed!! Love that. One of these days I'll eat their food but until then...(clinks cocktails) "cheers!"
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I ordered the Loco Moco breakfast item. It was delicious, scrumptious, and I want to come back for more!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I'm a huge fan of the Formosa Cafe! The Orange Chicken AWESOME; it's so incredibly delicious. And the Sticky Short Rib Sesame Noodles was pure perfection!Now, when it comes to the Char Siu Pie, it didn't quite meet my expectations. I'd give it a 6/10.The service was also great here.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The Formosa Cafe was so beautifully decorated and the atmosphere was amazing.  The service was great and the waiters were so nice.  The food was great and definitely save room for dessert!  Will be coming back soon!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Pretty good food with good vibes and great service. We sat in the bar on the second floor and the twinkle lights really set the ambiance that you didn't even realize you were in the busy West Hollywood. They give big portions as everything is family style and they have quite a few vegetarian options. Parking can be hard to find (since you're in West Hollywood) but most street parking in the area is free after 7 PM. The bathroom on the second floor was clean-ish and it's a single bathroom so there was a line.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Fantastic food. Very noisy, but food was worth it. Been there forever and can't say enough about the food and quality.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Incredible food, wonderful atmosphere, and a great experience with our server, Matt, and the AGM, Harrison.Firstly, the restaurant was able to accommodate our larger party with only a few hours of notice. For two out of the seven in our party, they had dined there before. The rest of us were excited to try all the things we'd heard rave reviews of.Immediately Matt G made us feel like we were old friends. He was charming, polite, and very knowledgable. He answered all of our questions promptly and humorously and continued to check in on us as the evening went on--making sure our water glasses were always full.The food was delicious and everyone left there full and happy to have leftovers for tomorrow. Half of our party ate family style and the other half got their own dishes. Both of which are easily doable so whatever experience you're looking for they can accommodate. i even forgot to ask for a dish to be not spicy and they immediately took it back to the kitchen and re-prepared it for me.After the meal I asked for the manager to express how wonderful our server, Matt, had done. Harrison was kind and funny as well and I really enjoyed speaking with him.All in all an incredible experience and one I hope to repeat again soon!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Great Chinese food with the old school Hollywood feel ..highly recommended, definitely coming back
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The food was tasty! The ambience was dark just like I like it, love the colors, love the vibe. 10/10 recommend!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: So much to rave about here. The history, the vibe, the food, and the staff were all fabulous.  My wife and I ate here in June and then came back in July. We had the sweetest little redhead hostess who warmly welcomed us and took great care of us.  Our server was very attentive and our glasses were never empty (a pet peeve of ours).  We had some wonderful cocktails to start our evening. My wife had the Matador and the Passion & Paradox (recommended by our hostess) and I had the Green Tea Martini. Kudos to the mixologist behind the bar!We experienced a variety of food on our two visits--Pot Stickers, Chile Wontons, Kung Pao Chicken, Braised Pork Belly, Orange Chicken and Xiao Long Bar "XLB" Soup dumplings.  Everything was delicious. In fact, it was so good we forgot to take a picture of the food!  Overall, our total experience was exceptional. Cannot wait to return and y'all need to follow suit!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I was looking forward to trying some delicious Thai food but was immediately met with disappointment as I sat around waiting for someone to take our order. Although the service was slow, I still held out hope for the food. However, the food was also disappointing. The shrimp cakes did not have much flavor and reminded me of chicken nuggets. The food arrived cold and the basil fried rice did not have enough flavor. Thai food is one of my favorite cuisines, so I was especially unpleasantly surprised. The restaurant itself was very open and had a large bar but I didn't try the drinks.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing and authentic thai food. Pad see yu, morning glory, papaya with blue crab, ton yum goong!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Depending on how busy this place is, that will determine the quality of service you receive. When you're the only customer here the food is delicious and they tend to your table frequently to ensure everything is going well. Should there be more than 5 tables with paying customers, there will be eggshells in your food with no chance on getting a refill on your drinks.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The worst Thai Food and perhaps the worst dining experience I've ever had. 1.) I repeatedly had go myself into their kitchen to find a waiter.2.) We ordered the "Chicken Hell," which is one of their "specialties," and it had bones that were so small and fine that I cut my gums and the roof of my mouth, and both me and my guest spit out blood from the small cuts the bones had created.3.) I explained to the server why this was a problem, and he just smiled and nodded as if I was telling him how nice the weather was, and then he turned away only to bring a bill a few minutes later.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The inside is absolutely beautiful with bar on the side but unfortunately can't say the same about the food we had! Ordered Chicken fried rice & Mint Leaves Basil & Chili Chicken (Pad ka Pow) w/ Hot spice level but we had no idea that we'll get level-8 spicy so really couldn't enjoy it and suffered with mild stomach pain the following couple of days! I think they need to be careful about the spice level they are serving the customers or at least should have warned us beforehand!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Might be one of the worst experiences I've ever had eating somewhere. First this little parking lot actually charges an $8 valet fee which if u saw the parking lot u would laugh. Then when u get there no one speaks English and what I thought was karaoke night was the actual entertainment. The music and microphone was so loud I could not hear myself think. No one seemed to be working and I had to hail down someone who I guessed was working. They Findlay bring my food and I was so hungry I dug in. $50 for two dishes that universally cost 10-15 each. Mind u they have NO PRICES ON MENU. I tried to enjoy my meal but the woman singing was sooooo loud I was in pain. I paid and ran out of there. Never ever ever again
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great spot to eat. Great and prompt service. Food taste was very good I had no complaints. My family and went to the other Thai restaurant that's starts with a "T" down street for 25 years. We live two hours away and only  ate Thai at that place. Service and ambiance is gone at the "T". This is my new place when I'm in town. Hollywood Thai really know how to treat clients , serve good food and is super modern and clean. I really liked my experience here. Recommend.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Be aware! They overcharge you!There is no price on the menu and they over charge you. We ordered one pad Thai and one morning glory, ended up paying $50 including tips. And found out both dishes were only $16.95 each . The bill was hand written only and they asked you to pay cash. What a scam
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing food was great' they are so kind and I will definitely be back!!! Yay this place is open late,Perfect for you and your hungry friends on a Sunday night ! Service was amazing!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We came in here tonight after doing a photoshoot nearby - we were a party of two young women. The restaurant had an overwhelmingly unpleasant 'fishy' smell as soon as we walked in, like spoiled seafood, and the vast majority of the restaurant was empty. We were seated immediately in a booth and brought water but it took awhile to get menus and drinks. The server was friendly but he NEVER came back--- we were left on our own for SO LONG without anyone coming by to see how we were doing. He told us to use the QR code for accurate pricing since the menus they gave us were not up to date (then why give them to us at all?). I ordered fried tofu and asked for a side of peanut sauce instead of sweet chili, and my friend ordered pad see ew and some mango sticky rice for dessert. Our food took maybe 20 minutes to come out. The food was hot and fresh, the tofu perfectly crisp on the outside, but it was VERY mushy and soggy on the inside, like too much water was left in it maybe? And extremely bland, no flavor whatsoever. Even when I dipped it in the peanut sauce that just tasted like peanut butter, no seasoning or heat in the sauce at all.  It was like eating spongy cardboard with a mushy center. My friend said her food was good but honestly, we were astonished by the service. We sat down to eat at 9:15. We finished eating around 10 and waited for the server to come by to offer us to-go boxes and bring the check. We sat and talked, our plates obviously finished, no longer eating, until 10:40 when I finally flagged him over to bring us to-go boxes and the checks. He brought the to-go boxes and then vanished again. We boxed up our leftovers and waited, but no check arrived. At almost 11 he resurfaced and I flagged him down again and asked for the checks again. He said "Oh, no one brought them to you? Sorry!" and went to get the card machine and brought it to us. The food is a little pricey - my appetizer of fried tofu was $20 plus tip and the mandatory fee for using a debit card (we actually used Apple Pay) and while the portion size was generous I can't say the flavor or the service is going to make us come back. I know there's better food in Thai Town.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The reason that ixlb DimSum Eats - Hollywood does not get five stars is because they absolutely refuse to alter anything in their menu - they even refuse to cut up the Chinese sausage in the Bento Box, even though, technically, it is NOT any kind of substitution (I wanted to order the Bento Box for a person who could not eat large pieces of food, thus the request to cut up the Chinese sausage). I even spoke to the Manager, who absolutely refused. So, I ended up NOT placing a $65 order - their loss.Compare this to any other Chinese restaurant, most of which will customize their menus for the diner.We have not gone back to ixlb DimSum Eats since the infamous "Chinese sausage" incident. There is a really good upscale dim sum restaurant in Studio City which has a much larger selection of dim sum and is an actual restaurant, as well as a section for counter service to-go orders (that restaurant is Shanghai Rose).It is a shame about the lack of flexibility at ixlb DimSum Eats, because they have good dimsum, and I used to drive in from Monterey Park (to pick up large orders for several people) because I preferred ixlb DimSum Eats' dimsum to dimsum from various restaurants in the San Gabriel Valley (which is saying something, because the SGV is known as a great area to get Chinese food!)One thing that I loved is the turnip cake - it is very flavorful, but I suspect it might only be ordered by those people who are open to Chinese food that is not "Americanized." You can find turnip cakes in Chinatown in authentic dimsum restaurants.ixlb DimSum Eats is an upscale version of those authentic dimsum restaurants. The hargow and shrimp and chives dumplings are delicious. The sticky rice ball was disappointing: hard and with pieces of uncooked rice - we only ordered it once, and never again. Instead, we would order the seafood pearl, which is similar, but the rice is sticky and SOFT. The curry puffs are good, but extremely greasy. The Smiling Fish Bun is a take on Bao, in an open-faced style. It is good! But if you want just the same fried fish without the Bao and toppings, you can get the Fried Fish Fillet which has 2 pieces of fish and a side of the same sauce that is in the Smiling Fish Bun (the Smiling Fish Bun only has 1 piece of fish).Parking is horrendous around ixlb DimSum Eats. There is a very small parking lot behind the restaurant (parallel to Sunset) and very little street parking. There is an Arby's nearby with a larger parking lot, but I don't know if they will tow away cars if they see people parking there and NOT going inside Arby's. I would wait to go to ixlb DimSum Eats until after 8pm just so I could find parking.In sum, the only reason I give ixlb DimSum Eats only 3 stars is their lack of customer concern and lack of flexibility (it would have taken less than 2 minutes to cut up Chinese sausage for the Bento Box ... ). Other than a few bad items, most of the food is very good.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Yes please!!!! Amazing small bites. Will not go wrong with anything you choose. Definitely a lunch gem!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Ordering was quick and easy, got our food in about 10 minutes. The rice was a bit over cooked for my liking but i enjoyed overall and the soup dumplings are a must! It is a bit humid inside, but it is kept clean. Would definitely go back!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Amazing! Free parking (for one hour), quick service (got our food in less than ten minutes), and super nice staff! Everything tasted delicious, especially if you're looking for a quick dim sum fix :)
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Luv this din sum .. service was fast.. prices r affordable .. parking is limited ..  foods r so delish .. luv it!!!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: This place is sooo good. The staff is so kind and professional. The owner came out and introduced himself. We came late and they let us finish our food and use the bathroom even though we came with only a few minutes until close. All of the food was so good. So hot and fresh. Best dumpling place I've tried.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: This place is sooo good!! Do yourself a favor and come try the dim sum! This is a good place for a quick bite. All the food comes out within minutes in takeout containers. The staff is so nice! We came as a big party(about 7 people) about 10 minutes before they closed and they were able to easily accommodate our large party.Here's everything we got:-pork xiao long bao 9/10-spicy cucumbers(spicy isn't super spicy but they provide extra chili oil if needed) 9/10-shrimp shumai 10/10-spicy garlic noodles- pork bao bun- we got a lot more but these were some highlights!!!We enjoyed everything we got
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: WOOOWWWW if I could leave a 100/5 star review I would! The food was fresh and tasty  the staff and owner seriously the sweetest people. Love how clean and easy it was to order my food.  If you are ever in LA I would recommend you come here!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Ordered delivery and food came hot and delicious! Perhaps they could have included a bit extra sauces and condiments for the dishes (such as sweet sauce for the spring rolls), but hardly a huge complaint given how everything was.Pork Siu Mai - PACKED with meat and veg, this is perfectly seasoned and just explodes in your mouth. One order was 4 pcs and enough for a good portion of a 2 person meal. That said...I bought 2 orders for 2 people and am happy I was indulgent ;)Xio Long Bao - My comparison point in Cal is Din Tai Fung and these dumplings held up to the competition - for a fraction of the price. DTF's version has more soup and fills your mouth with hot broth immediately, while ixlb's are more subtle, but more than make up in flavor what they perhaps lack in soupy KA-POWness.Shrimp Wontons - Again 4 per order and that's plenty! Absolutely yummy, came with most crispiness remaining (not bad for a few mile trip!) and their chili sauce is solid. Seems like at least two shrimp (or a beautifully tasty and huge single) in this monster. Loved this dish.We also ordered the fried shrimp balls (odd texture at first, then that rich flavor takes over and you're transported to another, kinder, place). Spring Rolls were hot and fresh and delicious (see note about sauce above), and the Cha Siu was fine, definitely have had better in town, but I primarily ordered to make my own fried rice later in the week, so fine by me.No comments on ambiance of actual store as only delivery so far, but this is definitely my new GO-TO (or COME-FROM) spot of Dim Sum in Hollywood and mid-city!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: I love this cute little fast food dim sum place. A great snack option - It's affordable and quick. I've been to both their locations. The Westwood location is nice as there is outdoor seating.I honestly cannot fault any of their dishes. I've tried almost all of them and they are so comforting and tasty yet simple and hits the spot when you just want a filling snack.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Huge fan of their rice! Char siu and their beef are my favorites. Only wish they were open more days of the week. Please don't change anything else.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Needle was a big let down, sadly. The people working there were lovely and kind. But the food took a while to come, and when it did, it was bland and unimpressive. My husband got the beef and onion and I got the char siu rice, which was supposed to be their most popular dish and I cannot see how, with how bland it was. It was just plain rice, a few pickled vegetables, and pork slices lightly coated in some sort of sauce. I'm not sure I would try again.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So cute and so good! Never seen a modernized Hong Kong cafe before, and they did it so well! A great and yummy spin on the classics like the French toast and pork bun, but still had the classics like cheurng fun and char sui rice. I had the char sui rice and it was so yummy, and reminded me of the way my mom makes it!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Stop looking! This place has the best char siew fatty rice. You won't regret it!!!!!!!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Stop reading and get your butt over here for lunch before they run out of everything. The char sui (option of lean or fatty) is so well done compared to other LA spots. The salted egg yolk French toast is also one of the best I've ever had. The egg custard sandwiched by two slices of bread double battered is perfection. Also really enjoyed their mango lychee tea which wasn't overly sweet. Their side dishes and green beans were a nice balance for fiber as well. Fried chicken imo was good but too salty for me.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Needle is a small charming eatery in Silverlake. Once you enter, it takes about 20 steps to exit. I believe there are 2-3 tables inside leaving most of the seating outside near the entrance and around the corner. Though not a very large menu, there are enough variety to accommodate most people in my opinion.The staff is friendly and casual.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Im sad i wasnt able to taste needles dinner menu but im so glad i went for brunch. Everything was soo delicious and i cant wait to come back for more.One of their standouts is def the salted egg french toast, it was soo creamy and flavorful. Please get this, it may or may not change your life.Lowkey i love their french fries. They were the perfect curly fries. If you like crunchy and crispy but soft on the inside, this is for you. And the ting leftover bites were just heavenly.Theres parking in the lots and street parking but may be hard to find. Staff was really nice and they have a help yourself station with water, napkins and utensils.I love this place and highly recommend it if you want a cantonese / taiwanese inspired brunch!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Hidden gem in sunset blvd strip. This restaurant's sign doesn't really stand out because all you see is a drawing of some sort of rice bowl  on a plane green solid color background. But if you get closer, you will notice a standing sign hand written "Needle"along with  today's menu. Their menu items aren't that extensive thus not many dishes to choose from. But their grilled pork belly on a rice and a stir fried udon was spot on. They were delicious. Not too sure if they used MSG or not but I enjoyed them.They deserve 5 stars for serving me delicious food! I can't wait to try other dishes they have!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: amazing. I've been wanting to stop by for so long and it didn't disappoint. friendly staff and a great place for a quick, delicious bite! we had the chow udon, pork shop sandwich, and char siu. each meal was wonderful, but that pork chop sandwich visits me in my streams.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So good. The service is fast and always super kind. I love their udon - the flavor is so fresh and delicious.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This place was great! I went in for a quick solo lunch, had the blt on focaccia which was delicious and a mimosa. Prices were great and service was fantastic. Would definitely come back!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We used to live nearby and come here all the time and it never failed to impress. Went back today for a late lunch and it was just as a remember. There was a woman being a COMPLETE jerk to the server today and he handled it so well.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We live within walking distance and this is our go to place. The food is always delicious- literally every breakfast item, the mashed potatoes, and their veggie sandwich are my favorites. The staff is quirky and friendly and there's always cute dogs on the patio. I only wish they would add Happy Hour and cold brew coffee for brunch.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This is a gem of a restaurant. I love this place so much! Always eat here when I'm in the area. Can't remember how I found it, but I have been coming here off and on since at least 2017, maybe earlier. They're very generous with their Mimosas, which are very refreshing in this heat. The brunch menu is a must have, especially the pear pancakes. Fluffy, not too sweet, and they pair really well those crispy strips of bacon. And if you don't make it in time for brunch, you won't be disappointed with their other options. Big shout out to my wonderful server from last time. Very attentive, I felt well taken care of.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food and service was excellent, relaxing atmosphere and reasonable prices. I had the streak, medium rare, it was a little undercooked but that was fine. The seasoning was reallllly flavorful!  I'll be back very soon :)
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Had a very tasty and reasonable dinner at this low key neighborhood diner after going to bear happy hour next door at Akbar. Had the fried chicken Rochelle recommended and it was delicious. The mashed potatoes could have used some of the gravy on the chicken and the asparagus was very thick stemmed and woody, but I had switched from the green beans it normally comes with. Will happily go back!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: A real surprise. We were looking for something near the bowl, and thought we might need to settle on food. That was not the case at all! The food was fantastic, the setting quaint, service was great and we'll definitely be back.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We'd passed The Kitchen 1,000 x's & never tried it. One day, my friend asked to meet me there and wow! Great service, chill atmosphere & the food was great. That crème brûlée is for REAL! Don't pass it. Try it!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: First time at The Kitchen; will not be the last time! Food was delicious, & great service. (The crème brûlée is to die for!)
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Omg! My daughter took me to this cozy little gem! Their beet salad was SO damn delicious!! Tried their steak frites and it was SO good as well! Highly recommend it! The food, ambiance and service was impeccable!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Lovely place. Had a hard time finding it but staff was very helpful on phone. Had the Shepard pie, absolutely loved it. Decent parking in the back. Indiscreet off the street but gives it a very almost hidden gem vibe.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: A Los Feliz neighborhood institution with a homey vibe and time-tested classic recipes. Try the crab cakes Benedict for brunch, or the deeply savory Belgian beef stew for dinner.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food is delicious! Great flavor profiles. Love her spin on traditional dishes!  Bravo.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I almost hate leaving this review. I'm afraid the world will swarm this restaurant, and I'll never get a seat. A friend and I had to find an alternate place for dinner when our original choice fell through, and boy, am I glad it did.First, the food was beyond amazing. I had the fried green tomato BLT, and my friend ordered the spicy vegan spaghetti. Both were so good that we made a pact to keep returning until we tried everything on the menu.Second, the staff! Friendly, upbeat, and happy to share what each item consisted of and their recommendations.Third, the ambiance.  If you've ever ventured out of the bigger cities in Louisana to one of the roadside juke joints and loved it, this is your jam.  No fuss, dress down, and spill a little something on your shirt.Fourth, the music, the music, the music, the music.  I wanted to eat and dance at the same time.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: My foodie weekend ended with this wonderful restaurant. We got there when they opened and the young woman who took our order was very pleasant and personable.The young man who brought our food was just as pleasant and personable. We were impressed with these young people who are very service oriented and pleasant and personable. Very rare these days.The food was creative and tasty. Great experience and will go back to try differnt items on the menu.Thank you for the great experience.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Simply, spectacular... i wan to try everything on the menu, yet ill have o reserve that  journey over time... so, so  worth every bite...
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Ordered on UberEats and the temperature of the food was tepid at best.It looked really good so I still had high hopes. Unfortunately, the bbq fried chicken, while juicy, was bland and the skin was flacid and falling off of the chicken Big disappointment.As far as the sides, the dirty red rice had an okay flavor and was the most seasoned item. The greens, though tender, were entirely too bitter and acidic. Overall, each of the items I tried were just imbalanced in flavor, so even though the portions were generous, I wasn't excited to finish the meal.Solid packaging. I don't think I'd return for another meal.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: 4++ great soul food spot near the Fairfax / Mid City area. Has a warm, family/ home style cafe vibe to it. The folks here were very friendly. It's order at the counter style and they bring out the food. So the presentation is beautiful and it still has a fast casual feel to it.This place has been on my go to list for a while now. Finally got to go with couple of friends. I ordered the fried catfish with the cheesy grits as a side. The grits were delicious and had a nice firm texture to them. The fish was fried perfectly with flakey bites and crisp outside. I got to try some my friends shrimp and grits and oxtail taco. Both very good.Definitely a great spot that I would love to return to and try some of the other stuff on their menu. There are a lot of desserts there that I would like to try as well. I was kind of full and we were kind of a rush to get somewhere so I didn't end up getting any dessert this last trip. But they are behind the glass at the ordering counter and they all look wonderful. Especially that German chocolate cake.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The service was so great and made me feel like I was at my family business. The music and vibe was also really good. I can't believe I haven't yet been here. The setup felt so embracing of Black culture and history from the decor to the food. The shrimp and grits was so good. I'm craving it just thinking about it.They did have plaza free parking but it was shared and limited so street metered did the jobThe dessert I had was strawberry cake and it was okay and not as I anticipated but sure if I had asked they would've happily replaced. The lemonade and tea was addicting and so good! Can't wait to go back and try out more.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Omgeee omgeeezeee , this is definitely a must try when in Los Angeles,First let me say don't judge a book by its cover, Do not SLEEP on My Two Cents,Get in there ,get in there ,get in there  ,You'll get a rich warm smile and welcome from the staff .They will help guide you through the vast menu of yummy goodness ,you'll want to order everything on the menu,Before indulging in our main feast ,We were were presented with bite sized cornbread with an  amazing sweet drizzle (I can't remember if it was honey or butter )Whatever it was it was amazing.We then ordered the ground turkey and cheese tacos , Baby Beet Salad ,and Seafood Gumbo, and topped it off with a warm made from scratch crack cake perfectly plated with a dollop of light whip cream and a mint leaf,The food not only looked pretty it tasted amazzzzzingEverrrrrrythinnng was a 10/10 Perfectly seasoned, tender ,flavorful and made with love . And speaking of LOVE We had the privilege of meeting the chef and owner Alisa ReynoldShe was very gracious humble and loving to our family as with the rest of her staff. I told her at your TWO Cents one gains a million dollar experience.,and of all the stars in Hollywood she and her staff are the biggest STARS .
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The venue is small but the flavor is BIG! My two cents is one of my favorite places to grab lunch when I'm in LA. The healthiest soul food experience you'll ever find. With an emphasis on culture and a conscious operation that uses local and organic ingredients, this place will be sure to impact your tastebuds and not your wallet. This isn't just any soul food, its food for the soul! Go get you some!
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I'm a native of the neighborhood one of my best friends favorite spots, she spoils her daughter she loves the steak it was cooked to perfection with a side of grits and green's, fantastic, the most popular shrimp and grit's amazing a variety of homemade desserts made with LOVE just outstanding , l love the poundcake, and the strawberry cake needs to be left out for 1/2 hour to soften the frostingeverything was amazing the best staff young actors. The chefs are very professional you can tell they cook with lots of love & her recipe's all prefect a black & Latino chef brother working together outstanding  presentation . The quality is there not the quantity. I hope you enjoy it as much as l have especially since the sister puts her heart and soul in to every. I left nothing on my plate to take home. It's true the music is loud so if you don't like loud music get it to go! Congratulations on ure new series it's fits you perfectly thanks for all your love & support  ure Mo Better Family
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: This is my second time here and I really do enjoy it but we forgot Saturday was not happy hour and the prices are just too expensive and they don't have any food at all on the happy hour menu which I find strange. Good service and really fresh sushi but my tempura vegetables were way too undercooked. Would really love to come here more often, but considering the prices we won't. The robot is a fantastic addition. It even winks at you. Very fancy and fun.

Comment: What a wonderful place! Everything was perfection. I especially loved my spicy tuna cut roll, they put sesame seeds on it, which really kicks up the flavor. The tempura was perfect and even the edamame was boiled to perfection. I love the way they serve the hot sake and our server Gabby was just fabulous! it is a little pricey, so I'm hoping they'll put some food items on the happy hour menu so we can come back more often. Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had the Tonkatsu ramen...delicious.  Service was friendly and helpful and food came quick.  Have been here multiple times and it never disappoints.

Comment: I went here during my recent Hollywood stay. Comment: I had a very good, but not outstanding experience here which I didn't feel was proportional to the final bill, so I don't think I'll be returning that often even if I live in the neighborhood.- the ambiance / location is very nice, probably the best quality of the restaurant. Very nicely designed and a nice general vibe. Good music too.- that said, the acoustics were horrible and we could barely hear each other talk without excessively shouting over the chaotic din. But I understand this is a sacrifice for a beautiful space and lively crowd.- service was very good, friendly and attentive, helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.- the food was very good, but the menu felt a little generic for LA without any strong unifying concept. Any Spanish inspiration seems to get washed out by an aggressive Californianization which makes it feel like every other LA restaurant of this type regardless of regional inspiration. We appreciated all the fresh and high quality ingredients, but the overall experience didn't seem proportional to the bill we paid at the end.

Octopus, grilled prawns.Love canned food, but the mussels weee just okay.Would come back. Easy valet parking in front.

Comment: Really cannot say enough good things about Kuya Lord. From the food to the service to the quality to the coziness of the dining room - it's all five stars across the board from me.I'd actually never heard of this spot before heading up to the LA area for a work trip. The guy I was with, though, he not only knew about Kuya Lord but was very excited for us to try it out. Luckily, we had a couple of hours to kill between events and this place was close enough for a quick lunch.The dining room was pretty packed when we arrived, though "pretty packed" here means there were two larger parties already posted up at their tables. The dining area is tight, so be prepared.We decided to share a couple dishes: the Lechon Kawali rice bowl (pork belly, rice, salad, $25) and the Beef Tocino bowl (short ribs with egg, $26). We also each got a glass of their honey calamansi juice ($7 each) and - because we're crazy - decided to share the calamansi pie $(10.50).The first bites of the Lechon rice bowl instantly transported me to my youth, to being in a family kitchen with my mom and aunties, to hearing my uncles talking about the proper marinade for the beef, the best way to sear in the flavors, the perfect pairings as sides. The Tocino bowl made me pause - beef still whole on my tongue - to appreciate the complexity of the flavors and the juiciness of the meat.To say we both enjoyed the meals would be an understatement. We're still talking about the food to this day - and this was only the second meal we'd ever shared together. The power of good food, man! Building relationships and memories without even trying.The honey calamansi juice was refreshing, a bit tart and slightly sweet. The calamansi pie was...well, it was a bit much after all that food. We got through a quarter of it before having to tap, but it had a nice bite from the calamansi, and a smooth texture to the filling. I wish we could have taken it back with us, but we had several more hours in the car before we could get back to our hotel, so that wasn't an option.We both very much enjoyed our quick (though slightly expensive) meal here and acknowledge our new friendship was built over the dishes and the conversations we had while in the dining room.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Been here a couple of times and really wanted to love it. Food was greasy, flavors were so salty and it was way overpriced. $58 for three super mediocre things.We had:Laing goodJava rice so oily & salty and the shaved onions came out of a package, not fresh.Calamansi juice $7 each! And it tasted gross.Skip it.Try Spoon & Pork or L.A. Rose.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This is definitely a hole in the wall in a hard to find parking location but once you do, it's so worth it! I loved every plate that I tried, especially the fish. It's a little pricy but they have great portions. The service was self serve for a lot of items but I prefer that rather than asking for everything from a server all the time. The location is small and cozy and it has a cool ambiance. I would definitely come back here again!
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Super good & a little different than other Pilipino places which I like.  Even their desserts r worth an order.

Comment: Kuya Lord is great if you want proper Filipino cuisine. It's one chef and one employee that manages the front. Order at the counter and sit where you find a spot. This place is very small & if you have a large group get it for takeaway. Food prep is slow, but you know what? It's one person & he's pumping out freaking delicious food. So don't be a jerk and be patient. Loved the LAING, LECHON KAWALI, PORK MAMI, LECHON KAWALI RICE BOWL, and the PANCIT CHAMI. ENJOY!VPS: There's only street parking & I ubered just to keep my sanity. :)
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I got the lechon kawali tray and it's perfect for 2 people. It comes with 2 scoops of rice, noodles, pickled papaya and a side of vinegar sauce. All the flavors paired well with each other. Lechon was perfectly cooked and the Java rice had such good garlic taste.The noodles were slightly too rich and got saltier the more I ate. It was tamed by the cabbage, so I wish there was more of that.Parking is tricky. You will need to find street parking which is tough and there is rarely any space in the residential neighborhoods.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food was bomb! Super broad range of flavors and felt like a home cooked meal will be coming back. Friendly staff as well and cool open kitchen!
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The tocino was really good. Probably the best I've ever had. The food is a bit pricey but the quality is there. I would definitely go back in the future.

Both were tasty and has its unique flair while having some traditional components.  The place is on a busy street, but parking was easy since we went after 1pm. Comment: Being half filipino, I always have a soft spot for all things filipino as well as the cuisine so getting to take a bite of this in LA really reminded me of home

Super fresh and doesn't have the fast food taste other hot chicken shops have, you can tell they make it fresh and use fresh ingredients. Comment: I ordered a Loaded Mac, it came ahead of time and it was delicious, It wasn't greasy and the chicken was on point, they have delicious things.
