Comment: Brenden was incredibly helpful in helping me choose what to order when I had never visited before, and was also very kind - 5 star service!
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: It's aiight! Gave the leftover fries to a homeless manChicken strips were over seasonedI got the jalapeño rub which was suggested by cashierGonna have to go on a diet this week
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I've tried Howlin' Ray's, Dave's Hot Chicken, and Angry Chickz.If I were to rate each of these places SOLELY based on taste (of the chicken and not anything else), I'd give Howlin' a 10, Angry Chickz a 9.5, and Dave's an 8.Service wise, Dave's takes the win, but Howlin' is a close second.Accessibility wise, Dave's wins by default cus it has the most locations and stays open the latest depending on the location you go to.Wait wise, Angry Chickz takes the win.Parking wise, I've never had an issue finding a spot at Angry Chickz.If I were to compare these places based on sides, then Angry Chickz has my vote because their cole slaw, pickles, mac n cheese, and buttery rice are FIRE! Plus, I don't like bread (which is why I mainly stick to tenders), so the fact that they offer rice is a complete game changer.Fries from all three places are equally good.Other than flavor, 2 reasons why Howlin' Ray's has an advantage over the other two:1) It travels slightly better than the other two (I've dined in and ordered take out from all 3 places)2) For Angry Chickz and Dave's, if you order anything above medium or hot, the flavor significantly goes down and the spice overpowers the taste. However, with Howlin', I've ordered every spice level on the spectrum (even howlin', which put me in pain for 3.5 days), and as spicy as the food may have been,I was still always able to taste the flavor.But anyway, I'll say this.If I were doing take out, I'd choose Howlin over Angry Chickz. If I were dining in, it'd just be a coin toss between the two. Or I'd choose based on the wait time for each place.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This is how it looks yummy sandwich I get it with no sauce my wife loves the sauce it's .service is great . The place looks amazing .
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing service from two gentleman, food was great (little better than the Ceres location if you ask me). Definitely a must visit.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Jose and Frances were amazing! Great customer service will definitely be back  First time trying this and we loved it. Perfect meal after visiting the museum of love.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The service, food, and presentation were excellent.   We will look forward to another visit.  Well worth the money.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food and flavors of Phenakite are in a league of its own. I knew it might be special after having been to her Porridge & Puffs restaurant before the pandemic. Chef Minh Phan curates her menu so thoughtfully, and to watch her in the kitchen is to watch an artist and chef building every dish with love. The mochi dish is not only delicious but an event that awes and inspires (I didn't take a pic so as not to ruin the surprise). Excited to see what the future brings for this chef and her food.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Phenakite has returned in a super stealth, under the radar multi course fashion inside of the Forest from the Trees art installation in East downtown Los Angeles.You are shocked when you refresh the Phenakite Tock for your daily check to see if they are back and serving and see actual reservations. You make one with no hesitation or care about the cost.The no-publicity approach seems to be destined to keep things on the DL. There appears to be a single seating for just five tables per night. It's all inclusive, food, tip and alcohol paid for when you make the reservation on Tock.The evening begins with a non-alcoholic yuzu drink while you wait for a private time in the art installation. Unusually everyone at your dinner has arrived early or on time (besides a party that no-showed, shockingly). Which left some lag in the schedule as the art installation has some time padded in. You enjoy the cool air and the opening of the exhibit where a series of microphones have been cleverly changed into small speakersThat experience is great; and interesting, however the real magic begins when you slip into a gallery esque dining room. Five tables all facing a kitchen where Chef Minh Phan works with her team composing a multi course meal. You might say it's nine or ten courses but some of the courses include multiple small dishes so you wouldn't argue if the chef told you it was a 15- or 16-course meal.Thematically the idea is tied to that of the art exhibit, indigenous foods (tho not religiously, like you might find at Owamni - The Sioux Chef, in Minneapolis), no waste, and the heartfelt imaginative cooking of the chef herself that is unlike any other in Los Angeles.Her laptop sits nearby connected with an aux cable to a speaker. It keeps turning off as the laptop goes to sleep and the chef fiddles with it to restart her playlist of 90s and 00s indie rock and alternative. Wilco and the Magnetic Fields serenade you.The walls are stark white with gallery lighting and a few branches screwed into them, but some have fallen. The wooden tables are decorated in a way that's elegant but also homey and reminiscent of how your mom or aunt might.And then the food. Bold at every step. Looking at past Phenakite menus you see some of her themes, a blowtorch (which ties wonderfully to the art exhibit) lights filled mochi and a fig leaf on fire, creating smoke and ash that drifts over the table during the course.Fauna of the forest with a flavor profile that is dreamlike. Different stems and pieces that might be thrown away used and pickled.A series of small dishes including a three sisters dish, a crab cake with the perfect season of dill and tarragon, pickles from the sea to go with it.  The lone dish of the night that fails to live up to its brothers and sisters is a shrimp with an elegant birds nest of root and tuber tempura fried on top of it. Salty and beautiful but pales compared to the flavors of everything else you are served. Perhaps that misses the point, and the salt is there to cleanse the palette.A fish dish with a medley of flavors and vegetables and perfectly splayed out fried mushrooms. The porridge course that one expects and loves from the beloved chef behind Porridge + Puffs. Two remarkable bites of venison with bright seasoning and mouthing numbing qualities.A course called a Dance Party that again minimizes the waste from the kitchen. Followed by a staple herbal granita and a crème desert.Throughout the meal alcohol pairings were served. They match the food beautifully and you make note of new wineries to check out in Santa Barbara next time .The service is warm and enthusiastic. The servers when introducing themselves reveal that they are an art student and an actress. It's at once surprising, revealing and excusing. Wines are poured occasionally with no explanation of the vintage and food dropped off without explanation, the menu is on the table so you can read, but the story is slightly lost in these moments. The lack of experience is at once endearing while also occasionally jarring given how remarkable the meal is.You embrace the at times awkward service with the same love and familiarity that the staff and space embrace you and embrace the strange situation they have found themselves in.From the entire time you felt purpose, warmth, and love poured into the meal you've been served. There isn't anything else quite like it, and you feel bad about wanting to tell people about it, as if it being secret could help it exist in its purity for a bit longer.And at the same time, you must talk and tell your friends about it, because you leave changed and touched in a way that few other meals ever accomplish.As you leave the gallery, You wave goodbye to the chef, and wish you could have this first experience all over again for the first time
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had really high hopes for this place after getting LA Times restaurant of the year and a Michelin star. Overall I think the concept was cool but the execution on food and plating was lacking.First, they seat you by order of which you arrived. The weird thing is, they don't take note of who arrived first and go around asking everyone. If you plan on seating by order of arrival, then a staff member should take note to make it an easier transition to the table for the guests. Other than that, I'd say the service was solid.Some of the plating felt a bit too much, random stones on a plate or unneeded rocks. I was able to look past that but the food was just not executed well at all. There was a tempura dish that wasn't crispy, it had no crunch and felt like it was sitting in oil for way too long. The pork belly course was way over cooked. I could see each fiber and I had a tough time cutting into it. The mochi that accompanied the dish was great though. The fish dish was severely overcooked as well, I couldn't take more than a bite. At first, I thought it was just an off night but when I spoke to friends who went prior to me, they all commented similarly. I'm not sure if it's lack of a proper kitchen or what but for $200+ per person, I was expecting a lot more.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Chef Minh Phan and team have created something very VERY special. This was more than just a meal. It was an experience. Everything felt near perfect, from the food, to the drinks, to the staff, to the ambiance and serving-ware. It's definitely a splurge meal that should be saved for a special occasion, but for me this is what all fine dining should aspire to be.THE FOOD: They only offer a nine-course set meal. It was a tremendous progression of tastes, flavors and stories that are meant to be a journey through the land, sea, and air. Some items didn't entirely hit, but overall it was a near impeccable journey. One of my few complaints is that they serve a lot of food, but don't let guests take leftovers home...so bring your appetite!THE DRINKS: We shared a beverage paring and it was a great match to the meal and felt like a perfect amount of drinks.THE SPACE: The team somehow transforms the courtyard of a coworking space into a fantastic secluded outdoor garden. It would be nice if they had heaters, but it is protected enough from the elements that it didn't get too cold.This was quite simply my favorite Los Angeles meal / dining experience over the past couple years.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Best restaurant in LA for a reason.We loved the food & interesting drink & wines pairings at @phenakite.la but it is the heart & soul of the people especially Chef Minh Phan who presented the mochi & pork belly dish as a release ceremony asking us to think of something to release as she set the dish on fire.My fire burned especially bright as I wished the breast cancer treatments worked and will never return.Thank you for an amazing dinner filled with excitement, Love and Light on our anniversary and during Breast Cancer Awareness month!!!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We appreciated the dining experience after reading the LA times review several months ago. Feed was excellent. Service was fantastic as staff are fully explained the ingredients of the dish as well as the intent. One thing that confused us was their requirement to see proof of vaccine when the entire dining area is located outside. I'm not anti-vaxx but I asked why this precaution was mandated when there are no county protocols instructing diners to show show vax proof of eating outdoors. I think this was unnecessary and when I asked for an explanation I was just given shrug of the shoulders by the host. Really strange.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had a wonderful pre-bday (for Ishita, my wife) and pre-anniversary dinner at Phenakite on September 17, 2021.Chef Minh Phan and her team are among the most welcoming, warm (though being under the stars was a bit chilly at times ), and caring we've ever met. The food was delicious, exquisitely prepared and evocative of memories and #feels. From the moment Chef Minh greets us with "hello friends", we were taken on a gustatory journey that was exotic yet familiar. This gem of a restaurant, born in the midst of the pandemic, truly embodies the mineral that forms under extreme pressure and conditions it is named for. Definitely recommend!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Magical. Perfection. Creative beyond words. Photos of the space and the food do not do the restaurant any justice, but maybe that's a good thing. Every twist, turn, & corner was a surprise. I don't want to ruin it for everyone. So just go! Book the ticket. You will not regret.They are requiring that diners show their vaccination card, so don't forget to have it handy! I had a moment of panic as we were checking in and had to search through my emails.Chef Minh Phan is so welcoming, sweet, and seriously an artist. She's put so much thought into every detail of your experience. She's injected Vietnamese soul into her food, and every time I spotted it in the dish, it took me back to a part of my childhood.Best part? You can request a vegan menu.Loved everything about tonight. It was so special and will go down in my books as one of the best meals I ever ate. Thank you!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We so enjoyed our magical meal here.  We are fans of the chef's other restaurant, Porridge+Puffs (temporarily closed during the pandemic) and were not disappointed in her fine dining experience.  She is an artist, plain and simple.  It felt like an leisurely stop at an oasis during the pandemic.  Delicious and creative food, friendly staff, lovely setting.  We had let them know about a few food restrictions ahead of time, which they seamlessly accommodated.  We are grateful and look forward to seeing what Chef Minh does next.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was amazing . It is. It a sit down place but food was amazing . Great to go or for a quick meal
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: This is the best thing I ever eaten for breakfast in my life! And I know a good breakfast!!! I still dream of the day I took my first bite!I am probably moving back to L.A just so I can eat egg tuck 3-4 times a week at least!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I saw this place on TikTok and had to try it so I ordered an egg sandwich with avocado and bacon threw Uber Eats oh man it's very good.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The food is delicious! You have to visit place if you are in LA. Their mango iced tea is beyond the great! I love everything! There is a small line every time but order is coming out fast. They are currently working to go but it may be even plus for everyone to have a juicy and enormously delicious breakfast egg sandwich!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Egg tuck is always a 12/10. Though known for their sandwiches, their breakfast burrito is my favorite in town. Crispy tots and I love to add bacon or chorizo.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Was looking for an easy breakfast place but was worried about a crazy line since it was a Sunday mid afternoon. Egg Tuck location isn't a dine-in type of establishment, which is fine by me, I was able to make my order on their tablets setup in store. Easy to use, made modifications and added a little extra to my bacon & egg sandwich. The wait time was minimal, maybe about 8 minutes, there was a line ahead of us, but 8 mins is nothing in comparison to trying to dine in somewhere. Food is always excellent, salivating thinking about it now! Lol
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Well what shall I say they nobody else have written already? Yes the sandwich is great, the eggs so fluffy you can't believe they make them fresh every single time, the bread crispy - I wish they would have an non white bread alternative but that's on a high Niveau - the bread they serve is just delicious.Yes it is messy to easy and somebody recommended wet towels - yes you better have them handy. And if you are a big guy like me maybe even a shirt to change hahah.What picture shall I'll make that wasn't madeAlready? Look at all of em And then get here and enjoy!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Great sandwich.  Fluffy eggs.  Well seasoned.   Great tots too.   I ordered online and that seemed to work well as there was a pretty big crowd waiting at the restaurant when I picked up my sandwich.   Short walk from my place so it's a perfect morning breakfast sandwich place for me.   Definitely will order from here when I have guests in town.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The egg burritos were 10/10. Fast and efficient service. Great newer spot. Can't wait to try it again.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Super good and tasty food, I highly recommend. Service is always welcoming. And the place is not to eat in, but it's great to pickup
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Let's talk about the menu. It is small, but it's enough for an egglicious breakfast.  Everything is tasty.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I like the pancake ... sandwich was good! But not the burritos... nice hotel, the restaurant is soso...
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: I came here during Labor Day weekend for brunch with my friend. It's a smaller restaurant so expect a bit of a wait but you can use the Yelp waitlist to shorten your wait time. I'm not sure if they're newly really popular because the hostess seemed a bit overwhelmed. It was drizzling this day and we were first seated outside but requested to be moved inside for obvious reasons.Service was fine. Our waiter was attentive but obviously busy with other customers.For food, I got the eggs Benedict with bacon and avocado. It was good but nothing spectacular. My friend got the French toast and liked it.The mimosa flights were delicious and i liked that we got our own champagne bottles.All in all, a nice restaurant but just needs to work on dealing with really busy days.
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: Such a quaint little spot in Korea town! We loved it ! The food and service were superb!
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: Most amazing food ! Please try the chilaquiles ! Food is big portions if you don't eat big portions maybe order one and share with whoever your eating with!
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: The service is amazing, from our waitress Anna to the beautiful woman at the door, I forgot to get her name, they were both very sweet, kind and helpful. H Cafe has self ordering and paying which makes the whole experience that much more enjoyable and convenient. I ordered the chicken and waffles plate and lemme tell you how juice those thighs were! This was my first time but I will be back.
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: Honestly, so good. Tried popping yolk and that was mid. Everything is good, from the lattes to the food. Hidden gem, tried it cause we were staying at the hotel. What an amazing discovery. Highly recommend. We got the French toast sampler and the chicken and waffles, so good!
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: Where do I begin....First and foremost, the actual ambiance and vibe of the restaurant is actually pretty nice. Music is probably way too loud to actually converse with whoever you take. But the vibes are over all niceWe had the espresso martinis and the mimosa flight and drinks were actually over all pretty good.Food was a different story. Pancakes we ordered were undercooked. French toast was ok. Definitely over priced for how good the food is though. Drinks were also over priced. They were good but not 20 bucks an espresso martini good.The service is cool, you get seated and you pretty much order everything on your phone.It's cool and trendy if you're into that, but not really for me.Will not be returning.
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: The food was great. The breakfast sandwich was good. The accompanying potato brick was a bit weird choice but still good.We ordered everything through the app and paid through the app. Other than that not much to add to this review.A fun brunch or breakfast location, connected to the hotel. worth a visit if you are staying at the hotel or in the area.
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: The food was all amazing. We complemented the food with a side of mimosas. The service was great. Our waitress continued to visit our table and ask if we needed anything else. The ambience is great. I would definitely recommended this place.
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: perfect brunch spot in Ktown! not adequate to get "rowdy", which is totally fine by me lol. not exactly cheap, but the food is delicious, the ambience is great, and you can order through your phone (don't have to wait for your server in case they get slammed), which is a plus, so i believe it's reasonable. i've tried many different dishes (not pictures unfortunately) and they were all great!
Address: 3200 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Juice Bars & Smoothies

Comment: Perfect and very fresh oysters and amazing pasta with black truffles!!!!Best place to go out!!!
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Another cute but "just okay" Italian spot in Art's District. Nothing super special about the menu. We were a larger group, so people ordered different things and lots of appetizers, but not one of us thought our food was good. The dishes either felt over salted or bland to us.  I think we liked sides and the appetizers more than the pastas. The guy taking our order even told my friend to not order one of the pasta dishes because he didn't think it was good.Also, the wait staff didn't seem like they liked their job or maybe they were confused. I don't know if it was because we were a big "younger" looking group or something, but it felt like our waiter didn't want to serve our group or just didn't have good communication skills. He didn't really talk to us nicely.My friend did valet here because it was a Saturday night, and parking in this area is just terrible. After dinner, we had wandered next door to get some ice cream nearby, so my friend left his car with the valet for maybe 30 minutes after we left the restaurant, but when we returned, we didn't see the valet guy, and the wait staff told us that the valet was closed...when it was actually not. We called the number at the valet post, and nobody picked up. Luckily, the valet guy returned like 15 minutes afterwards (he was grabbing a car). I don't know why the waiter would tell us that...because not only did the waiter not help us...but he put us in unnecessary panic for a little bit.
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: What a fantastic place!Great ambiance and very friendly staff.Everything we ordered for the group of 9 people was exellent! Best scaloups, delicious octopus, succulent meat,yammy deserts! Food started coming in 5 minutes after ordering. We loved every minute of it being there!Coming back for sure!
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Great good, ambiance and although new service, we scored. Food was DELICIOUS. Stay open minded and fun, this is a great place
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Great food and ambience ! Love their cocktails! Seafood platter is the best . Everything so detail and delicious ! Went during Sunday Brunch! Dinner will have more variety ! Cheers
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: What a horrible experience!!!!We booked a party of 8 here for my birthday and I will never come back here again. It started out well, good ambiance, clean, nicely lit, but our experience quickly deteriorated after.I should have known something was off when our waiter asks if there are any dietary restrictions and then says okay well I'll tell you your options later and never did. Then before he leaves the table says "it'll be better for me if one person places the orders for everyone." I'm sorry but 6 adults and 2 children is not a very large group. We placed our orders and waited and waited and waited. Twice they came by and said the food is coming, but never a when, or a sorry for the wait, or would you like a round of drinks for the table? We waited an hour and a half for our meals. While tables that arrived after us received their entrees.Everyone was so hungry that they ate the food that was delivered underprepared. We had raw underdone pasta dishes and my filet was completely rare and bloody when I requested medium. Now what really made the night horrible, the waiter comes to the table and says to my husband, "I told you that it would have helped to order family style" blaming us for the poor service. I looked at him and said that is just an excuse and putting the blame on us for ordering individual meals is poor customer service, he tried to argue back to which I said to him to just stop arguing, apologize and stop making excuses and if he could bring us the check so we can pay and leave.About 10 minutes after, a young lady comes to the table and apologizes and says she will take 10% off the bill. I said thank you we would just like to pay. When the bill came it had 10% taken off and a 20% gratuity added!!!What a terrible experience, poor service, undercooked food, lousy wait times and too expensive for this quality. Nice establishment but we will not be coming back or recommending.
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: What a great restaurant with attentive service and delicious food. I came by for drinks and the bartender made some incredibly tasting libations, there was a Dj setting the fun vibe! We enjoyed our time here so much we hosted a dinner the following day. Food was mostly Italian, a beautiful charcuterie board and bruschetta started us out we then moved on to pastas and juicy steaks and the grilled seafood dish was everyone's favorite. The inside restaurant is beautiful really enjoyed watching the chefs in the kitchen. The outdoor patio was lovely on a mild summer night. Will definitely be back hope to see Victor and the rest of the team who made our visits memorable. Also loved their Barbie themed menu. My only complaint was their pasta--it wasn't Al dente it was undercooked, tiny portions, and bleh flavors, the linguine allá vongole had canned clams as they were not served in their shells.
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: We absolutely loved this place! It had a beautiful patio for dining, the dishes/drinks were delicious and they provided excellent service. Our waiter was an expert on recommendations and the food was brought to us very promptly. The portions were neither too big nor too small, and they even offered a special menu inspired by a recently premiered movie.
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Victor was the absolute best waiter you could have asked for. All his recommendations were perfect for the whole party and he added to the experience with his genuine personality. We need more Victor's in the world. Trust him when he says I recommend the "..."
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: The ambiance is always enjoyable and the food is stellar. On the weekends, there is a DJ playing music and makes our dining experience ever better. Service is good. The chefs can be seen preparing the food in the kitchen in the center of the restaurant. My personal favorite waiter is Viktor. He knows that place like the back of his hand. I request him everytime I go.
Address: 225-227 S Garey St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Our server was rude and the vibe felt pretty pretentious. Didn't appreciate the uppity attitude. She didn't even come by to refill our water. Didn't check on us one time. We asked for recommendations and she read us the entire menu. Honestly I don't like to write bad reviews but there are SO many great restaurants in LA, so why should we come here? They completely forgot about one of the dishes we had ordered and they offered us a free slice of cake which was nice. Our server had left by that point and someone else had taken over (who admittedly was much friendlier -- the only reason for the second star). A message to the owners: get some new wait staff or train them to appreciate the business that walks through your doors. No reason to make your customers feel judged or unimportant. They literally keep your lights on.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food was incredible. Every box  was ticked--savory, salty, sweet, herbaceous, spicy. The ambiance was relaxed and welcoming. The service was informed and friendly. Exceeded all expectations.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Had a wonderful dinner with friends here last night. Everything is shared style and we probably ordered too much, but sorry not sorry, cause everything was delicious.  The cucumbers with melon, the fried cauliflower are what dreams are made of. The squid and the steak, were so tasty and you cannot forget the flakey bread (get all the sauces) and epic rice dish!  Now I have a new place to order take out from, until I can return to have a proper dinner with friends! Thank you so much!
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I went to this restaurant because it was recommended by the LA Times and my kids, who live in the area.  We were seated on hard plywood benches and seats. No cushion available on the back of the banquet and the tables were positioned close together, so the noise level was extreme.Our server told us that it was a "shared plate" restaurant and although portions were large we should order 2-3 plates each. All the servings were tiny! Entrees were very small and didn't come with any side vegetables or extras, yet you were charged for a full main dish. We ordered the eggplant as our main. It took 45 minutes to get our meal. There were two tiny stuffed (more like a garnish)  Japanese eggplants on the plate.  I saw other "mains"that were equally as small. This is not a sharing restaurant - unless sharing your credit card for overpriced food, 4% for employee health benefits (since when is the customer on the line for that! )and poor service is what they mean by sharing!
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Finally got around to trying Kismet! Arrived for HH from 5-7, and was amazed at the great happy hour deals. They offer a fairly generous pour of wine around $10, and all the food items were around that price point as well. We ordered the tomato toast (to die for), salmon toast, chicken skewers,  fried sweet potato (not pictured), summer melon (also not pictured), and another tomato toast because it was that amazing.The chicken skewers weee not on the happy hour menu, but the juiciest chicken I ever did eat. Considering they have a rotisserie a little bit down the street, I wasn't surprised that it was AMAZING. The fried sweet potato was soooo good and the tomato toast is a must!It's a cute little restaurant with simple decor. Candles are lit around sundown, and the staff were great.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Fantastic food, service, and ambiance. Everything my girlfriend and I ordered was fantastic. Compared to dinner at AOC a few weeks earlier, Kismet was better in all areas, especially value. Highly recommended, and would absolutely go back again to get deeper into their menu.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great food and love how the staff is so chill and it feels like a friends and family vibe. It's a good idea to order many dishes and great for sharing.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of the best neighborhood restaurants! Food and wine is always superb, wonderful service and ambiance. Always an interesting crowd.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing Service, the waitress we had was also vegetarian and had the best suggestions! The food was great and the vibes were awesome. Love this place just wish there was easier parking so we could go more often!
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Excellent, friendly service.  The cucumber and melon salad was tasty and refreshing, the baked stuffed eggplant delectable, and the lamb ribs were very tender and good.The chocolate semi-freddo had proper texture/temperature and was made from quality chocolate with discernable taste notes .Would love the option for a fresh fruit tart and expresso.
Address: 4648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Not much of a fan of food that is pre heated on lamps.  The fried rice was basic, I would skip that. But the bulgogi was really savory.  The prime beef lemon pepper burrito was impressive and my favorite thing about Hanshik.  The tacos were pretty good as well.  The wings were really crispy and juicy on the inside.  I really enjoyed the wings. They do have a lot of flavor.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: A bit disappointed.   I came to an conclusion that this place is for non-Koreans.  Food are very sweet for Koreans' taste.  Tried three different lunch boxes but all main dishes were sweet.  I tried this place cause I wanted to bring some lunch boxes for my non korean friends a week after so they can try authentic Korean lunch boxes. They might like them who knows but I didnt think they are authentic.  I did not like the food =(I decided to go a different place for lunch box take out.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Hansik Express has a modern, spacious interior with plenty of tables for dining in. The service was great and very similar to Panda Express style. You can order Korean fusion tacos or burritos as well as combos A, B, or C with many options.I ordered Combo A Power Bowl: Chicken Fried Rice, Spicy Shortribs, Meat Pancake, Pork Belly, and Fried Shrimp. Everything tasted great and my favorites were the spicy shortribs and pork belly. The flavors were reminiscent of the meals my mom would cook at home so it was very comforting and delicious!
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great food! Upper scale Panda Express for about the same price. Choices are insane and everything I tried was excellent
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Been here four times during my time in LA and THIS HITS THE SPOT!!! The fried chicken is made fresh and super crispy, the meat is so tender and super big actually. i get the soy garlic (the spicy version is actually super spicy) and the honey butter. it's soooooo yummy. super nice staff too. 10/10 recommend
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: If you love Korean food and Mexican food, then this is the place for you! I mean, galbi beef tacos and pork belly kimchi burritos just sound amazing, and it turns out they taste amazing too!!I also tried their Korean fried chicken in soy and original flavors. They are super crispy & satisfying to eat. I will definitely be back for more wings.Self parking in this plaza may need some luck, especially during weekend nights. But I believe they have valet (as this is K-town).
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I was a little scriptural about Korean/Mexican tacos when my friend took me to try thus place on her Groupon. The Calbi tacos were one of the best I had in my life. On the second visit I got a burrito - excellent taste and huge, one can easily get 2.5 meals out of one burrito. Very good fusion of Korean and South American flavors, bravo  chef Kang!
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Ordered take-out for the first time and was very satisfied with the food and presentation.  I had one of the boxes - it was a ton of food!  Will definitely return and try other options.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Food was amazing and service was great. I got the 5 item plate and it was so amazing to be able to try different items. Even though they give small portions its enough to fill you up because I had four other items. So amazing- i will be going again when I am in that area.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Only reason I give this place one star is because there's no option to select zero star!Based on the customer service we received from this Asian girl staff, made me and my partner to walk out of the restaurant.When we selected Korean spicy rib as one of the entree option, she was filling up dinner box with bones with no meat on it. We sincerely asked her if that option can be replace with other menu since only bones are left and she said "I can't because I already put this food (several pieces of bones) on the dinner box and that can't be replace with other menu option."We were just appalled by her response and decided to walk out the restaurant.Isn't it common sense that if there are no meat and only bones are left, staff needs to take it off from food menu and inform customer that it's sold out and have them select different entree.If that selection was a fish entree, I bet she would give me fish bones and would tell me that she can't take it off because I chose that option and once that bones are put it into the dinner box, you can't take it off nor replace with other menu.I am just really upset how this ignorant and imprudently trained staff could treat customer with this type manner. We are paying for not only good food but service as well.How are some of these Elite Yelp reviewers gave this place five stars.To restaurant owner or staff manager:I stopped by your restaurant at 7/7/24 Friday at 6:00pm. This staff needs to be addressed and retrained. Customers are not stupid. We are going to your place expecting good food and decent service. We've always trust food quality and service from Chef Kang's restaurants.When did Korean rib bones became a new trending menu!This location
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Ste A3 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I made an online reservation a few days ago after an add for this restaurant popped up on my IG. The main picture was well put together line up of YAKITORI which quickly caught my eye. Im a huge fanatic of Japanese food as my name is from Japan. Yesterday on the day of my reservation which was set for 7:30pm I had an unplanned event pop up so I had to call in and reschedule for 8pm. Jaime answered the phone and was so kind, he made me changing my reservation easy and breezy.Walking up to the place I noticed how modern yet elegant it is, the ambiance is relaxing and chill with lots of fabulous smells. Jaime greeted us with a smile and some laughs and had the chefs table available for us along with some complimentary sake shots to start off our dinner. He let us know all about the menu and what the most popular dishes currently were.Very quickly the Manager Ray introduced himself and the young beautiful chef Sophia. Ray let us know that the specialty item was the Tako Taco he was very helpful as ever dish came out he offered us a story, I really enjoyed this since it felt like I was brought closer to each item of the menu.As for food items we went all out and ordered, I'm going to name them in order which I loved the most form best to least.1. Half a dozen oyster - Ume Mignonette and Serrano peppers. 10/102. Beef Tongue a La Lengua - pearl onions, shiso lime sauce . 10/103. 12" Bone Marrow - comes with grilled mochi garlic bread. 10/104. Pork Belly - Yuzo Kosho 10/105. Salmon Furikake - avocado mint and key lime 8/106. Skirt Steak & Wasabi - grated wasabi 8/107. Wasabi Short Ribs - garlic oil marinade fermented wasabi 8/108. Squid Ink Karaage - I don't eat chicken but I tried a piece tasted good loved the charcoal garlic ranch.  7/109. Black Fried Rice - I don't eat mushrooms so also didn't have much of this dish but I did try it the rice itself was very well done with good flavor. 7/10Sides:1. YAKI ONIGRI - rice ball, bonito flakes, furitake 9/102. TSUEKEMONO - daily house pickles (perfect pallet cleanser) 9/10Cocktails:1. Watermelon Sugar- love this drink and the candy it comes with 10/102. Last of US - I got mine without the ginger beer 8/10Dessert:1. Bichotan Brownie- AMAZING BEST BROWNIE IVE EVER HAD! 10/102. Green Tea Ice cream - well executed and fresh 9/10I look forward to coming back!!! Thank you to all the staff, they made us feel like royalty.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Great food. Make sure you park in the parking lot, validation is available.Great service. We came on a Saturday. Reservation is not needed.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: This is a nice and premium feeling yakitori place.You can find this restaurant inside of an upscale shopping mall. There are Outdoor, indoor, and bar seats, all of which you can choose from. We walked over from a close-by apartment, so I can't speak to parking or public transit, but I believe there is a subway station close-by. We visited on a Saturday evening and were able seat right away without a reservation.There were plates, sides, and raw portions of the menu, but we were there for the yakitori. There's also an interesting cocktail menu. The yakitori menu had a pretty extensive selection. I opted for the pork belly, and skirt steak & wasabi. the price difference was drastic, with pork belly being 6, vs skirt steaks 18. The latter sounded interesting and I wanted to say I at least tried it. I also ordered an IPA that I haven't heard of before.The bartender assisting us was very knowledgeable of the drinks menu and was able to help my sister in finding a drink that she might like. We also got to see him make the cocktail in front of us. The drinks didn't take too long to be ready for us. The yakitori however did take a little bit longer than we were expecting. You can see the kitchen, and it doesn't look like there are many spots to grill the skewers, so maybe that's why.The pork belly was delicious. Something about the sauce that it was covered in, really brought out the taste. I did save the more expensive skewer for last, but I ended up being a little disappointed in the skirt steak, because there wasn't as much flavor as I was expecting, given the price. Maybe it was the wasabi, as I think it is real wasabi, and not the one you would see at your everyday sushi restaurant. The wasabi didn't add much to the taste, and I like wasabi. With that being said, if I were to come back, I'd rather get 3 pork bellies as opposed to 1 skirt steak.This was a really nice experience. Minus the wait and the high expectations of a more expensive menu item, this is definitely worth the visit. If you're looking for an upscale yakitori place, this is it.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Dope spot at The Bloc on 7th!I was there for a dinner with a friend and we were greeted by Becky who ended up being our server for the evening as well.She was super nice and helped us navigate the menu and let us know what the popular dishes were.We ended up doing the prix fixe Eggcellent Menu.I ordered a I Choose Yuzu cocktail to start the meal off and it was definitely yuzu forward...refreshing, clean and delicious.The miso corny soup came out first and it was solid. I don't necessarily judge an establishment by their miso, but if your miso isn't good...I lose hope for the rest of the food. So, this was a nice preview.The next item was the avo tuna toast which is wild caught tuna, yuzu smashed avocado, crispy rice, green onion, house togarashi. The yuzu definitely stood out, but maybe a bit much for my taste personally, but the tuna was good and the crispy rice was toasted nicely.The chicken meatball, pork skewers and the mushroom skewers came out next...loved the chicken meatball and the sauce it came with. The pork belly was good, but a bit salty and so were the mushrooms. I couldn't finish the mushrooms...Then, my personal favorite, the black chicken karaage...black because of the squid ink, cooked perfectly...crispy outside with a nice crunch, tender on the inside and that black garlic ranch...chef's kiss!There was also broccolini with fried garlic that was another favorite, and an onigiri that was meh (you can pass on this if you're ordering a la carte).The staff was attentive but not overbearing...Becky, you were amazing!Definitely check out the extensive Japanese whiskey selection and their cocktails! I will definitely be back for all the rest of the items I did not get to try!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: We were so happy to find this phenomenal yakitori restaurant! We were in Los Angeles visiting for only a week and tried several different dishes: chicken thigh & onion, chicken meatball, black chicken karaage, wasabi shortribs, chicken gizzard, unagi, onigiri, black fried rice, and marble sesame cheesecake. Loved it so much we came back for a second round. Service was top notch - our server Manny really took care of us and made sure we were happy. All the yakitori was grilled to perfection and the meat was super tender. Additionally the ambience is dark but cozy. My personal favorites are the wasabi short ribs and unagi. I recommend coming with an appetite and trying various dishes!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Amazing food and phenomenal service, Manny was the best server I've met. the ambiance and interior decor was great and the food and drinks were all great. I highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Came to Hatch for dinner on a Thursday! Made a reservation, but I probably would have been able to get a table without one.FLAVOR (3.5/5):1. AVO TUNA TOAST: The server recommended this one and photos of it on yelp caught my eye... but the flavor was underwhelming and tasted like something you could make at home.2. CORN TEMPURA TOWER: Good, tastes like your standard corn tempura. Not sure it makes sense for the price though.3. UNAGI: Unagi was good and tender - tbh, I prefer it on sushi rather than yakitori, but it comes with crispy rice on top for varied texture.4. PORK BELLY: The pork belly is a thicker cut and was cooked well.5. BEEF TONGUE: I've never had a thick cut of beef tongue, but was pleasantly surprised. The umami flavor was good and it was really tender.6. SKIRT STEAK & WASABI: The two skewers we got were different sizes of meat and my friend's skewer ended up tender while mine was dry. Flavor-wise, the wasabi isn't very strong and doesn't add much to the skewer. Can't really justify this for 18 dollars.7. SQUID INK KARAAGE: Previous reviews raved about this dish, but I don't see the appeal. Don't get me wrong, the chicken was tender and had a nice crispy batter, but it's nothing super special. Tastes like good chicken karaage.8. BLACK FRIED RICE: The black fried rice was probably my favorite out of everything we ordered. I liked the salty flavor profile and thought it paired well with the karaage.9. GREEN TEA HIGHBALL: I liked this drink! I mentioned I wanted something smooth and this was recommended to me by the server. Would definitely get this again.SERVICE (5/5):Service was good.AMBIENCE (5/5):Intimate and cute. Would recommend coming in on a busier day like Friday or a weekend for the atmosphere.PARKING (4/5):Garage parking and Hatch validates. We didn't stay for very long, but still had a small charge (I think one dollar).TAKEAWAYS:Hatch was good, but its yakitori is not my favorite, especially for the price point. While service and atmosphere were amazing, food-wise everything fell short.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: I finally got to have dinner here and didn't let us down. The staff was really cool and attentive. Beautiful range of cocktails and lots of helpful hints with the menu. We tried a lot of dishes and they were all unique and full of flavor. It was a great combo with seeeing a movie after at Alamo Drafthouse. From the eggplant to the chicken hearts it was fantastic.. We will be back...
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Small bites. Great cocktails. Wonderful staff.Parking structureSmall patioUpscale casual ambiance. You could wear jeans and a tshirt or a date night outfit and still be comfortable.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Second time coming to this spot, but this time for happy hour! They have happy hour Tuesday-Friday 4-6 PMDrinks: ordered the matcha highball and honestly didn't taste the matcha at all! But the drink was strong and refreshing so I'd give it a 4/5. + the happy hour deal was good!!Food: my favorite here is their black chicken karage and it comes with this delicious black garlic cream sauce which is a 5/5.Their wagyu short ribs were a 2/5 considering the price and how tiny the portions were :( the tuna and avo toast was also good but extremely small.Overall the food here is GREAT, my only gripe is that the portions are super tiny and still pretty $$$, even though it's happy hour.Parking: the BLOC is a super packed plaza and especially if you're coming during HH, expect DTLA traffic. Parking in the structure was easy and they validate it- don't forget because parking is $$$Bottom line, happy hour here is a great way to try out their top picks of the menu, but be warned that the portions are really small! But nonetheless, I would DEFINITELY come back :)
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste G600 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: This is a cute place for content but not a place for memorable/ good eats. The food was very bland and lacked flavor. I was very disappointed because I was expecting a lot more especially since it's black-owned and supposed to be comfort food, but no. The only thing that was good here were the drinks but the food was a hard pass. It's primarily set up cafeteria style so you'll be sitting to next to people, but they do have some setting where you can sit solely with your party. Service wise, it was pretty fast and the waiter was sweet and charismatic.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Food is very tasty and delicious. Our waitress was phenomenal. I love her. Drinks were great as well.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Came here during brunch for my mother-in-law's birthday! We arrived around 12:30pm on Sunday, and it was less than a 20min wait for a party of 8!There are a lot of public parking spaces nearby, but I did see a sign that they validate parking in one of the neighboring lots, so that's nice! We don't know the area too well, so I'll figure that out next time lol.Service is pretty quick, and it's a small place, but very cozy and nice. The food is delicious! I'm really not a breakfast/brunch person, but this place really changed my mind HAHA. Actually, it was the first time I DIDN'T have an alcoholic beverage with my brunch lol.I ordered the Waffle Fried Chicken Sandwich, and it was everything I wanted! So savory/sweet/spicy all in one, and the chicken was so juicy. I'm not a fan of the super runny yolk, but I think next time I SHOULD get my egg more runny, it jus balanced so well with the meal. Waffle was bomb too!!My favorite part was actually the BRICK HASH! It's so nice to look at lol, but also crunchy and delicious!!!!The blackberry limeade was SO GOOD. The cold brew & matcha were so-so. I would jus stick with the limeades. I really wish I tried their alcoholic drinks because I could only imagine what that limeade with a shot of vodka or champagne would taste like... it would be heaven :')Anyway, if you're looking for a chill place with tasty drinks and food, I would definitely recommend!THANKS FOR READING Y'ALL
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: The food was good, I ordered chicken and waffle and tasted the French toast and steak egg. It was nice and cozy inside and the staff was nice. Pretty crowded on a Saturday morning but the wait was under 30 mins.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Excellent Brunch spot!   Food was amazing and the staff was very attentive.  Can't go wrong with the Chicken and waffles.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Great service!Great food awesome mimosas our server was really nice and very polite
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Our chicken Cobb salad was delicious, the fries perfection, location in the flower district felt safe. Beautiful inside, clean restrooms.But the noice level was crazy loud! It has to be the choice of materials for the ceiling, I'm really not sure. It was not a relaxing lunch, I couldn't hear my mom from across the table. We had lunch around 2pm...so the place was not super packed like it had been 30 min prior. Told us the wait was an hour, seated us in 30 min. Had to rush back from shopping.Service was great, the salad and crispy chicken was DELICIOUS! But we will not be coming back.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: The host is awesomely personable. He explained menu items,  held a fantastic conversation, and made us feel welcome.  The Cafe is beautiful, simply furnished, and a nice little oasis in the flower district.The waitress that delivered our food was cold, stand-offish, and seemed to really not want to be there. She didn't say 2 words to us. When we asked for condiments, she still didn't say a word. She made it uncomfortable.The food. The eggs were perfect. The side of bacon was not crispy, it was a tad bit undercooked. The steak had an odd look. It was closer to rare, we ordered medium.  It was not unseasoned (we didn't want to trouble the waitress by requesting  salt or steak sauce).The French toast compote is delicious. The lavender wine spritzer is refreshing, tasty, and delicious.I had a fantastic meal on my first visit. The shrimp and grits, and chicken and waffle were amazing.  I was surprised by the lackluster meal we experienced today.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Go HERE! Every thing was amazing! Waiters as well! Only one small thing threw me off, which was the warm water.. I think it just is a thing they did. but.. I think ice water would've been better due to the fact that it was summer! But it comes room temperature in a glass.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Came here with a friend for brunch and parking wasn't too bad. Food is very typical American fanfare, good and classic. We got the chicken and waffles and pork something which was on top of a brick of hash brown with an egg on top which was pretty good. Also got a mocktail but that was a bit too sweet. Overall pretty good and fast service and cute vibes.
Address: 765 Wall St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Good food, but they keep forgetting to give my tzatziki. Twice already. Check your stuff before leaving.
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Will be back! This place was awesome!! If you're looking for a good, healthy and fresh meal, Sidewalk Grill is the place to go! I have to say, this meal was so filling, and I can eat a lot! We both ordered the chicken shawarma and it was great, perfectly cooked too. You also get to pick one side, so I chose humus. My friend got the tzatziki sauce instead, and it came with so much sauce so next time I go I will definitely be getting the tzatziki! The service was great, took a little bit to get out food but nothing unbearable. We sat outside on their patio and that was nice and spacious!
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great kabobs and rice... We love everything about this place and the owner is always welcoming everyone. Great food at a fair price too
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I LOVE this place for tons of reasons. The chicken kabobs are great and the staff is really nice.  I just have to say that the falafel is not good.  It does not taste like falafel or have the right texture. I got the the falafel plate and received flat, mushy patties that seemed undercooked.
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The cuisine is wonderful, but I always order to go. An adorable little restaurant with both indoor and outdoor sitting. Perfect when you're in a hurry!
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Absolute GEM! The chicken kebab wrap was outstanding, and they do not play about those hot potatoes, amazing.
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Excellent food, nice people first time here was in LA for mom's appointment, found this place was very satisfying Thank you
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Excellent food, used to go nearly every day for remote-work lunch, but they recently nearly doubled the price of everything on their menu and I can't justify spending that much on lunch every day!
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: It's so hard to find a good chicken kabob nowadays.  But this place know how to cook juicy and tasty kabob.  The meat has a nice tint of saffron and hint of garlic.  Cooked to perfection and just the right amount of smokiness and burnt on the meat.  The basmati rice was fluffy and buttery in taste.  The garlic dip complements the chicken and gives it an extra kick .
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I am a regular at Sidewalk Grill and never disappointed.  In addition to making delicious food, all of the staff are kind and amazingly cautious with my allergies.  Thank you Sidewalk Grill!
Address: 1727 N Vermont Ave Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I don't hang out often in Koreatown, but so glad my friend brought me here for brunch. Street meter parking is available (accepts card payment) and there is also valet parking offered. When I first walked inside it reminded me of a cute Korean cafe with cute decor and very much resembles a barnyard. There is an outdoor seating area as well as indoors. I would say plentiful amount of seats. The menu is huge and you can find anything from breakfast, lunch, and dinner dishes as well as tons of drinks and alcohol. Everything looked so good so it won't be my last time coming. Everything came out piping hot and fresh!We ordered:The Barn Omelette - 5/5 (Served from 8am-3pm)Comes with a free coffee as well. This omelette is served with a side of salad, toast and fried potatoes. All great pairings and a really simple but tasty omelette :)Rose Ddukboki - 5/5My first time trying this and OMG soooo good! It definitely has a kick of spicy to it, but in a mild way. The sauce was really good too, i can't really describe it.  The dish itself was pretty big being that it was a lunch portion. Overall it was really good and we had leftovers to take home.A definite gem that will be added to my "must visit again" list.Enjoy!
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: i am a picky eater & I don't like onions, garlic or avacado so i was glad they had something on the menu that they were able not to include those things.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: First time to the restaurant. All the ordered dish tasted delicious. The serving was good. The atmosphere of the restaurant was good. Great place to get late night Korean food. Shrimp quesadillas was really good. No bad experience, would love to visit again.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: This restaurant exudes both elegance and charm, creating a delightful atmosphere for diners. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, contributing to a pleasant dining experience. The menu offers dishes that strike a balance between quality and affordability, making it a worthwhile culinary destination.Among the various options, the mentaiko pasta stood out as a personal favorite, impressing with its flavors and presentation. The attentive service ensured a swift dining experience, enhancing the overall enjoyment of the meal. It's worth noting that the restaurant is well-equipped to accommodate larger groups, as there are ample seats available for parties of up to five.In terms of parking, the valet option provides convenience for a fee of $3. The valet attendant added to the positive experience, displaying a friendly and helpful demeanor. All in all, this establishment offers a fusion of sophistication and charm, making it a place I would gladly return to for another delightful dining experience.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I came here with my friend Erik and was heavily disappointed. This food was SUBPAR... we ordered the assorted skewers (meat all BURNT and NO FLAVOR, stay AWAY) sweet potato fries (false advertisement and sorry excuse for fries) sweet and spicy chicken wings (one of the only good things, good crunch, some flavor, looks better than what it tasted) pasta carbonara (pretty good, flavorful and a nice portion with a little garlic bread). The overall dinner was a big disappointed and felt sore from my behind when they handed me the bill... totaled to over $120 to be left disappointed, screwed and still hungry .-.Service was eh and environment was smooth with a nice big screen displaying the baseball game.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I'm gonna give this a 5 stars because we were actually supposed to go to the place next door. This was a very convenient find as a Korean couple told us that this place was better and I'm glad they did. The ambience at this place was more chill with an outdoors area, dark room, but had lights. It's a great place to just eat and drink with your friends and the price wasn't too bad since the soju was BOGO and there are set menus.I thought the food was decent, 6/10. but the experience was like an 8/10 because the service was fast, they were nice, and everything came out timely.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: The food was tasty and made fresh!I give a 3/5 stars because of the service. Service was not tentative and they had many workers. We noticed many of the workers talking and standing off to the side and didn't fill up our waters when we were sat outside under a hot shaded area.The restaurant is very cute & the outdoor patio is beautiful with lots of plants (not pictured)- I would go again, perhaps we went on a off day, but the food was good for the most part!
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I absolutely LOVE the Barn Cafe! They have the best KFC I have ever tried. They're open late and I love going at night to sit and hang out with my friends. Service is always amazing and street parking is so easy to find. I also love their Kimchi Fried Rice!
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Their menu constantly changed the past few years, they got rid of a really good steak dish I used to love to eat here.Outdoor seating has bug and fly issues.Recently tried their kimchi bacon cream pasta, the sauce was good but the noodles tastes not fresh, tastes fake or out from a box. I don't see myself coming back anytime soon.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Brah I dont know who was cooking tonight but the barn steak was amazing. That dish belongs in a 5 star luxury steakhouse in las vegas or something. Whoever cooked that steak thank you and you deserve a raise. Will be coming back soon to try it agian.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: A cozy little coffee shop  ,they have their own home made syrups and an amazing selection of caffe , they have a service and the location very easy to arrived and park your car I highly recommend this coffee shop.
Address: 228 S Oxford Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: amazing freshly made noodles while you wait it's a must if you are in the neighborhood
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: I really enjoy the chewy handmade noodles and the flavorful sauce. The Szechuan spicy emphasizes the numbing sensation of the sauce. However, the basic version doesn't come with any meat, and at $16, it does seem somewhat expensive.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: You will not leave hungry here! The bowl of the Szechwan garlic soup is the size of my face. The dumplings are great and I haven't tried the cucumbers but those look amazing as well. FYI they do not take cash if you did not know!
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: The food is okay and service was as well. It's place I would visit more out of convenience then desire.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: This place makes the best noodles ever. The noodles are very thick and delicious. I love how the noodles taste and Bang Bang Noodles never fails to impress me. I ordered three noodles and dumplings and they were ready within 10 minutes. The best service ever.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: We came on a Friday night, and luckily we found parking nearby. Once we went inside Citizen Public Market, we found Bang Bang Noodles hidden, in the middle of the hustle and bustle of this lively Culver City hotspot.  This is a great place to see first hand that food could bring random and all kinds of personalties together . The vibes in this part of town are very welcoming.Tingling Cumin Noodle Dry with beef $16: I think this is good if you really like cumin. It was heavy on the cumin, and we didn't finish it all. Because it wasn't being eaten quickly, the noodles stuck together and became clumps.Tomato Dry Noodle with beef $16: This dish was more tasty and had different flavors. I like the taste break with having the texture of veggies and meat in the dish.Overall, I liked the Tomato Dry Noodle, and eat it quickly!Warning:  There aren't many comfortable seats to sit on and seemed like everyone was in a hurry.After eating our dinner, we walked across the street to Salt and Straw. We enjoyed a relaxing Friday night eating our ice cream  on the Culver steps.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Saw this place on TV, so while in LA decided to give it a try. I was sorely disappointed with the taste of the sauce they used on the noodles. I tried the dry noodles and ordered two different styles and both were unappetizing. Sorry, but I can't recommend this place. We asked for a refund which they agreed to issue for one of our dishes, however, it never appeared on my credit card statement. Not very nice!
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: "Why do they call it Bang Bang" -- I asked myself. Before getting blown away watching the chef pull the noodles and slap them down onto the counter as they elongate the dough. "OH, IT GOES BANG BANG"I smiled and tried noodles in both soup and without soup. Pros and cons to either option, but I believe I prefer the soup-less version more. I really do like the Szechuan flavors throughout the noodles.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: This bowl of noodles packed so much flavor and spice and messy goodness that I just knew I was going to get some on me.  And I did, but so damn worth it!  Explosion after explosion of spicy goodness each time the chop sticks carried this goodness to my mouth!  I didn't have any water and needed some but each time I gathered my composure to leave the table to get some water I found my self with my chopsticks back in my hand and shoveling more of these amazing, velvety noodles into my salivating mouth.We also tried the same thing but in a soup format, also damn tasty! Everything was right with these dishes. If I had to complain about anything at all, it would be that they gave us three napkins for four people eating these dishes.  I need at least three for myself, don't ask.Greta food and great ambiance sitting in the Citizen Market.
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: If you like thiccccc noods, then you must get some BANG BANG NOODLES a former pop-up that now has a permanent location in Citizen Public Market with open seating.The texture of freshly hand-pulled noodles is unbeatable. We tried the Dry Szechuan Garlic Noodles and Tingling Cumin Noodle Soup, which were both boasting delicious flavor. Don't forget to add the beef shank, which was well-cooked and tender.Full review and video on my Instagram @see_lim:instagram.com/reel/Cpe5j…
Address: 9355 Culver Blvd Ste J Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Love Hour burgers are to die for! I know Mike and he is a great host. Service is simple and tech savy. Ambiance is cooool
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I am baffled how this place has 5 stars. These people must be getting paid to leave these reviews. It isn't even comparable to the other smash burger spots in LA. The lack of customers was alarming -- my partner and I were the only ones rheee eating. There were two people at the bar drinking. If it's so amazing you think there would be customers?The burger meat was plain and the meat was of poor quality. And the patties were basically a glob of meat in the middle. Hugely chopped raw WHITE onions? Should be sautéed sweet onions. C'mon! The pickles were terrible. They were bitter and they don't use pickling cucumbers, just the regular with tough skins. Yuck! The love sauce was by far the worst tasting burger sauce I've ever had. The flavors were so off. And the ranch was just as bad. And they charge 75 cents for the tiniest cup of sauce and fill it halfway. Complete rip-off. Chris N Eddy's gives out unlimited sauces and their food is 10 million X better and half the price.The fries were decent and the onions rings were okay but way too much breading per onion and they were burnt.Needless to say, if you think this is the best smash burger in LA you clearly have not tried their competitors!
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Been on a hunt for the best smash burger in LA - I actually got to try love hour at Coachella this past year. It was worth the wait at Coachella so I wanted to take my boyfriend to try it.We ordered two double burgers with a side of cheese fries. The patty had the crispiest meat skirt and seasoned perfectly! What I like is that there is a bar next door so you can order a beer while you wait. Love hour is definitely on my top three favorite smash burgers in LA
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This is a really cool spot that gets lit and good vibes on certain nights where DJ's play music and there are other events. It is located in Ktown. Their smash burgers are mayo based and really good. The servers are always chill and friendly. One of my favorite smash burger spots in La.
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: this was one of, if not the best, burgers i've had! a delicious burger doesn't need a hundred toppings --  just the best quality patty, a fresh, soft bun and maybe some ketchup and mustard or homemade sauce and you're set. i had two burgers the day i first tried them, with a side of onion rings and HOMEMADE pickles. def on my top favs list!
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Amazing beef burgers, chickens sandwiches, sides and great service!  Parking wasn't too bad early on Saturday.
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I had these on a pop-up location - really amazing! The entire staff there was super involved in explaining what to order, etc. I had a burger with 4 patties and it was super filling. I will go here again for sure.
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Absolute best hamburger I've ever had. Friendly fast service and an extra slice of cheese! Would you like some grilled onions on that? No problem!Yum. Cannot wait to visit your brick and mortar location and get my SECOND one! Thank you.Great visit at Smorgasbord downtown as we discovered so many tasty treats. But LOVE HOUR WINS.Ate it all up before we could even sit down.
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I LOVE LOVE HOUR. Might get the logo tatted on my forehead, will be back with an update if I do.Ambiance? 90's hip-hop lovers paradise.Customer service? Chillest, most attentive staff I've encountered in a good min!BEST BURGERS EVER? Yes. Don't question my taste in burgers.Speaking of chill, as a native Los Angeleno, I'm used to mini &/or mega heatwaves; I went to Love Hour after work for a 'double' & was legit impressed with how cool it was while I was there, both metaphorically & literally. Shout out to their air conditioning that helped me cool down while I watched Game 2. We're just going to ignore the fact that the Lakers lost the game.Parking is tedious, it's Ktown, stop acting shocked, ya'll.Menu is impressive, lots of drink options, especially if you're into beer!I'm a firm believer in getting what you pay for. $10+ for a burger might be a bit much for some, but the quality, ambiance, & space to hang with friends - & even make a few more while there! - is well worth the price.
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This easily became my new favorite burger joint in the neighborhood. The potato bun was perfect and the pickles taste like they are made in house. The chicken nuggets remind me of McDonald's but more flavorful and juicy. The fries were perfect! I love that you can add different flavors to the fries. Their love sauce is so good! It's like a honey mustard style sauce. I wish they were open a little later but I do love that they have a little bar in the back. The served natural wine and beer. They were also playing the playoff NBA games which is a nice perk. The bartender was super sweet and let me try different wines before I made my choice. All of the wines that I tasted were really good and it was hard to make a decision. I can totally see myself becoming a regular here! I'm so happy to stumble upon this place!
Address: 532 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020
